ytxk_pTaISuyiLpQo1GZNA.text: I am addicted to this place. The pho, BBQ pork and salt and pepper catfish are all amazing.

arkaOW9laOkb-xlh3AjEYw.text: Great staff, awesome eat-in or take home experience.  Fish sauce to die for.  The best Vietnamese food in the Valley.

Rn7bVAmFnAJhnGCL7oMsyA.text: The food here is very authentic, fresh, and delicious. The soups are amazing. The prices are very reasonable. The staff is very friendly. The food is very practical for take-out. My favorite is the Soup no. 1 with shrimp (not on menu) and their spring rolls with BBQ pork. They are always busy but very efficient and hard-working.

JmIRqhU9g4OEWOpJNasuEA.text: This is the real deal, folks!  ----------------------------  Quite a few colleagues in my office have been afflicated with the cold bug lately, and as much as I tried to avoid it, I woke up this morning with some  scratchiness in the back of my throat.  Sure, there's Zicam and Cold-Eeze and Vitamin C pills and all that hoo-hah. But I knew there was another vital weapon as well - a good, hearty bowl of pho. It worked like gangbusters for me in San Francisco so why not in Phoenix?  And so I pondered the recommendation given to me by the helpful waiter at China Chili and headed to Da Vang.   Da Vang is located in a small, worn strip-mall (on 19th Ave just north of Campbell) completely consisting of Vietnamese businesses. And as I was parking, I saw two separate Asian families walking in, which was a good sign: I knew this was place was going to be different.   Once inside, you notice the place is extremely casual and is family-run. At least 6 relatives are behind the register/counter area being busy doing who knows what. Then you have all the Vietnamese patronage - which definitely has to count for something. And so I sat down and ordered the spring rolls, the pho tai (beef broth with noodles and medium-rare thinly-cut beef slices) and some hot tea.   The spring rolls came with the requisite fish sauce and tasted pretty good, but it was the bowl of pho which was the main attraction. Just looking at it you knew it was the real thing - not watered down to cater to the tastes of as large of a crowd as possible, but still great tasting in its own right. So in went the bean sprouts, the torn up basil leaves, and sliced chilis, and the squeezed lime juice. A little bit of chili sauce to taste and I was in noodle soup heaven. The beef was cooked just perfect, and the noodles were just the right consistency. I ate with chopsticks until there was nothing left to grab at, and switched to the soup spoon to savor the rest of the broth. Mmm...tasty.   Protein, carbs, and hot pepper - talk about a coldbuster in a bowl. Who needs Jamba Juice?  And another great thing? Besides the food being good and authentic? Dirt cheap! Spring rolls, pho, and tea together cost $6.75. And I was STUFFED by the end of my meal.  Sometimes you have to sift through a lot of coal to find a gem, and I'd liken Da Vang to this area of Phoenix, but what a find. I'll definitely be back. And again, my gratitude to China Chili guy, without whose recommendation I probably never would have sauntered in there in the first place.   Thumbs up.  ---------------------------------------  EDITED TO DOCK ONE STAR: I wrote the above review about 15 minutes after eating my meal. However, not long after that, I was sitting in the coffeehouse feeling like I was going to pass out. I felt that drugged, and realized it could only be one thing: MSG. LOTS of MSG.   Oh Da Vang, you really had a good thing going on - for one hour.

ybpiu87asVdzGrfo1QUpNA.text: Hole in the wall. Great pho. The BEST spring rolls ever (do yourself a favor and order 48B). Great Vietnamese food period. Don't expect most of the serving staff to speak English though. But the place is filled with tons of Vietnamese people.. Which I always take as a good sign. Ask for Hung. Best server ever :)

WY-MIzvkzFGy8MWhRoOs4A.text: This restaurant pleasantly surprised me. Not in the greatest location but once I stepped inside it immediately reminded me of my hometown in OC. The wait staff was pleasant and our food came quick. I got the Bun chai gio thit nuong (BBQ pork and eggroll with vermicelli noodles) and the Mr. got com tam thit nuong (BBQ pork with broken rice). Comfort food in the middle of the desert when I needed it most. Prices were decent and it satisfied my craving. 'Nough said!

Y9nIyTgD8drr4-7UfOeZGA.text: My boyfriend and I love this place! It's a bit of a hole in the wall, but these are always the best places anyway! We get #22 and a #50 to split. If you're a picky eater, probably not the place for you, but if you like Vietnamese, this is one of the best places in Phoenix.

YtYoho6XWpWhKW_WMl_saw.text: Amazing Food , everything I have tried is delicious, is a hole in the wall, but is hands down the best Vietnamese food I have ever had

8cjUwizES7HAktdJjwghRQ.text: Have you ever gone to a place and were so overwhelmed by the menu options that you ultimately just point to some random item and say "I want" and pray that they don't bring out a moose knuckle or a pot of Sanka? That was our first experience at Da Vang. We live in the neighborhood and I've been wanting to check this place out for the better part of a year, but we never got around to it. Until tonight, that is. Honestly, I can't tell you what I had (it was the #27) but I can tell you it was wonderful! Strikingly fresh vegetables, great meat; amazing! And we arrived 15 minutes before they were scheduled to close on this Monday evening. [Truth be told, we weren't the only ones going close to 8 p.m. At least half a dozen others were converging upon Da Vang as they were trying to close up shop, and all were allowed to order.]  Da Vang, now that I know you're my little jewel in the strip mall--and near a strip club, no less--I shall be seeing more of you and sampling all your bounties.

zoo5IjvOFVgaxvUePxJfTg.text: It was ok. There are better pho places in Phoenix like pho thanh or 43rd express. I thought I give it a try since the reviews gave it a good rating.  Nothing special here.

SQm2DFvZYQ8dn8jCbFeCcQ.text: I guess that I may have ordered the wrong thing, or than I'm just not into Vietnamese food. I want to be, but I am just not feeling the love. The place is clean, the service was great and everybody was very friendly. We ordered the spring rolls that were translucent and looked appetizing, but there was just no love for them. The beef soup was ok, but not memorable enough to order it again. The sandwiches looked great but I wanted to try the entrees.  I need to come back one day and go with someone that really knows Vietnamese food and knows what I like. This place gets stellar reviews so it has to be me. I give them 4 stars because the staff was very helpful and friendly, offered to take back the spring rolls and fry them and were patient with us. What was memorable, however, was their kick-ass desserts. They were great and I think we ordered 3. Banana with tapioca and coconut milk, white bean with sweet rice and coconut milk, and something with taro.  This place has to be one of the nest values in The Valley- inexpensive with great food (and desserts) extremely clean and with excellent service.  I'll be back.

uSATjA8-vqJqYSN5bkTlFQ.text: Is this the best Vietnamese food I've ever had? No, but for the price it's pretty decent without having to drive all the way to Chandler. Two bowls of pho and two orders of goi cuon for $15-16 is a steal. Very homely taste to the broth and finally a place where goi cuon is inexpensive (it's $2.50 for two pieces). The Vietnamese music in the background and the decent amount of Vietnamese people dining inside add to the authenticity of the place.   But beware of the shady area it's in. Located in a tiny strip mall in a not so great area of Phoenix, I would not feel comfortable driving a really nice car here. Or if you had to because it's your only form of transportation, then I'd recommend parking it in front of the restaurant where you can at least keep an eye on it through the windows while you're eating. Probably not the cleanest restaurant either but I'll keep coming back until I find a reason to not to lol.    When I have a craving for Vietnamese food I'll be back to have my fill until I can make it back home and eat some good food in San Jose.

A9kMius-x0K3lA7-U_WXCg.text: Woohoo is right!  This place is awesome.  If you are interested in great Vietnamese food try it out.  I will not lie, you will not be wowed by the level of service or the ambiance.  The food speaks for itself.  My wife and I have left each time with the cheapest lunch/dinner we have ever had and still were completely satisfied.  Everything on the menu is worth trying and comes to you fast and fresh.  The only draw back is no beer but hey plenty of that elsewhere.  To sum it up, no frills, great food, easy on the wallet.

faAIiXR8fu5U0p5cTY2dPg.text: I want to start off with that I am not that familiar with Vietnamese cuisine but I am absolutely willing to go back. I ordered the #39 which had been recommended by a number of people but I have to admit that when I tried it a good portion of the balls, sausage?, and fried rice tasted like seafood spam but the pork and the perfectly cooked rice were effing delicious. Like I said another try is in order so maybe will be a rating change.

V5akz8-b_vnuUckObXeGig.text: Had some delightful pork & shrimp eggrolls here....sooooo good that I ordered some more after the first order. However, the pork sandwich that I had was nasty, tons of fat & gristle, and it only covered 1/4 of the bread...was only $2.50, the chicken sandwich looked much better...oh well.   Food is super cheap here, just watch out for that pork.

UofTwIxaiF3wAP1c_h-ltA.text: This place is fantastic!  Every time I go I try something different.  The family who owns, cooks and serves at Da Vang are very attentive, give great advice on what to try and really work hard to make your experience a good one!  Love, Love Love!

TdnqQ53XPIrY5txONzwbSw.text: Guy took my order and forgot all about my soup. It took about 30mins until I raised my hand and he remember that he had forgotten my soup. Its only soup!

4QR1HMjRhLFwsXQDwWTgOA.text: The best place in Phoenix to get Vietnamese. The service is great, prices are fantastic, and the food is unforgettable. I would recommend the pork and rice. Very cheap but rich in flavor!

DqoHu6VxZuQNmTN3xNaUBQ.text: I love this place. This was the first place I ever had Pho, back in 1998. This place is always busy now. The prices are so cheap that It always keeps me coming back. The food is great and I always get their spring rolls.   I eat here about 2 times a week. The service here is not that great but the food makes up for it. I do have to say that since I come here so much the staff that is always there seems to know me and our order now. Service gets better when your a regular I guess.  Voted best spring rolls in Phoenix Magazine.

3nwEcNVwaKC2xfxtzOxqNw.text: Totally fun experience. Delicious,  great price, amazing portion sizes, fast service.  The desserts you can buy separately at the cashier are also delicious. Try the coconut milk and black bean dessert. Highly recommended.

BPU0n4Gmta4xjikLozfzDQ.text: I don't know quite where or when I discovered and fell in love with bone broth, spicy with fresh herbs, veggies, proteins and egg noodles! After dumplings, but not long after!  Da Vang is wonderful!  They have banh mi which are very tasty.  On our visit they brought extra appetizers that we hadn't ordered but gladly paid for...  Very friendly. Very tasty. Very reasonable.

FX5wDkCE0m_mv2QKWfVZ2w.text: We come here for lunch when we want some good Pho, or Vietnamese noodles. I've only had good experiences so far here. The people running the place are very friendly and they do a great job getting people seated, eating and out. They need to because it is usually very busy around lunch time. I'd highly suggest leaving a little early for lunch to try to beat the crowds. The parking lot is packed if you get there past noon. However, the food comes out hot and fast. The building is a little run down, but I don't fault them for it, it is what it is. The food quality is top notch and I'd recommend this place for sure. It is reasonably priced as well and delivers a high value for your dollar.

U7qK4kIVbAH5O1Jh50xw6Q.text: Pho is good and so are the egg rolls. I was not a fan of their spring rolls the first visit but the next few times I went they were good. I also tried A few other things on the menu and you really can't go wrong. Waaaaaay better customer service than Pho Thanh!

7Vknr7pw8hBHTtz_Xw3piQ.text: I've been going to this place since I was a kid with my family.  You really can't go wrong with anything you get here! Once a it's done dripping, mix it in the glass they give you THEN pour it over the ice.    The beef stew is so flavorful and it's one of my favorites. I also like adding extra vegetables to any soup that doesn't come with it. The veggies always have a nice crunch to them and taste fresh.   It's definitely worth a try!

8eBV8GDK9-sBs-QzswhRJg.text: I've only been there a couple times in the past but never wrote a review.  All I gotta say is this place is the real deal. The main reason I go to Vienamese restaurants is for the pho and this place is in-pho- gettable. See what I did there?...hehehe ;)

VpBUDx85NE3TafFzmAptOg.text: I just have to say that I was looking for a place that had good Banh Cuon and this place came up. Banh Cuon is one of my favorite Vietnamese dishes and it's not easy to make at home so I'm always on the look out for a good place to buy Banh Cuon. So far the best place for Banh Cuon is Banh Cuon Tay Ho in the Westminster area of Orange County CA. I was hoping to find something comparable in the Phoenix AZ area. I was really glad to see all the good reviews about this place. Even though the atmosphere left much to be desired (most Vietnamese restaurants do), I was still hoping for the food to make up for the location and decor. Unfortunately, I was disappointed with the Banh Cuon they served. It was not good. It wasn't fresh. The other dishes were jusokay. I would not come back.

171idxscOPgDVe0gdV4c2g.text: This place is amazing! It might not look amazing, and service isn't the best, but the food is amazing and extremely cheap! I got the 2a and it was enough Pho to fill me! I also got 50 which was also extremely amazing.

8Ng7N5C85eO8-2_ER0Ju4Q.text: A nice, large bowl of pho is my ultimate comfort food, so I was hoping that Da Vang would make me warm and happy. Although 1B was very large, the soup taste like pepper water and most of the bowl was just noodle with little meat. I would not get this dish again. I also did not like broth for number 7, which tasted like tomato water. The only component I enjoyed for both noodles soups was the soft tender beef in 7. The springs rolls were also only average, which average dipping sauce. And the banh mi were okay, with the best part being the baguette. The service at Da Vang was great despite it being very crowded during lunch time, but I will not being coming back for pho.

They have the best three color bean dessert. Pho is on point and my kids always devour the combination fried rice and egg rolls. EN2Y1KH8Xw5XpDkv7_YQ3g.text: We were convinced to eat here with some friends tonight. Ignoring my better judgement, big mistake!!! The service try's to accommodate a big group, but falls short. As I turned to look around the restaurant I noticed how filthy the blinds were, splattered with some kind of beverage. Oh and how could I forget the roach behind me on the wall. Now, I know a lot of restaurants have them, but the last thing you want to see is 1 while you are eating. Commmon!  Please don't invite me again!!!

QcWycQZL2A0Qr0h9hcWBuw.text: Love this place! I Come here 2-3 times a week.  Staff is super friendly, food is tasty, and you really get great portions at SUPER reasonable prices.  In fact, I'm going to order something right now! I usually get a number 1 which is a classic MEAT Pho.  The broth is to die for!! I normally don't add anything to the broth because it's rich in flavor.

OumXZTo6Sxyh-b1rHExvyQ.text: I've heard mix reactions from friends when it comes to Da Vang.  Some love it and some don't care for it.  I fall in the category of thinking it's the best pho in the valley.  I've tried other places around town, and there are some great ones, but Da Vang is the best of them.  Again, to me.   I can not be the only one as it's usually bustling with families and people getting their share of great Vietnamese cuisine.   Definitely recommend.

vN7j-DnffQ9ywS_DsYE3Lg.text: Some friends and I decided to come here and try Vietnamese food.  The restaurant isn't full of decorations or anything fancy, just straight-forward food that the local Vietnamese seem to like, as the restaurant was full.   We started off a bit confused, so our waiter (we told him it was our first time) really helped us along the way.  We started with a pork/shrimp spring roll appetizer that you make yourself.  He showed us how, and it was fun and delicious!  For our entrees, we decided to order a few different things, and each try them.  We got a beef/meatball pho, a stir-fry noodle dish with pork, chicken, squid, crab and many veggies and a banh mi with bbq pork (we ended up getting 2 of these, since they were only $2.50 each).  There was plenty of food to go around...the portions are huge!  Everything was really good. We debated on whether to try a dessert, so we asked our trusty waiter what he thought, and he brought us over 3 different ones.  They all had crushed ice and coconut milk/cream, but they had different items included...1 had clear noodles, 1 had various beans and the last one had bean paste and seaweed with noodles.  The funny thing is, we each tried a little of all of them, but we all favored different ones.  I personally enjoyed the one with garbanzo beans...who knew??? After we finished our meal, we went up to the cashier, to find out the entire bill came to $34!!  What???  Between the 3 of us, we ordered an appetizer, 4 entrees, 3 desserts and beverages...amazing! On the way out, we picked up the pork buns (not sure of the actual name for it) to take home and try.  They looked really interesting, so one of my friends bought them for us.  The cashier explained how to make it later, which turned out to be perfect.  I shared it with my husband at home, and he loved it! All in all, we had a great time, and can't say enough about how nice and helpful the staff were to us.  It was a great first experience!

wrX1A2vjA6YByROd_wHHBg.text: Everyone here is cool as heck, food good and price is super sheep lol.. Can't go wrong w/ this place. Don't expect the world for $5.00 this place is what it is.

EZQ70XGyLiv3qf4dW4v6NQ.text: Favorite place. Been coming here since I was 8. Delicious egg rolls and pho, and awesome broken rice dishes.

PvYwydqNLQ1X5mboF25YbQ.text: Love this place super cheap yet super good and for how much you pay you get a LOAD of food! Love their fried egg rolls and pho is so tasty! Their fried rice with braised chicken is the best!!!! Amazing

hrLHqZbuVIBSiYmgfge0jA.text: I have to give three stars because they are down the street from Pho Thanh and not as good. Their size of bowels for their soup is much smaller, their broth is not near as fresh tasting or seasoned. They also don't give you a lot of fresh herbs like Pho Than does. But, they are open on Tuesday's when Pho Tahn is closed. So if you are craving Pho Soup and it is a Tuesday, I would reccomend going here. But on any other day, I would go to Pho Than. If you disagree, I am sorry. But if you haven't tried both restaurants up the street from the other and you love Pho, I would deffinately go for the taste test on the 2!

I always order number 72 and the spring rolls, but I also try the variety of food on the menu and never feel disappointed. Service is friendly and the atmosphere is great. I will be a regular customer whenever I'm on this side of town

nswZcByszzHykxPtY-JMvw.text: I cannot believe this restaurant is rated lower than Pho Viet Nam in Chandler. The food here is so much better, and less expensive. The parking lot is on the smallish side a bit disorganized. The food is delicious, but on my visit they were sold out of the brisket and the BBQ pork.

I come here for the pho and coconut drink. This place is in Phoenix so don't be taken back by the location and the look of it. Go inside, the food will not disappoint, at least not for my taste buds

eQZNNXBdQmHxaGDRxjzajQ.text: My co-worker and I came here around noon for lunch even though the place was packed, they seated us within 10 minutes. The food is amazing, best I've had and the prices were very reasonable. This is definitely my new place to go for pho and vermicelli noodles!!! Oh and the spring rolls are cheap and delicious!!

g_yn1wVzN9og3WA--4NV_A.text: Cheap and good foods.  The foods tastes consistent every single times.  The restaurant itself is kind in a ghetto place but oh well...as long as I don't have to wear bullet proof vest.

ziF-7lKyJN-W0URqTzoytg.text: Been to Da Vang several times but first time to Yelp it. Chris H. Is right on target.  The food is True Vietnamese. When my companion and I get tired of the same Asian chain offerings we make the special trip from Ahwatukee and never regret it.   The atmosphere may not be comfortable for some but we dig it plus you can't be the prices, service and always with a smile!    Would give it 5 stars if it wasn't for 2 things... no vegetarian menu BUT just ask and they will make you a tasty noodle vegetable tofu dish and they close so early @8pm even on wkends!

O0yqWRO8HnEtQYCFRaVhnA.text: In order to submit a review I guess you have to at least click one star.  But I just want to specify that I think Da Vang deserves 0 stars.   I'm not sure why this establishment has a solid 4 star average.  I guess people like to eat water flavored pho and water flavored everything, basically.  I haven't had food from this place in years, but since our regular spot was closed, we came in here to get our fix.    After our meal, I remembered why I hadn't visited this place for a long time. The food sucks.  And I feel bad for everyone who thinks this place is awesome, cause you guys have sterile taste buds.

Z0co4FabQqtTP4QQ-DM8pg.text: Great Pho all the time, watch the lunch hour, super busy, but you might wait 15 min to be seated! Worth It!

CwPfxbWzjorjLqo3fP-_yA.text: Still have not found a better Pho place.  This place might look ghetto af on the outside and inside but honestly their pho is great.  Plus the price is also still the cheapest I've found in phoenix, 4.50 for a big bowl of pho!

yHMB4ABJqFhbA0ugeOO_IQ.text: The service is pretty standard for a cheap vietnamese restaurant - not particularly friendly.  If you can deal with that, the food is incredibly cheap and delicious. I order the ca kho to (carmelized catfish) - my boyfriend said this smelled and looked awful, but I love fish and this was really tasty. It was also like 2.5 meals worth for under $7.  My boyfriend ordered the veggie rice noodle dish - he wasn't a huge fan of the veggie mix (cabbage, onions, bok choy and carrots) but I thought it was really good. The gravy/sauce they stir try it in is really tasty.  Definitely will be back!

y278eoZVy6LrA92HedqdMw.text: This is an affordable place to get Vietnamese food. It isn't fancy, but at least it is clean. The staff are so busy at times that you'd better ask for what you need when they approach you. The bill is at the front, so this is on the honor system. I do recommend the Thai tea, I think everyone should try some. The Vietnamese coffee is strong enough to keep you up at night, so skip it if you're ordering after 3pm. I love the sandwiches, specifically the BBQ pork, which I believe to be the best on the sandwiches there. Pho, of course, that IS the mainstay. Highly recommended for foodies on a budget. Enjoy!

ZI_Mz9ALNXbUlAqWZfpS0Q.text: Best VIET noodle soup in PHX ---Pho Sure! My now estranged Love was sooo inspired by this place that he secretly texted his viet. Xgf that night to rekindle old memories.   Guess he was inspired by the cheap prices and the hole in the wall decor.

Sk7wD14p5Vns6UGcBBoQHQ.text: Amazing spring rolls and the pho is so darn good very good prices for amazing food! The service is great but best of all the price is low and great food

_C7F-47LrUFdW0FHmZWWEA.text: I like the pho here. The broth is really good! But the staff doesn't check on you if you need something. I even told the waiter that I'm ready to order. I was there before the another customer but the waiter took their order first.

U1TPVgjbbK0SHT_nUGnEcw.text: Alright, oh dang, Da Vang! By far the best and most affordable Pho joint in town. I would say its authentic, but I've never been to Vietnam. Great food -- even more amazing is the cost!  Please understand though, its the real deal. The restaurant is in a dimly lit strip mall that's easy to miss. Look for the water dispensary in the parking lot. When you walk in you'll probably notice its older and surprise, surprise full of Vietnamese!  Don't expect the ambience of the Rice Paper Eatery. At Da Vang you'll be greeted by Vietnamese, not hipsters.   My recommendation: Beef Pho, fried rice, and spring rolls.

LczqlM3jeFHgHnnIRcBU8g.text: Since my first visit I've been back here at least once a week for almost a whole year. Hung is very personable and I see him being relatable to guests and providing great customer service.    They've updated their menu and prices went up a teensy bit, but this place is WAY affordable and I enjoy keeping it local and supporting a nice family.  My man and I will continue to visit weekly.    Thanks Da Vang!  See you soon!

grrhmPA0p8Q-sokvW2ziAQ.text: My friend recommended this place to me saying " it's the best pho in town" so naturally I had to go try it out myself.  Upon arriving it was seated right away. I knew what I wanted already so I ordered. Not even 2 mins later I had my spring rolls, then 3 mins later I had my pho. Super fast service.  I Love Pho and I love to try it at all different places because it never seems to taste the same. I would have to say though this is not my favorite Bowl I have taste it. The broth seem to lack in flavor and seems a bit more oily than normal. At least compared to any other pho I've ever had. Spring rolls tasted great just like any other spring roll along with the peanut sauce. Overall, the service was great, it was super fast, and although the pho was a bit oily, it was still overall good. Probably wouldn't mind coming back to this location.

photos.caption: Photo of Da Vang Restaurant - Phoenix, AZ, United States
Photo of Da Vang Restaurant - Phoenix, AZ, United States
Photo of Da Vang Restaurant - Phoenix, AZ, United States

ZmUavTb6w7Kv1VWrtUeGgA.text: Highly recommend for authentic Vietnamese food. Went at lunchtime based on a recommendation from my Vietnamese friend. He had mentioned to go back for pho at dinner time when it's at its best because it cooks that much longer since 5 am when they start to make it. It was pretty darn good at noon.  They were busy but very efficient. Everything was incredibly yummy and fresh. Good prices too. I already have a lunch date set on the calendar with another friend so she can check out Da Vang.

0v8GqZYQ9yiNzTGkVGNvtQ.text: 3.5 stars   A good spot for Pho thats reasonably priced.  Only been there once and I likely be back to try some of the other menu options. The number 36 (bun cha gio thit nuong) was light, flavorful  and really good. Its a good recommendation if your not too hungry as it wont weigh you down.   The number 67 (cari ga) was a good chicken curry which i would prefer for dinner when really hungry.

photos.caption: Photo of Da Vang Restaurant - Phoenix, AZ, United States. #36 -bun cha gio thit nuong

TwTbB5Vc02WcETjk0VBHBA.text: This place has been updated. They added more space. The restaurant is clean and so are the bathrooms. The prices are modest. For a regular bowl of beef it is 5.95. The staff is usually fast at serving but on tuesdays and fridays it can be a bit packed. It is still a nice place.

78wBnyqXS07o5etH_UN7qA.text: This is a review based mainly of service.   If you care about food just stick to the rice dishes under Com Tam.   This is why I hate eating here in person:   1. If you don't speak Vietnamese some of the wait staff will be extremely rude to you in Viet. Like smile to your face and talk shit behind your back.   2. The have things on the menu but will tell you they ran out or that it takes too long to make. Why even have it on the menu? Maybe it's because I'm Vietnamese and he wants to be candid with me but still.   3. Their food isn't good enough for service to be this bad. Like I accept at most Asian restaurants service will take the back seat. But I only come back if the foods SO good I can overlook it.   TLDR Food is not good enough for the poor level of service. Eat here if you want them to make fun of you.

vGMsY6DizFD-3x3qGLxkjQ.text: I've been to several pho restaurants in Phoenix, and for the longest time, I could not find one that I liked. After noticing all the high ratings here, I decided to try it, and this is finally the pho that I like. Turns out, I didn't realize that DaVang's has been here for a long time, and my mom used to bring me here when I was little. I loved it then, and I love it now!  The prices are reasonable and the soups are so good. I can't put my finger on it, but when pho is done right, it is done right, and it is absolute heaven. Pho is one of my comfort foods, so coming here for spring rolls, pho, and maybe a dessert after a long day of work always makes my day instantly better. My friends have also been impressed with the quality of the food here when I bring them. The servers are always really nice to us. They never rush us out, even when we are indecisive about dessert and wind up spending a long time just sitting and chatting after our meal.

FGwNFCVOnWVqOTvAYZoypQ.text: A quick visit to crowded Da Vang for a Banh mi  (Vietnamese sandwich).  I got the chicken and hubby ordered the BBQ pork.  The food comes quickly and the Banh is nice and warm.  The baguette is soft and chewy. There's a little too much mayo for my liking but it was still yummy.  Good amount of meat.  Still good though.  Great service, no frills kind of place.  Cheap prices too.   (

photos.caption: Photo of Da Vang Restaurant - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Chicken Bánh mì

VFdvOcQ-Wq3CgpKB_HlxpQ.text: Truly one of my favorite Pho places in Phoenix. It's in a strip mall but don't be fooled by appearance, this Vietnamese restaurant is authentic and inexpensive. Very fresh ingredients and the broth cooks all day to get incredible flavor. Their whole menu is delicious!

photos.caption: Photo of Da Vang Restaurant - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Beef Pho - mmmmmm!

XZqDK1NHUoOFtmCR51YpMA.text: Bun is off the hook and so is their iced coffee. I love their spring rolls and the service. Broth and pho soups are great for any cold. Sandwiches are good except there is too much bread but we always manage to take it off. Great prices and food.

0YqGTpbS1fGEPKJ5jjRm9A.text: Great food. The owner is super nice and understood my parent's dietary restrictions. Has great pho, noodle soups, and Ban Mi sandwiches

ClGsi3HvdwQ5fnEMTrrPuw.text: The food here is pretty good but boy is the service terrible. Placed a phone order and was told that it would take 30 minutes. Great! I arrive at the restaurant 30 minutes later and was informed that my food wasn't ready. That happens. As I wait, people are walking in and getting seated. 5 minutes go by... 10 minutes go by... and the people who were seated after I walked in were getting served their food while I was still waiting for my pickup order! It took them an additional 30 minutes of me waiting at the restaurant to finally complete my order and hand it to me. Will not be coming back.

sdTn7kQLsPBRW8Bqdwdmqg.text: How have I missed this gem?  Fresh yummy platters of greens and leaves to add.  Fantastic!  Just wondering if they use MSG so I know if I can bring my bff here?

EMoc1GKAz40FVJgam9h5Qg.text: This is my new favorite place for Vietnamese pho. I was pleasantly surprised at the taste! I haven't had pho his good since I left Los Angeles 12 years ago!! Definitely will take my Vietnamese friends there with me next time as they are sure to be impressed!!...

PBxYrxgW5TjFPhUeyFaD1w.text: Love this place! Amazing Pho, the Vietnamese Noodle bows (cold) and combo fried rice are fantastic too!

o8zT439UjYT11Cu709TS-A.text: The prices were great. The food was simple and rich in flavor. Their Thai tea was delicious and they give you a big cup, unlike other Vietnamese restaurants that charge a lot and give a small cup. Other places put way too much ice in the cup and it gets watered down. I ordered chicken pho and it was delicious. The chicken was great and I definitely prefer their chicken over other places. I ordered to go and it was all packed very well that nothing spilled. My only complain was the sauce for the spring rolls. I requested the clear orange sauce instead of the peanut sauce and it was very watered down or something was wrong with it and the flavor was bad. I'm not sure if they just have a different recipe from the other Vietnamese restaurants but I couldn't eat it at all as it tasted awful. I couldn't eat the spring rolls neither. Part of it was my fault because I forgot that they had basil. I didn't request them without basil and it had some other weird thing that tasted different and I didn't like it at all. It looked like fish or some sort of meat but I thought it only contained shrimp as a meat. Next time I'll make sure to know all of the ingredients.   They were very friendly. Regardless, I am very picky but I will consider this place as one of my to go Vietnamese restaurants.

J4toNJjM_xSXpmdrQmXOmQ.text: Good prices, good food, friendly staff, small dining area so there can be a wait/line which can be a problem but that shouldn't effect the rating if you do decide to eat here. If you can't wait you can always order to go, great place for lunch and dinner my go to spot when I'm in Phoenix area looking for pho

ltO1pW4TigwEutkWpfKVcw.text: My sister has been buying spring rolls from this place for years (which I loved) but that's all we ever ordered. One day I was like ??? Why not try a bowl of beef pho and I can honestly say that this place made me reconsider my favorite pho spot. The pho comes in AMAZING portions and is reasonably priced! Love Da Vang and I will certainly keep coming here :)

3K9hjM8lb9QTfBd75zvJVw.text: By far my best restaurant to eat Pho, the place is always busy and sevice is fast. Great food!!

iYEdm1SWf0gqa1CFC-7fIg.text: Best pho restaurant in the valley... hands down! I almost called my parents in the middle of eating lunch to tell them they have been making pho wrong for the last 29 years I have been alive and they need to come out here and try it... they are from Vietnam, live in Southern California and make pho every weekend to basically feed the masses. I thought I died and went to heaven when I ate this pho (pho tai). I have never in my entire life finished a bowl of pho before because I was always "too full to finish". One of the seven deadly sins got me this day... as I committed the sin of gluttony and CRUSHED it! I went back the following week to get one to go and slurped away at my desk. Also, I would like to mention, this place reminds me of garden grove pho restaurants- super busy but friendly and the prices are DIRT cheap, how pho used to be.   I dream about this restaurant....

photos.caption: Photo of Da Vang Restaurant - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Pho tai- CRUSHED IT
Photo of Da Vang Restaurant - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Pho tai

3qGcAnFz4v5xg_ujKfzoWg.text: I started going for the Veggie Spring Rolls and now I am hooked! So inexpensive, filling and without a doubt the best hot sauce and Plum sauce to go with it. Once I am off this kick, I will have to try the Pho which all my friends state is the best in Phoenix. They answer the phone "hello again" and it really makes you feel warm inside. Only bad thing is there are always 1 or 2 beggers outside. I try to comply as much as I can, but it is real annoying after the 5th time.

0Clbf8-18FuF3QVFIcWkJQ.text: I'm a fan.  I love their seafood pho!  4 stars for the tasty food- although they could work on their customer service.

lfdMm_CqL0VxRCJjeFg_2w.text: This is a 30 year, 3rd generation staple in this community. It is always busy with a great family-friendly vibe and diverse clientele. I recommend the BBQ Pork Spring Rolls and 3A Pho. My brother has lived in Hanoi for four years and recommends this place highly.

g5dtn7aiQD-zH9HSFhX6Pw.text: This pho place has been in biz forever and I will try to eat here whenever I am in the West Phoenix area. Not only they had expanded to have ample sitting, the price  point was still under $6 for a bowl of noodle soups. It is a great value!  They are cleaner than how I used to remember them. A+.

qVUQfRAp0XGQqRbZWPLFOg.text: I have been consistently going to Da Vang for over a year now.  This review is long over due!  It is as authentic as it gets with Vietnamese food here in the valley.  The servers are polite and happily accommodate diet restrictions!   The prices are incredibly reasonable.  I can purchase a full nutritious meal here with less than what I would need for a fast food combo! That is a steal!  The place is large enough to accommodate their growing number of customers.     Now that's all fine and dandy but lets get to the good stuff! The food! Oh their food!! I think children are the worst critics when it comes to food and my little one just wipes the plate clean.  That says it all!  Its fresh, light yet filling and tasty!

eH1YNuRoMXBzv_0prj7iOg.text: Heard this place has the best pho. The egg roll was good, sweet but not too sweet and just enough filling. I had pho tai and my husband had the pho da vang. Now my husband normally adds more seasoning to his pho, hoisin sauce, and I was surprise to see his broth was just as it came out of the kitchen. The broth was definitely perfect, I added spice to mine but other then that the pho is excellent here.

photos.caption: Photo of Da Vang Restaurant - Phoenix, AZ, United States

UYfo7kach9Eyb9-1cpwY5w.text: Good place. It was packed with people at 1:30 in the afternoon.   Nice Pho. Needed more flavor. Some of the meat was not cut up properly and I got no meat balls.   Good service just let down a little.

AL9j1LuTMEgY9E5Z2vI8PQ.text: It's no Khai Hoan, but Da Vang has stellar service and decent food.  My date was a bit grossed out by the restroom, and the pho was a little too authentic for her.   It's really hard to put a vegetarian meal together here. All pho is beef based, and all the bun dishes have some sort of meat or fish.   The egg sandwiches are decent but not spectacular.

ySEKOuRrM4_X4bZsU7Cn5A.text: I am always raving about Da Vangs to anyone who asks me where to get genuine pho. The broth is clean, clear and savory. The Bahn mi sandwiches are ALWAYS delicious and the fried rice is phenomenal! Not to mention, the staff are efficient and polite. And the prices are insanely low for the quality of the food and the amount of food you get. I don't mind at all to drive all the way from Scottsdale to da vangs for their pho! I go at least twice a month!

photos.caption: Photo of Da Vang Restaurant - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Red pork Bahn mi and pho for two. Delicious!

pz9WG1WRxNtEenSSsHRkjA.text: The food at Da Vang was hot, fresh, quick, and super healthy. The prices were very reasonable for lunch and dinner. Staff was super helpful.

A9FeI99e8LRrwyObjWF9LQ.text: So amazing!! I drove by this place one day and decided to try!! Pho was awesome and I got sandwich and spring rolls oh yeah and hot tea!! I paid $12 will come back many times!! Next time I will bring my hubby

yCxF1HKE80eskcsQVS4lOw.text: The last time I had Vietnamese food this good it was served to me in San Francisco's little Saigon by a friendly couple that didn't speak English. The pate is real, the pho is traditional, and the shrimp and pork spring rolls hit all the right notes.  Do you self a a favor and spend the 15 dollars for a feast from this place.

wEFk41sHyb4viwOIcvwmKw.text: This is my favorite Vietnamese restaurant.  This is by far the most inexpensive yet most fantastic Vietnamese food.  I like the Pho soup stock.  It's the best.  We ordered spring rolls, extra large Pho, crepe, fried noodles, fish rice soup, pork chop plate and one dessert.  The entire bill was less than $35.  I'm very glad to drive 25 miles to come and eat here.  It's worth it.

photos.caption: Photo of Da Vang Restaurant - Phoenix, AZ, United States. A Caucasian teenager said if his mom serves this fish rice soup for breakfast he&#39;d eat breakfast everyday.
Photo of Da Vang Restaurant - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Pork chop plate
Photo of Da Vang Restaurant - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Extra large bowl of special Pho

OqB5zPI-KZT9hDS3WINR5g.text: Good location for a quick and fresh meal! The location could be more presentable, as well as the interior. Overall, it has still been a relatively expected experience. The food was good and fresh! It has been served fresh and with adequate silverware and sauces.  Liked it and would definitely come back for a quick, delicious and fresh mean, but not a meaningful dinner/meal with vendors, clients or friends and family. Good food tough!

aBXDdEe5jMorfL33f7OYwQ.text: No frills. Always packed with the locals. Alot cleaner than it used to be when I went there as a kid.  Nice to see people of all ethnic backgrounds enjoy some asian comfort foods. Cheap but definetly not for everyone or those of you that prefer chain restaurants.

hifjXJmqpGIH38UB_7Mgfg.text: Best Vietnamese food in the state! It might not look like much from the outside but don't let that deter you, the food here is authentic, super affordable and the size of the plates are big. I love reading the reviews by people complaining about the service, the food is great here because the restaurant is serving authentic Vietnamese food by staff and owners that reflect that country. They aren't being rude on purpose that is the culture and way they operate. You place your order and they drop off the food and that is it! If you need anything else you have get a waiters attention. People are so sensitive now that they let that get in the way of a cheap and delicious meal.

um8fmCyWQcVCzucln5dWsQ.text: OMG! Someone recommended this place so my friend tried it and she said that it was the bomb. When we went, prices were: sandwiches $3, regular Pho $5-6, large platter of egg noodle stir fry $7, and egg rolls 2/$3. Everything tasted authentic. I'm wondering though if the restaurant uses MSG. I know how to cook and can tell which seasonings  are used most of the time. I couldn't figure out which secret ingredient was used to make the food so good. However, I will definitely come back and try new things. It was quite a drive for my family, but it's totally worth it. Expect to wait a little to be seated as this place is packed with customers. Don't expect to be in an immaculate restaurant. This ain't Cheesecake Factory, but I'm sure you'll be surprised how cheap your bill would be when you pay at the register.

9EVYIvSeKW2Ro77lw3wIUg.text: Their pho is the best for an unbeatable price. Flavor is always spot-on, broth is so delicious. Spring rolls are really fresh. I placed a pickup order for 2 orders of pho with chicken and spring rolls. My only qualm was the way they tie off pick-up orders. Both the styrofoam cups of broth had torn at the top from being squashed into one bag and they had leaked quite a bit. I didn't sprint home or toss them around, just poor packing.

9bwSCWGIEiHUUkKS4eczYw.text: Friday night and the place was packed.  We had a UYE with about 15 people in the center of the restaurant.  The staff had their A game on and people and food were in constant movement.  I had a couple of rolls followed by a stir fry that was quite a generous portion.  I would have left out some of the ingredients but it was good.  We ended up under a couple of a/c vents and decided it may have been warmer outside, even in January (ok I stretched that a little but nobody took off their coats). Restaurant food can quite often be judged by what the diners chooses.  Based on what I ordered I prefer Da Vang to Pho Thanh.  Both places I ordered a similar stir fry and I was the only one who did.

bEumQFQIjrXAFWTdhK0JSQ.text: I've been here several times. Started coming since 2013. It definitely won't leave you dissapointed. The egg rolls are bomb, Flavorful and crunchy. The shrimp pho is my personal favorite. Always hits the spot. Spring rolls are fresh and yes they go perfect with the peanut sauce. The portion sizes are perfect. The price is just as great. Don't go at lunch time only because you won't find parking and the line is at the door.

bA4hP2vxjf8DtbizJovHVg.text: This looks like another hole in the wall but you can't afford NOT to eat here.  We finally went by after talking to a couple people who have been eating here for years.  The food is great, so many choices, the people are friendly, it is almost always packed and you can't even eat at a fast food restaurant for cheaper than this

3n0L7IJ1dT0OzaTHPXnWJA.text: Da Vang has awesome PHO.  Very cheap prices for great food.

I9lQC515NAdaNxbbOfVLqA.text: My first time here. Csme here because of yelp comments and I was not disappointed.  It's a no frills place located in a strip mall. It is clean and the service was fine. I got there a little before noon and shortly after noon there were no tables available. Lots of Asian folk eating there. Lots os choices on menu. I had one of the pho's and a couple spring rolls. Pho broth excellent and everything else was delicious, right down to the fresh sliced jalapenos. I will definitely go back.

3R4S-I7TiQG3xn_ucbPl0w.text: Very disappointed in my visit today. My boyfriend's food was served first, and mine didn't come out until he was completely finished. Then to add insult to injury, the portion was half the size as usual. I sent my food back and said I no longer wanted it. No apology or anything.  I'm used to my food coming out a couple minutes later because of what I order,  but for my dinner companion to be finished before I'm served is ridiculous.  Additionally,  there were no vegetables served with my dish. Just crazy bad today.

YK3qOFyDoqbZnryREolsDw.text: I am taking a star away because I made the mistake of ordering takeout on a Friday night. I had to wait half an hour for something that normally takes five minutes to prepare. I saw plenty of people get seated and served food while I waited. They apologized, and that's why Im changing my review to four stars instead of one.   This place is great, fast, and friendly for breakfast and lunch pho, but at night they lose control. The whole staff becomes disorganized and flustered very easily. Food's delicious, but I won't be coming in after 5 PM again.

bXgROy0OlgsZ0va21VaeDA.text: So here's the deal. Da Vang is a 5-star restaurant. Now, maybe not a AAA Destinations Monthly or Arizona Highways Magazine 5-star restaurant -- but a 5-star if you're a normal person who understands a pho restaurant in the Avenues is going to have some semblance of a pho restaurant in the Avenues.   Now, we visited Da Vang on a day we had a pho hankering and Pho Tan was closed. Here is the scoop -- both places are good; Da Vang is better. Especially for sit down because their staff provides much better service. It's as simple as that.  Else, about $20 for two orders of pho, two rolls, two drinks. Can not be beat.

VEC9E0ZLtTFwx7DYzPWB-g.text: The food, the prices and the service are really good.  Is not a fancy place but if you are looking for a good vietnamese place Da Vang is your place.

photos.caption: Photo of Da Vang Restaurant - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Inside of the place

meHGBTQevXKdT0CrkxFDAg.text: First time customers.  Excellent pho - many menu options.  Place was packed on a Thursday evening.  Two people ate for $17!  We will be back.

O_vcGn15o9s0RjedB0fsQA.text: Place is legit. Inexpensive, fast service and the Pho is amazing. You can get the extra large bowl if you desire. Best Pho around. Tucked away in a plaza south of Camelback north of Indian School. Enjoy.

photos.caption: Photo of Da Vang Restaurant - Phoenix, AZ, United States

CJc89JrEB78qO2AuRO4jUQ.text: Food is amazing too bad the costumer service doesn't compare it took over half an hour to get a fork and when you ask for something you need they just laugh at you

gW3Dsb6GNEtsWaEvYtUAeA.text: Love this place... Been to it twice. And have not been disappointed. Can't wait to go back. Prices are amazing & the quality is great.

photos.caption: Photo of Da Vang Restaurant - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Number 3a brisket pho so damn delicious!

R7ZM51SMgH0ffsrMySQcrg.text: 2nd time here First time was fine because it was busy and there were workers walking around However this time there are open tables and the service has gotten worse, as in when we walked in the host walked away bearly saying a word and practically threw the menues on the table and walked away. They took our order and were out of my gf's first choice. Then when the garneshes were brought they forgot the culantro (sp). Our water glasses were empty as i asked for the culantro (again sp), they brought a small plate of a few leves that was fine for me, and did not fill the water cups.  I have been going to pho restaurants for years in Hi and Az, this will be our last time dining here, or maybe 3rd times a charm if we do not find a better place

skIIXMULcvBudlfUMto6FA.text: Listen people... I've tried almost every Vietnamese restaurant in the PHX area and let me tell you Da Vang is by far the BEST. If you love Vietnamese food, then I urge you to try out this place. Your going to get authentic, affordable, amazing, delicious food here. You will not be disappointed!!!  The Pho, on point. The broth has this homemade taste that is made with love and care. It reminds me of the pho my mom use to make back at home.   Last but not least.. The rice plates. By far the best Com Thit Nuong I've ever had. Make sure you order an egg to take that rice plate to the next level.   I have wet dreams thinking about the food here. Enjoy!!

NzbsjxXQQ9VJbkzPcNkRaw.text: What are the best pho places in Arizona!! I was surprised how good this place was. You can't judge a book by its cover and same with this restaurant does it look like it's the greatest place but they sure prove you wrong. Also their soups are super cheap they start out at $4.25

VhumuEk42tR85ydlLL4AHA.text: Truly the best Pho in the valley, Been coming here 10 years. I also love the beef stew...

Svc_WqVrU_LVP67tBCiKgA.text: My first time here had rare beef tendon meatball all were very tender especially the meatballs, the broth was deep and tasty, noodles were cooked great, coffee was also very good, with a coffee for 9 bucks this is the best value I have come across so far, I'm a recovering pho-addict

kijw_ek9oB2eoGYeyQXqtQ.text: Love the food here,  when on this side of town this is the place to go. We have ordered everything here from all the pho's to the rice plates. Our go to dish is the egg crepe dish, Delicious!

photos.caption: Photo of Da Vang Restaurant - Phoenix, AZ, United States. The egg crepe at Da Vang, look at the fillings! Mmm....

edjWIdTDRt8BOMj5VUFVHQ.text: If you're looking for some authentic Vietnamese cuisine - give this place a shot! The people were friendly, the prices were great and the food was delicious! The ambiance is more like a cafeteria and it is easy to miss from the road. I will eat here again!

XAzAXIBIxFEYEe5sK2lFvw.text: Yum! Great pho! I feel like they give you more veggie & herb add-ins than usual. Some look like little trees. Anyway, delicious. We will be back. Oh, and super cheap. Two meals- under $11. Love.

ViSAf4lNwILRAbORKxZnlw.text: Definitely one of my favorite restaurants in Phoenix! Unbeatable for the price and consistently great food. I get the vermicelli and spring rolls every time.

LaXQiIevdjqbF-KTaNEwng.text: Delicious... being vietnamese we're a little particular when it comes to our selection of vietnamese restaurants.    Hubby had Bun Bo Hue.  Soup was flavorful and slightly spicy.  We did have to add some shrimp paste to it but it is understandable as shrimp paste is an acquired taste.  It is a requirement for True bun bo but we do live in America, not VN, so an adjustment is needed to feed the consensus.    I had Pho.  It was also very tasty and had lots of meat.  No skimping here.  Broth was clear and rich.  Definitely hit the spot.    Favorite oldest son had rice with pork chops.  He inhaled it.  It was apparently so good that he wouldn't share any with us.  Favorite daughter had spring rolls.  They were a good size and weren't stuffed with noodles to take up space.  The rolls had a good amount of meat and shrimp in them with an even balance of veggies.    Favorite youngest son had Bun Thit Nuong a noodle and pork dish (dry, not soupy).  He also inhaled his dish.  The fish sauce was also just right for him that he finished most of his sauce dish too...  We will definitely be back on our next trip to Phx

zDg7UB6q40OspjHjh38zLQ.text: It's that time of year for warm food and stuffed belly's. First day that it's cold in Phoenix and I automatically wanted Pho! It was my first time here and it was pretty good. There was nothing to complain about in regards to the taste of food. The wait staff were all also very nice. The best part about this place was it was sooo cheap and affordable! I ate pho and a vermacilli bowl both for $14! I'll be back again.

photos.caption: Photo of Da Vang Restaurant - Phoenix, AZ, United States

A-ZKVsop36kytsYUoyVtng.text: Always on search for PHO, and so far... this one is the best I've had in Phoenix. Typical Asian non descript looking front, but inside the food is amazing. Very homey, don't expect fancy decor. I came for lunch with a friend on a Monday at 12, plenty of tables available. Service was very attentive and fast.  I ordered a Thai hot Coffee while looking over the menu. I had number (48) Goi Cuon Tom: fresh spring rolls with shrimp and pork, (50) Cha Gio: fried spring rolls with shrimp and pork, (3D) Pho Tai Sach: Pho with sliced beef and tripe. All the pho dishes are served with fresh vegetables. The broth of pho was excellent, the amount of beef and tripe were great the most I've ever gotten in a restaurant. The appetizers were excellent.  Nothing fancy, but great Pho and very good service.

photos.caption: Photo of Da Vang Restaurant - Phoenix, AZ, United States. (3D) Pho Tai Sach: Pho with sliced beef and tripe (Undressed)
Photo of Da Vang Restaurant - Phoenix, AZ, United States. (48) Goi Cuon Tom: fresh spring rolls with shrimp and pork
Photo of Da Vang Restaurant - Phoenix, AZ, United States. (3D) Pho Tai Sach: Pho with sliced beef and tripe (dressed)

Y3t03ClFhpHv4qzCvoGqkw.text: Fresh and flavorful from the pork and shrimp egg rolls, the bbq pork banh mi sandwich and the DaVang house special pho is always good.  the Da Vang Fried Rice is awesome.   My favorite in Phoenix, you won't go wrong by checking this place out.

5hcfVkw1-hD3g1PsAZrQig.text: My son found this place with friends and he recommended it - and I was not at all disappointed. What a perfect, family-friendly restaurant. Terrific options and the best PHO is town.  I recommend this place - over the others - go there!  Get meatballs and brisket.

photos.caption: Photo of Da Vang Restaurant - Phoenix, AZ, United States

Ul1Lv1bHgsfn9N4KzFXf5w.text: THE WORST CUSTOMER SERVICE EVER. First time here and so disappointed. The lady who took orders was so RUDE. We stood up and went out right away. Excuse me, we pay what we eat, not eat for free. If she cannot be a server, so please don't!! I

VQGNX2I0Yxf4qSulTWVeqw.text: Authentic Vietnamese! Went here two nights in a row for dinner Togo and everything was delish. Pork is the True fatty pork and very flavorful. Pho was tasty. They were kind enough to cut up the meat and noodles for me as I was taking pho to my sick father. Not many viet places have banh ceo but they did, along with four pages of other choices. Pricing was VERY reasonable and didn't skimp on quality.  First night we got soup, spring rolls, and two vermicelli dishes and our total was $21.  The second night I did a rice combo plate (sooo food!) three vermicelli dishes, banh Xeo and total was a little over $30.  Service was okay but oh man they were packed. It was a full house both nights and the to go line was to the door

photos.caption: Photo of Da Vang Restaurant - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Rice combo plate. Little bit of everything. So yum

EV0zd0RgX3H8ajAixTa1_g.text: I've visited many Vietnamese restaurants and this place is best because taste and price are in sync!  Very busy and lots of Vietnamese customers who are regulars, always a sign of good ethnic food establishment.

sRwt_011oI7aIVAsYwbkkQ.text: This place is one of the original pho places I stray to. Big portion sizes and relatively cheap. Definitely a place to check out if you never had pho. I'd recommend going during the week, they can be pretty busy on the weekend

kgoyV5tyk2Bd5dT4m7Ne3g.text: Da Vang never disappoints. Found this gem from my best friend and have been a regular customer. There are a great deal of selection of authentic Vietnamese dishes. Everything is good whatever you order. In my opinion, Da Vang has the best Vietnamese in the valley. Not only their food taste delicious, their portion is also generous and the prices are very affordable. Service is also great and quick.

okbbrlnLo6RrQEfb56vqVg.text: Best  food love the pho the egg rolls we eat here often  I love the #75 for a quick cheap snack only thing they can improve is the Thai tea taste like the stuff from a carton at the Asian stores

hFrR6gJRSjwAUzIMlhw8cA.text: My friend and I visited this restaurant on 01/01/2019 in the afternoon. We both had the same thing, which was an everything pho bowl. We BOTH came down with food poisoning. Check your shit, DaVang!!!

XZHFdumVIldOISKtp83OPQ.text: The Pho here are pretty good. The broth is tasty and the noodles have a good texture. They do not have consistent good bowls though. I have been coming here since I was a kid and will keep going here because the price here beats out all other Pho places. The soup makes you want to throw rice at yourself and scream in joy. Get the 3d.  J out.

nLV5t4TDhP6ru2nf_bUHRQ.text: Best Pho in town. I always get the chicken pho, so good. Everything is so fresh and traditional.

RtpcNuI8dC3WelmQuHpGfQ.text: Da Vang hands down is my family's go to pho place. I grew up eating here. Authenticity at its finest!

HXeRPUchs7GYUyi4DnjO_g.text: Came on Friday night around 6pm. It was pretty busy but not packed. The food, however, took pho-rever to arrive (had to wait about 30 minutes!!!). I think it's pretty ridiculous for a pho place. The food was a-ok. An Asian crepe was decent but with a puddle of grease on the plate bottom. Seafood pho was nothing I'd expect..and the broth was red which I never seen before. The pho garnish plate was serving lettuce instead of Thai basil.  Not too bad but nope, I'd not recommend, neither would come back

XddxbpZST2Evf_LLKsxoJg.text: Cheap, legit Vietnamese food - it doesn't get better than this!  I've been here three times now, and every time we come it's packed.  I still haven't figured out what I'm ordering, but I usually pick something random off the bun (boon? still not sure how to pronounce it) menu and then get some spring rolls and Vietnamese coffee on the side.  I've been with people who got the pho, which comes in a huge bowl accompanied by all sorts of leafy greens.  Great place to bring out-of-town guests for something different... and great place to just grab a huge bowl of cheap delicious food.

bdnderYJMS-iG1JOQQKFuA.text: Yooooo this place was fuckin fire bruhhhh if you go get that number 66 that spicy lemongrass chicken and a thia tea....omg.... Do your self a favor MF this wasn't just the bee's knees it was elbows wrist ankles all that good stuff.....

eKdTFCvCzm-aaXVqIkUiSA.text: I ended up here via Phx Newstimes suggestion. I ordered Togo. It's weird to me inside. I get the clean and stark appeal of restaurants but it cld have been warmer inside. More inviting and less institutional looking. At any rate, I ordered the fresh spring rolls, grilled pork and egg roll rice  vermicelli with combination fried rice.  The fried rice was awful. It incl what appeared to be cut up hot dog. That's nocando for me. The spring rolls were actually the best I've  had in a while. I loved the dipping sauce. It wasn't the traditional peanut and I really liked it. The rice vermicelli salad was really lame. No flavor. The grilled pork was even weirder than the hot dog in the fried rice. Suprisingly the egg rolls chopped on top were great! I will keep that in mind. The vermicelli needed more mint. I appreciate the person who bagged the order incl everything wo having to ask. I'm impressed with that. Even the garlic chili sauce! I ordered the same items from three different vietnamese places listed in the Phx Newstimes on Twitter. This place came in third behind my regular, a new place also in PhxNt. I don't know if I will be back.

26GrL9KFnuiUtDj_gIWRZA.text: We have heard good things about this place and finally made it.  We ordered regular pho and spring rolls. Our meal came in 5 minutes and we finished the whole thing within 30 minutes because it was so good.  It's good portion with fresh ingredients. We both think it's the best pho we have ever had. Wish we lived in Phoenix!  The restaurant is clean and bright. Much better than I expected. A lot of locals came here and hang out.

photos.caption: Photo of Da Vang Restaurant - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Two #1 pho plus #48 spring rolls and coconut water! Only $19!

6tOg0k4xvSLuPUB3Zulv-w.text: This is the very best (and inexpensive) Vietnamese food you can get in Phoenix. I cannot convey how flavorful and wonderful and fresh the food is. Don't know what you want? No problem! Just point randomly at the menu and order something.  Service: A little on the slow side, but the food is so good that I don't care. That's a very high compliment from me, because I'm NOT forgiving.  Ambiance: None. This place is a dump, and I don't care: This IS Phoenix, so we're all trash anyway! (Especially YOU, Scottsdale snobs, I KNOW who you are! lol) The fluorescent lighting is lurid and harsh on the eyes. No music playing. It's a miracle that the sagging ceiling didn't fall upon our heads. This restaurant is literally on its last legs. Very much in need of a remodel and a makeover.   So, put on your dirty soiled wife beater, and your flip flops, and you're set. Da Vang is devine!

IPNcSJKBPS4ClPO2wQvMOg.text: Authentic, delicious Vietnamese food. All staff are nice, food is always great. Our good friend brought us here and now we can't stop from coming back! I often order 37, a great vermicelli bowl.

s_znZfN86nzdtyKsKNgqUg.text: Nammer pride I love this restaurant. Ever since moving away I've missed and craved Da Vang nearly every few days. They cook just like my mom cooks and the staffs have become like family to me because I was a very frequent customer.   I recommend everything here especially their pho bo kho and com tam or broken rice dishes. Everything is authentic and is packed with a lot of meat and flavors that just burst in your mouth every spoonful.I am not a person who tends to order desserts, but when I come here I always get their che and a drink. This is definately a great place for a full rounded meal.   Even on a scorching hot summer day a piping hot bowl of pho is still on my mind; only from Da Vang. Thank you guys.

3U06bxFi_7Jb2ZqrB3bgrQ.text: Great place and awesome price!  I order the BBQ pork and vermicelli noodles and the BBQ pork spring rolls ...it was awesome!!!  Our bill was under $20 even with tip!  This place will be on our lunch outting rotation!!!  :~)

3kOLck3ShtW24CE7I7Y52g.text: Moved from a place with decent pho (Denver) to a place with very non-decent pho (Santa Fe). So on any of our travels to big cities we try to get our pho fix. Decided to try this place. Was very pleased that we did. I always get pho with beef and tendon. Broth was tasty and clear. Beef port small but lots of tendon. I love when places serve culantro with their fresh herbs and this place is one of the few that I've found that do. Herbs were fresh. The service is impersonal but fast and efficient. Place was packed on a Sunday at 1:00 pm but no wait and good was brought out promptly. Would return for sure.

vI5nRmRORL82YRJDWgbQTA.text: The hubby and I come here once a month for my pho cravings, his fried rice, and the egg rolls. It is located in a seedy looking location but we don't mind since the food is good and affordable. Avoid coming here during prime time (lunch and dinner) because service is very slow even though there seems to be a lot of people working at those times.

photos.caption: Photo of Da Vang Restaurant - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Pho tai
Photo of Da Vang Restaurant - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Com chiên and 2 fried eggs
Photo of Da Vang Restaurant - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Cha gio

fQNVTnoWEWBl1AgUb41wPg.text: I don't know how this place can keep their prices so low!!!!!! I mean my boyfriend and I stuff our faces for under 20$ with a tip!!! My boyfriend is Vietnamese so we both know good Vietnamese food and this place is very good, especially for the rock bottom prices. My fave thing on the menu is banh xeo and its 4.50$! I can't even with that price! Most places will charge at least 9.99 for that dish, but not da vang! Worth the drive from anywhere in the valley! We come at least once a month from north Scottsdale. Never disappointed

JOL11vrpsxkYOU2KQFYqNQ.text: After years of being a regular, on two different occasions I have found hairs in my food. On one of the two occasion I found a hair in my spring roll and the other one in my pho. That was the last time I decided to go back. I've also seen the older workers cutting their toe nails in there. It is pretty dirty and there is other pho places for about the same price that look cleaner than this place. Don't get me wrong the food was good, and the prices are pretty low but the customer service and the lack of cleanliness keep me from coming back.

kkD44iv3qdwjg2DzKPQXXA.text: Tried Da Vang on Saturday night because of all the great reviews and to treat an out of town guest to  Vietnamese cuisine.  I will start with the service.  3 people--3 entrees ordered.  The Pho came out 25 minutes after ordering,  the next dish came 25 minutes after the PHO and the third dish.....well..... we wondered about since it was NOT arriving.  We actually thought they had forgotten about the third dish. Embarrassingly, the third dish was for the out of town guest who wanted to try Vietnamese food.  So to sum it up, the service gets rounded up to  "zero" stars.  How can you serve 3 entrees in the course of an hour and 20 minutes to the same table and have each customer eating their food alone while the others watch?  It is called "dining"  not eating because the act is part of a larger social experience.  If I wanted to "eat" I would have bought a gyro and eaten it in my car.  So, definitely a big zero for service. Now for the food.  The chicken PHO was mediocre at best.  Hubby said that on a scale of 1-10, it was a 4.  He named 6 other vietnamese restaurants who do it better including the PHO place in the Gila River Casino in Chandler.  Really Da Vang?  You allow yourself to be beat out on PHO by a casino food court outfit?  Shame on you. Pho's should be your go-to dish!   Next: Stir fried noodles with pork & shrimp.  Way below par.  Had to add Siracha sauce, soy sauce, fish sauce to get any taste out of it.  And the pork  appeared to be scraps of pork (not pieces) cut lengthwise and very thin; and by the way Da Vang, thanks for the 3 small (and I mean small) shrimp you added to the dish.  Never, never, never, never, EVER---that's what my stomach is saying about me even thinking about ordering this dish EVER again.  Next: Sauteed beef with lemongrass over rice.  This was the definite winner of the three with a score of 5 out of ten.  The beef was not trimmed and fat prevailed.  Now, I know that fat is where it's at in terms of flavor but enough is enough.  Again, fish sauce and soy sauce had to be added to make it palatable.  AND FINALLY: The spring rolls ordered with Tofu instead of shrimp and pork were good and a good value.  Other than that... Not too much to be said for Da Vang.  Between the service and the less than stellar food,  I won't be there any time soon.....  Wait......wait....., wait a minute, I hear something.........  It's my stomach ....saying NO WAY JOSE....   I guess I won't  be going back ever again.  Stomach rules!!!!!!!!

eodp1R4PjfYi2Oyv2x3vWg.text: I am so upset!!!! :(  Idk if I should be angry at myself or them but I went in and did takeout of their Pho Da Vang and when I finally got to my desk to eat it, the meat was completely raw ! I tried calling them to ask them if I was supposed to request cooked meat and he thought I was ordering a bowl of Pho. Guess I'm skipping lunch today.

tCuZyhEtvddst9X_J7xwHQ.text: This place is awesome!  My family and I come here all the time.  We've never had a bad experience, even when it's busy.  The bbq spring rolls are awesome.  Especially with a little sriracha.  The workers aren't rude, they just stay busy.  I will continue to come here again and again.

PnXP9s3bM99evlpNuoBqIA.text: Was seated right away and it took someone 15 mins to come to us after waving someone down a couple of times. After taking our order, 30 mins had passed by and finally when my brother went up to the cashier to ask how much longer we would have to wait to get our food, She looked at my brother and rudely said that she lost our receipt.... At least apologize.... Used to come here every week but never again because of that lady...

tBdlWQh5sIXo5N0yvFuy6Q.text: I was expecting a lot out of Date Vang because of its constant comparison to Pho Tahn. However those assumtions were incorrect in every category. Go to both places and you'll know why. From the quality of the noodles and chicken, to the flavor of the broth. Take your hunger there instead. 3 stars.

CAviDux5QedgKq9hIxzlzQ.text: Pho-yuck this place!   I was tricked in to going here with promises of great Vietnamese. I was ready for a culinary adventure and what I got was a ride in the fright house.   The Banh xeo was so greasy I couldn't eat it, it was literally served on a plate of grease.   The bun was about the same. It lacked flavor, the rice noodles were slimy, the spring roll was loaded with grease.   I ordered some sort of plum soda drink and it had a cup of salt on the bottom of the glass.  The service was horrible and I will not be back.

dZsB0mJzwLk54NyTQksv7w.text: DaVang is DANG GOOD! My go to place for pho. We eat here or get take out about once a week even in the summer heat. We regularly get either the beef or vegetable pho (always a robust selection of fresh veggies) and the barbecue pork roles. We used to be patrons of Pho Thanh but the staff at DaVang are way friendlier and are always happy to see you. They're A+!

zBqkWm9bbfWF1IWhBkq_3g.text: Good, but I've had better pho elsewhere in the valley. First of all, order the spring rolls. They were fantastic and huge. Pretty sure I could have made a meal out of just those, especially since they were cheap. The pho was good, but I've had better elsewhere. It had good flavor and lots of ingredients, it just lacked...something. They get one extra star for the price though- a dollar or two cheaper than I'm used to paying for similar food. Service was fantastic even for our large table on a busy night.

xnTORWMKDuMDThMPdeJLGw.text: Food: Amazing period. I come here like twice a week. No matter what you get you'll love it. I normally just end up always getting 1B which is the extra large Pho.   Price: 1B is only like $7.50. Can't beat that at all.

9pKxIBmReDO7IbbTbQWbfg.text: Da Vang is so good. I eat Pho once a week and because this one is a little to far from my house I only get to go here once a month. Hands down my favorite place for BBQ pork spring rolls and steak Pho. It's always crowded and the atmosphere is nothing to write home about but the food is amazing.

DpyKejyIjgqKQ7dvxlXA9A.text: Ordered the pho da vang which was good. I have never had pho to go and this came with the meat uncooked. Apparently your supposed to put it in the broth and cook. It did cook the meat but the broth still did not seem warm enough in order to cook it fully. The prices were great, pho and a can of coke was about 7.50 or so. I had limited contact with the employees as I got the order to go but they spoke English well and seemed friendly. The worst part was the location, as others have mentioned, is not the best. It is a little hole in the wall in a strip mall. There are known tweekers in this area and I had one approach me while leaving claiming he was Clark Kent. I would return here but might eat in next time due to the uncooked meat.

B5Nx94C7qZga67oF04O1VA.text: This place seem authentic. This is a good thing. I am not saying that you walk in and believe you wormholed yourself to little Saigon, but authentic enough to believe that what they create in their kitchen is what you could get served in the most Vietnamese establishment the Americas has to offer. Like someone said "Pho is what happens when former child soldiers pour hot rainwater over fish nightmares" and I was dying to try it.   And as much as I did enjoy the freshness of it, I must say that it didn't impress me the way I expected it to. In retrospective I am not sure what I possibly could have expected, having had extensive culinary adventures in Asia. I will have to come to terms on my feeling regarding Pho somewhere down the road.   I did taste a sandwich here as well, and that was surprisingly tasty. I wouldn't come here just for the sandwich, but if I find myself here again I am quite certain that I will sample more of their menu. All this being directed to the food, I must say as far as service at atmosphere goes - there isn't much of either. But as long as one comes for a particular item I am sure that this place will please food-wise, not experience-wise.

TiRFHGYUpFuTWnPHaaeLsQ.text: Had a better visit today with my daughter. We arrived for lunch around 1:00 PM and it was 3/4 full, showing that Da Vang is popular.   We were seated promptly with menus and ice water arriving shortly. Drink orders were taken and the extensive menu perused. My daughter ordered her usual: Pho with brisket and Spring Rolls with BBQ pork. I ordered the Noodles with shrimp, crab and fish meatball (#29).   My daughter dove into her Pho with abandon. I've had it before and, to me, the broth was bland.  She said it was fine but added hoisin, chili paste, Thai basil and bean sprouts so it seemed blase to me. The spring rolls were excellent. Very plump, colorful, crunchy vegetables and fresh.   My dish was good and I would order it again. There was just the right amount of Bok Choi to make it a good accompaniment, the noodles were soft but not mushy and there was plenty of tasty protein.   I really wanted some sort of fried noodle dish, similar to Thai Pad Thai or Chinese Chow Mien but the service was still a bit lacking and didn't offer much help so I got #29.

photos.caption: Photo of Da Vang Restaurant - Phoenix, AZ, United States. #29 with a good mix of seafood, veggies and noodles.

aSZLTvELo2C44CrdB6Qiwg.text: Love the Pho and homemade macaroons! I've only ordered pick up, food is delicious, price is good and to the service is speedy.

YEm1s1726-Kbxxbdc5xNmw.text: This is definitely a step down from PHO Than just up the street. A step down in flavor and quality, but not in price. If you can pick between the two, PHO Than wins my vote every time.

2dzbLHkAjv5rcMbeLClSnw.text: Best Pho in the valley! I've been here many times and thought it's about time I write a review. Every time I eat at Da Vang's the food is on point. Highly recommend to all who actually want authentic Pho. I was introduced to this restaurant by Vietnamese friends and their parents only eat here because of the authenticity. Btw, don't come here if you want great customer service. It's all about the great food!

2RGBQY8uJK_a6-dhltKWOA.text: Best pho place I've been to yet! We read other reviews and decided it would be a great place to try. We walked in on a Sunday afternoon and it was packed! Always a good sign! All of the food we got was delicious and would definitely go back!

lEQjJob6zGhcNwkYqz2bZQ.text: The best Vietnamese food I've had in AZ. The taste of their broth is rich and delicious and their prices are super cheap compared to somewhere like PT noodles. Outstanding stuff, Da Vang, keep it up!

qMOgTg3Ov8JIai7sWbXcSQ.text: Love this place! Great service,food is good at a great price! I've been eating here for years, they are working on fixing up the place. Every time I walk in I always get greeted,every one that works there is nice and friendly! I've never had any problems with my orders or any workers.

G4r0XoZoPPLIu5bvavXCPA.text: JD Invades AZ Day 3:  I know what you all are thinking: you flew over 600-miles just to eat Pho? Well ordinarily you're right--I would never go to AZ to eat Pho in 90-degree heat, especially since we have World Class Pho back home in San Jose. However, my good Yelp bud, Laz C, had never had Pho before and as the unofficial Pho-King of Yelp, it was my duty--nay! Privilege to take his Pho-Cherry away. So, we did our research and Da Vang (DV) was the most convenient Pho spot to Laz's work. So we hooked up on a sunny and warm Phoenix Spring Day. Here are our chronicles:  48: Goi Cuon Tom Thit (Spring Rolls)- I was not too impressed with DV's Spring Rolls; the Rice Paper was too thick and sticky and the spring rolls themselves weren't as fresh as I'm used to. Also, instead of Peanut Sauce they served them up with a cup of Hoisin Sauce sprinkled with Peanuts. I'm not sure if that's customary in certain types of Vietnam, or what, but that's not the way we roll in SJ. 2.5*  1B: Pho Da Vang Xe Lua (Pho sliced beef, brisket, tendon, tripe, and beef meatballs):   Broth- I was surprised how good DV's broth was because, to be honest, I was expecting some fake wanna-be Pho out here in the Desert where most people don't know any better. It didn't have some of the nice subtle complexity that Pho broth can have, but the beefy flavor was on point. 3.75*  Noodles- Standard Pho noodles and they hook you up pretty good with the amount. Now, if they had fresh noodles I would've been way impressed, but alas you can't get everything. 3*  Meat- The meat was pretty good, but they weren't very generous with it. I was too engrossed in our conversation to remember to order the steak raw on the side-- Pho-Jester is more like it. 3*  44: Com Ga Nuong (Steamed Rice with BBQ Chicken)- I ordered this for my 3-year-old and was surprised he ate the tomatoes and most of the chicken.
