He's pretty picky so I'll have to rate it based on his discerning palate. 4* (Lance rating)  Service & Ambiance- Pretty standard Pho service in that you get the minimum number of visits to your table, but at least they were friendly and didn't grunt at us. DV is located in a pretty suspect Phoenix neighborhood; I wasn't 100% sure, but Laz confirmed it as I guess he used to live close by once upon a time. With that being said, it wasn't super-ghetto, but ghetto enough to add to the charm. 3.5*-service/4*-ambiance  Value- I was surprised how cheap the Pho prices are here compared to SJ; where a bowl of Pho is averaging around $8, DV's average price is around $5. Great value for what it is. 5*  I'd like to thank Laz again for letting me be his guide into the world of Pho and for being a fantastic dining companion. As for DV, I'd say they deserve an overall 3.5-star but I'll give them the 4-star bump because I was pleasantly surprised for AZ and they have a tremendous value.

photos.caption: Photo of Da Vang Restaurant - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Chopsticks
Photo of Da Vang Restaurant - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Grubbing like a boss
Photo of Da Vang Restaurant - Phoenix, AZ, United States. #44: Com Ga Nuong (Steamed Rice w/BBQ Chicken) - $4.95 (trains are extra!)

ncrbPp2Wc0ljicFea74K9Q.text: Awesome! I usually go to Pho Than down the street but they are closed Friday and Tuesday so came here. Had the #50 and #39. Both were amazing.  They are open 7 days a week too so that is also a plus. Legit Vietnamese food at inexpensive prices. Don't waste your money on mediocre, over priced food in other parts of town. Make the trip for the Truth.

Kc6kk-0ht441eQZDJflltA.text: Have been here on a few occasions.  Really like how cheap this place is, and the food tastes great.  But every time I order a banh mi sandwich (a steal at $3!) it always takes them forever.  Aren't sandwiches supposed to be one of the quickest things to make?!?!?! Out of 2 orders of rolls, 3 bowls of pho, and 2 stir fried noodle dishes, the banh mi came out 10-15 after everything else, and we had to inquire twice about it!   The first time I came here and ordered a banh mi to go, at the end of our meal, we had to wait around another 20 min just to get it.  Maybe they don't like making these things??  Otherwise, food is tasty.  Service is decent.  Prices spot on.

1QZAI4FlakiPbo_ih4YpCw.text: Wonderful service here! The staff was so friendly and helpful with us since we had never tried Vietnamese food. Pho was so tasty and their other noodle soups are awesome too.

PgqIKfNk3Vodocl_OmvSjA.text: Searched for Pho from Downtown Phoenix and actually found a different spot. Checked the hours and drove over to find out that they were closed! Searched again and found Da Vang was only 3 more minutes away. In a little shady section of town but dont be afraid!!!  Located in a strip plaza, plenty of parking.  Everyone is friendly...most speak enough english. The Pho is Pho-nomenal!!! Super yummy broth, very authentic. Regular or large sizes and so much variety to pick from.  The pricing is just ridiculously cheap. $4.75 for an amazing bowl of Pho Tai!  Spring and Summer Rolls are very fresh and come with lettuce and dipping sauces.  Less than $3.50 each.   The best surprise are the Banh Mi Sandwiches for $3 a piece.  I always take one home to eat later cause I cant finish everything I order while I'm there.  The food is great, atmosphere is ...well...authentically vietnamese and they do have a working bathroom lol.  Great meal and friendly staff with the cheapest prices.  Been back about 4 times.  You cant go wrong with your order!

DoZ3Nim5uBpraWukqeO-cg.text: Maybe I went on an off day- or ordered the wrong thing but my vermicelli with BBQ pork, vegetables, and egg roll were just ok. The BBQ pork and egg roll had some good flavor but the noodles and vegetables were lack luster. Service was fine for a typical hole in the wall place. My sister and her husband love it here so I'll definitely give it a try and order something different next time.

photos.caption: Photo of Da Vang Restaurant - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Vietnamese coffee
Photo of Da Vang Restaurant - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Spring roll appetizer
Photo of Da Vang Restaurant - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Pork, egg roll, vermicelli. Served with fish sauce

ekHl2wGCv7OCiSabczXfYQ.text: Da Vang! You mean "Da Best" I mean that didn't rhyme but what can I say I'm not a rapper!  Da Vang is a vietnamese restaurant, located on Camelback where most of the undiscovered restaurants are located at. It's definitely family owned and It really isn't trying to be anything else but that! I mean when you think authentic, you think of the food tasting and looking exactly of how they would cook if it were at home, or a friends house. And thats what Da Vang brings to the table, it brings you delicious house made broths and tasty pastries and treats. Everything was made to order cause the food was pipping hot and definitely fresh made. Everyone who has been here will recall the pasty yellow walls and cheesy asian decor, and somewhat okay customer service, but the staff here is genuinely kind, all you need is patience. But I mean it's definitely not the glitz and glam of what you assume an pho restaurant is, the culture, the food and the awesome people around you is what makes the experience even better. So feeling soupy? Did you drink too much the following day? Well get yourself up and come to Da Vang! You won't regret it and if you do, well I don't know you but other than PHOenix, you stay hungry!

photos.caption: Photo of Da Vang Restaurant - Phoenix, AZ, United States. 50 I believe with the meatballs.
Photo of Da Vang Restaurant - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Fried Egg Rolls &amp; Spring Rolls.

y-LFMU7x8X63ByZYUiXVww.text: I came to Da Vang with a date. I don't regret it but I could have made a better decision. We walked in to a packed house which was a good sign and consistent with reviews. The debit/credit system was down that resulted in only accepting cash. This led to a good 15 minute detour to get cash back at a circle k around the corner. Not terrible but inconvenient nonetheless.  We were seated immediately which was nice. Our waiter however was a little pushy for us to order with checking in about ever minute or so. The food came pretty quick though. I thought it was a bit odd that the chopsticks were in an open container at the table where they were just out to anybody as opposed to them being individually wrapped. Not a huge deal but a little weird. The pho was really good. Nice and spicy the way I like it. I really enjoyed it. Overall, the date went great and the pho was a good idea, but I won't be returning. I'll stick to my go-to's for pho next time.

mA1QiPdLeKtqxS9Ue5-_sg.text: This is by far our favorite vietnamese restaurant. We live within 2 miles of 3 vietnamese restaurants in Tempe that are just ok. We drive to 19th Avenue and Indian School because it is that good. If you are looking for great vietnamese food at a good price, make the drive it is well worth it!

9dlk_DQ8j62A08KM9bNKNQ.text: I ordered 2 banh xeo, egg rolls, spring rolls, iced coffee , banh mi, banh bo and che ba Mau and it soooo good and cheap ! Love it . They're so friendly and fast here . I always come here to eat when I come visit, it's my favorite restaurant.

xTTAV77AcKlpji8PgDzyxg.text: Well my boyfriend loved his Pho but mine was gross I ordered spring rolls and I've never tried them before but I decided to be bold. Bad idea. So much fat in the beef I.T grossed me out idk other people probably like it but I sure as hell don't. Also the broth had no flavor at all.

hOXiW2JOnkFxiv1PSLDuGA.text: Bad bad bad service... we went there for breakfast and waited for almost 20 minutes at the table while the waiters ignored us. The food is just so so, not really good or bad but the service is so bad.

rBy-s7EjGGPz0TsWSKC7jA.text: Love the place and love the food, the only reason I do not give it 5 stars is due to the older skinny short gentleman who takes orders, very rude, does not listen and gets the order wrong every time. One time after calling him out for walking away before we were finished ordering, caught him smiling and talking crap in Vietnamese (I do know a few sentences) about us, so while walking out I smiled at him and whispered to him a choice profanity in his language which gave him pause. He has behaved ever since. LOL

l_ZdlML3KCwCJmz5NrqPhg.text: This hole in the wall offers fresh, tasty Vietnamese food at low prices. Try the pho and fresh (not fried) spring rolls. Mmmm.... My only disappointment is that they don't offer Pho Cari Ga and Vietnamese carpaccio made from Kobe beef (but then, I have only had those at one Vietnamese restaurant in San Francisco --very hard to find)...

CFsmNeGerWdcJ6CAzu3R9Q.text: i'll admit, i am the LAST person out of my group of friends that wants to eat at da vang. why, you ask? this place was SHUT DOWN for health violations this past year for a while. that's all i need to say.  From filthy floors, nasty things stuck in/around/on the tables, to food stuck to plates/cups/chopsticks.... now, i don't mind eating at dirty little hole-in-the-wall places when i'm in third world countries, but not in the freakin' U.S., when i know i can get the same or better food at the same prices at a much cleaner place with much better service. but, that was before....  I hesitantly revisited yesterday, to give them a "second chance" since they've re-opened since being closed. their prices are still low, service still suuuucks, but it is thankfully a bit cleaner. since it was too hot for pho, i decided to try the vermicelli noodles with bbq pork and egg roll - all layered on a bed of bean sprouts, lettuce, mint and basil leaves ($4.75). you pour the fish sauce allllllllll over and eat. It was meh, good-ish, although nothing that makes da vang's better than any other. in fact, i thought the portion was on the skimpy side, but meh. the spring rolls were large, although a bit chewy ($2).  My bf ordered the bbq beef on rice ($6.75), and they FORGOT his food. granted, we were in a huge party of 12, but when we tried to remedy it, the waiter had to go through his orders, and then he said, "oh yes, # blah blah blah, bbq pork. yes, it's still coming." although it was apparently NOT being cooked at that minute, since several in our party had already finished their meals. meh. so not only was it forgotten, it was also all bone and fat. being one of the more "expensive" items on the menu, you expect it to be much better quality.  so. i guess it's ok, since it's cheap. it's a hassle to get to because of construction, and the food isn't amazing enough to warrant that. i think i'd only consider take-out if i was in the area and craving vietnamese food. i just hate eating IN the restaurant here. definitely NOT my favorite vietnamese place (yes, even in phoenix) by a mile.

jAxM5srE7fjmVsaRZBYUQA.text: This is my go-to place for cheap, quality eats. I've been coming here for 15 years. It's not a place for ambience or location, but you can't beat the food at that price. It's relatively healthy too. Don't be scared by the strip mall location.  The fried egg rolls are as delicious as they get, wrapped in lettuce and dipped in fish sauce. The spring rolls are light and refreshing.  The Pho is always tasty. For the standard beef slices only (no organs or weird stuff), order 2A. You can order it in large or "superbowl" which is comically huge for only a bit more.  Barbecue pork chop rice, 39B is delicious and the broken rice has the best chewy texture.  The bahn mi sandwiches are also great at $2.25. 74 is shredded pork which is flavorful with the pickled veggies, cilantro, mayo and hot peppers. It does contain some collagen-meat, however. The barbecue pork sandwich (75) is also tasty but does have some fatty meat in it.  You don't come here for the service or the atmosphere, but for the FOOD. It does get busy around lunchtime on the weekends but service is generally quick. They close at 8pm.

rHg9xdGf0P_S8ISzjtEPcQ.text: The first time I went to Da Vang was with the whole family- Stepmother and Father. My stepmom was telling us about how there was this really great Vietnamese place that she knew of way back-- about 15 years ago-- and she wasn't even sure they were still open. So, we decided to take her word for it and see if Da Vang still existed.  To our surprise, it was! Despite its dive-y appearance, we walked in and were very politely greeted by what seems to be the owning family of the restaurant-- I can't be positive though. We were seated immediately and when we looked at the large but accommodating menu, we were also welcomed by the wonderful aroma that filled the room.  Anyways, to make a long story short, we ended up going to Da Vang 4 times that week. It's so delicious that it's addictive! The Pho soups are AMAZING! EVERYONE MUST TRY THE SPICY BEEF SALAD!!!! Eggrolls and springrolls are fresh and made to order, and all of their food seems to have the homey feel of a meal cooked with some genuine TLC-- and it all came out to less than $30 for the three of us! More than likely- we'll be going to Da Vang at least once a week!

LtlqAkVJziJltRtx_o-V3Q.text: I really wanted to like this place and maybe it was because I didn't get the pho, but the quality of the food was just bad.  I ordered the bahn mih and one of the vermecelli plates with grilled meat and egg rolls... and it was just alright.  The price was about right for comparable food but I was definitely expecting A LOT more of the bahn mih (it sucked compared to Lee's Sandwiches; the bread was too bready and NOT a baguette but instead that used for a sub sandwich).  The neighborhood was also sketch.  I came here on a weekday around 3pm and there were some strange characters hanging out in front.

cRzytqnXgxQkg1wpd2QgLg.text: The only reason I took the time to write this review is to prevent others from having a similar experience we did. We were craving some good Vietnamese food and after reading all the 4 and 5 star reviews of this restaurant, decided to give it a try. The place itself has a lot to be desired, but not even the dirty floor and a filthy door handle scared us off. After all, the other 30+ people loved the food. So was the food worth the experience? Not at all! I am still trying to figure out what is so special about the spring rolls the reviewers are raving about. This place made Pei Wei seem like top of the line Asian cuisine.

kwKqrtipzFSrHeribYq90g.text: This place is old but the food is good. The compliments arent that great...such as the basil and bean sprouts they give out. Their soy milk is made fresh and does not come from a Yeo's can.

AiaZcnW25a0REWS17I-J0A.text: Absolutely amazing pho!  Cant comment on the other food but the pho was great.  Service was typical of most small asain restaraunts.  Will definetly come back!

rAwLLFSF-pbjbO4nqqPKPA.text: i've been eating here for 20 years and i get great service. i see none of the reviews mention the chicken curry! to die for! order it with either rice, noodles or french bread! so good!

_DRsAE8oeHu69DN3Pt8w9w.text: Been here twice and they are RAT INFESTED!!!  Heard them in the ceiling on the first trip and sure enough my girlfriend saw them in the bathroom on the second trip.  Needless to say we got up and left without eating our food.

Rw6kw-0nxKmKetNoE2SGvg.text: this is a popular vietnamese place for the area with good food and prices, but the usual not so great decor.

d1kvqDcXaSvOEn9_s9iH4Q.text: I've been going to Da Vang for the last 2 yrs now. Only real pho restaraunt that tastes good and close to my house. I'd give the restaraunt 5 stars but the service and cleanliness is not there. The restaruant could use a remodel.  Now onto the food: I love their rice dishes. No complaints. But their Pho is ok. To me it tastes different every time I eat it.....Thats probably why I really try to just stick to the rice plate.   Prices are pretty cheap. No complaints here either.   I recommend this place if your in the Phoenix area.

oaajOrFM1c8GZAzRTYcpDQ.text: It's a bit of a drive for me to reach Da Vang, but it's well worth the trip.  This place doesn't have a nice atmosphere and the service isn't the best which is why it gets four stars.  But if you love great food at a great price, then you'll love Da Vang.  If you go, make sure to try the pho, spring rolls (at only$2.50 an order!) and bbq pork sandwich (again, at a price of $2.50)

tmz1oY2j7BfZ3JV0Mzf_hg.text: This is a place that has an appearance that would make you want to keep driving by.  However, the menu is extensive and the food is pretty good if you're up for trying real Vietnamese.  Spring rolls were really good!  The sauce that came with wasn't great, but wasn't necessary.  I had the congealed pork blood soup.  Pork blood had zero taste, but the broth and pork was good.  Had the seaweed, bean, and lotus seed drink, which was tasty if you could get by the appearance and hard work it took to drink/eat it.  Prices are extremely reasonable... Great Vietnamese for Arizona.

Z4f8TlSbOA-oX3fyoZOH9w.text: Sorry, but I was really disappointed in this place.   I love Vietnamese food and eat it as often as I can.  I also love a good dive restaurant too, so I was excited when I heard about this place.  My husband and I both ordered the pho and the spring rolls.  The pho broth was okay, but the sprouts and herbs to accompany were VERY old and withered.  They looked to be about a week old or so.  It was very unappetizing.  I did mention it to the server and she kind of shrugged her shoulders and walked away.  Fresh ingredients are a must in Vietnamese cooking.  Maybe it was a fluke, but I don't think we'll go back.

SPh24nzgDHM7Fw6HHRZ9EA.text: OMG! what is the rave about? this place is disgusting! it's dirty and the food is not worth it! i came here with my family and we each order a little bit of everything that is suppose to be good and popular there. unfortunately everything is bad. i walked by the waiters and they were all cursing really loud in vietnamese to each other. the table is icky and it smell like my cooked up oil . ick! go to Pho ao sen instead at least it's clean.

kzRCY4dHNXn79AKEEbYiYA.text: I have been to Da vangs several times I usually get the pho, beef with meatballs. I have tried pho at two other places pho thanh, and maxim the pho here is pretty good the broth is very flavourfull however I prefer the pho at pho thanh u get bigger portions. The egg rolls here are outsanding. I have tried the lemon grass beef which was also pretty good.

SYLFU2AFLOr4wAlMyeOKGw.text: After living in Hawaii for over 15 years and having some of the best pho, this is hands down best place for pho and a huge selection of other authentic dishes! (table next to us from Hawaii agreed:-)  especially after my poor experience at Viet Kitchen on Cave creek:-(  I will drive the distance!!!!!!!!

MUNajhPmvcFImXBr6hBw0Q.text: Da Vang's is my favorite restaurant in all of Phoenix. Not just my favorite Vietnamese Restaurant but favorite restaurant.  The food is amazing I have not had a dish I do not like. Their spicy fish was seasoned perfectly and not too spicy to enjoy, the Pho is the best in Phoenix although I can barely tell the difference if I am being honest and they have my favorite the Bahn Mi.  Hard to find in the city and really hard to find with the right bread.  I try to go her at least every couple weeks.   The service is not great but seriously if you are going to complain about that I say "look around fool do these folks look like they care about customer service they are packed because their food is bomb....they don't care about your 15% tip."

HZ2wC1NgxQjApJuaqcSaMQ.text: Last Saturday we decided to go out for Pho for lunch.  It was my first time having Pho so it was a cool experience.   The price is great and it was only $6 for a bowl of Pho I think I put a little too much chili oil my pho, it was getting a little warm in the restaurant. It was all good because it helped with my sinus and it was amazing too.  I will have to come back and try a different flavor next time. This time I had the one with meatballs in it.  :-)

6_jXVLap2YQLBA49W6PYKQ.text: The choices for Asian food are limited at best in Phoenix, and good ones are few and far between.  In my experience, sometimes the smaller less fancy places can be the best.  This is one of them. Years ago, not so much, but the food and restaurant have both improved 100%.  The boys that run the floor are fast, and attentive.  Much friendlier than another nearby Vietnamese Restaurant on Camelback at 17th AV. that shall remain nameless. The option for salads is nice to have as Vietnamese salads are one of my favourites, and their many take out items including the chilled desserts make my visits there complete.  They have a huge menu and I have never had a bad meal there.  The BBQ beef plate is my favourite, but they don't have it all the time.  Don't let that stop you, as the rest of the menu is great.  You won't be disappointed.

C3xLu9NSevam1uIhsJ5EKw.text: Their Pho was delicious, and cheap. Which is always a good thing. I also tried their shrimp spring rolls, they were ok, all the flavor was in the peanut sauce. But overall really good. Be prepared to take home leftovers because the portion size is ridiculous.

4dKK0oaRMGxryZZKPpXVEA.text: There's no better Pho place in Arizona than Da Vang! Seriously! Their service is amazing. If they ever mess up on my #1 pho they will quickly change it back to what I ordered! Great place!

Uvtwfi9bgR-KFeHquhTUIw.text: Great food, cheap and fast! Definitely going back.

REqxbvc47hz9VCFx-PYM5A.text: Staff was very friendly, prices reasonable, nice little spot. A disclaimer: I'm not a Pho expert by any means, but in my opinion the pho just didn't have any flavor. I ordered the pho without meat, so just vegetables. To add heat they have a bottle of siracha and some other sweet and tangy sauce out of a bottle, both full of preservatives, cheap quality ingredients. My dad ordered the beef pho and he was adding kikoman soy sauce to add salt and flavor. To me this is not the proper way to season or spice a hot and fresh soup. Only natural chilies, ingredients, spices should be added to flavor. Cheap sauces and spices out of a bottle to flavor fresh soup is like wearing a suit and tie to dine at Mcdonalds, just doesn't mix well. Safe to say I will try some other Vietnamese restaurants in the area, which there seems to be plenty of.

E30y6Ak_DTBGlR5U9b51EQ.text: Food....pretty amazing for the price. You can eat here for what you pay at McDonalds and everything's good. Not the best Pho I've had but really good and the spring rolls were great.  Ambiance...seriously lacking, inside and out. Not the cleanest place around.  Staff.....I've been here 4x. 2x staff was great and 2x staff was as rude as can be  Verdict...I'll put up with a lot if the food is great and if the price is right...EAT HERE!!!

QfjT4IIGMV3NrVj4Y_Oh1A.text: Tastes like Pho should taste! Service is good, but different. The Banh Mi is good too! This place is always busy!

bvhmxMC7rV--pIe4KBlQmw.text: My family and I have been coming to Da Vang for as long as we've lived in Arizona (a little over 10 years). This is by far the best vietnamese restaurant in the valley. The food is always great.

7U7pLa2Cu0okR8tsbG9-SQ.text: I eat here about 2-3x per week. Food is good, service is typical of a divey Asian establishment, it's cheap and very close to where I live.   Try the banh cuong (#72b). It's my new favorite thing to order! The bbq pork spring rolls are also DELICIOUS!

am5EFYc-L2awTQmkuduG7w.text: Love this place. One of the few places I can find my favorite dish- bo cuon la nho(beef stuffed grape leaves). Try the salted lemonade! Soooo good!

0RVD1x2j9yPv9gaC24gGOQ.text: Love it!!  The price is right!  Didn't know I liked Pho but this is great.  Get the vietnamese coffee!

AV2aFzUatD2yRE3IWRE32w.text: Our favorite Vietnamese restaurant in Phoenix, hands down.  Incredible pho broth used in their bowls.  Plates have all been great also...

eB5LPM3pbDEMk8RWvEIfJg.text: Foods great but English isn't.  7 times I ordered lemon Grass beef with fried rice and got something else.  I keep going back because food is good.

ptlLiW4U-rVF-VpjIUbFEQ.text: Phoenix, you are lucky! Such delicious flavors for such low prices. We ate whatever we wanted and then some for only - wait for it - $19!!!!! I'd be pumped if we lived closer to this place. Go here!

1xOZ0uPdFEiawk5eWU_dhQ.text: So I like the rice dishes here (com) their spring rolls and giant Pho 1b are amazing too.  You gotta try the pork chop or their rice combo plate .  Great!

TBxOW3-jOl1g1cCAWb4JEA.text: Went based on the Yelp rating, and if I were to somehow go back, it would be an "order-out". Even just looking for it, it was hard to believe that a place rated so high on Yelp would be in such a crappy area and mall! The inside just seems dirty, the windows are hard to see out of, it looks like nothing has been moved around in years. If the food knocks you out, you get over that grime and dust, but the food here was just medocre.  Nothing great, nothing bad, just ok. We had pho, bbq pork, spring rolls, egg rolls and noodles.  Charge me more, clean the place, and maybe I'd come back and give it another shot!

RtoXRC605DYTJum_w3v-0Q.text: The first thing you'll be amazed by is its perfectly reasonable price. The wait maybe long but it's worth every minute. Excellent pho broth and the rice plates are extremely delicious, will be visiting this restaurant everytime I go to phoenix

rgRdogaxB0IZTGTPVXRozQ.text: This place hands down has the best Pho in the valley! Yes the place is dirty and a total dive but that just adds to the experience.. if it were clean I don't think it would be very good. My theory is that Vietnamese places are usually a little dirty cause it's good luck!   The BBQ pork Banh mi just makes my mouth so damn horny! I'm dripping just thinking about it! Be sure to try the Banh mi bo kho (beef stew), its the best Ive had and none in Westminster or Santa Ana have come close.

2ah9ZIwch3WpoSiv2onMbA.text: I love this place. The prices are fair and the food is great. I was able to get Pho for breakfast at 8am on a Friday morning. I brought my mother here after an appointment at St. Joes hospital. She had never had Pho before and loved it!

lzbNG9qr349kh1h2siHdMQ.text: Pretty good. When you order an XL it really is an XL. Small hole in the wall place but food is very good. In a ghetto neighborhood but that's how I like it...cause I wish a ninja would!

JQD1g960TQ1mIF0pqqwskw.text: Coming from Seattle where they have good Asian spots everywhere, finding a good pho restaurant was hard. DaVang had really good pho. I had the tofu pho and the tofu was lightly fried just how I prefer:) the broth was amazing and it was a bigger building than most I've seen in Arizona. It's one of those "hole in the wall" type restaurants, but sometimes I think that's the best places for real authentic oriental food. I now come here at least 3 times a month ;)

NzTKc-y8Z89ACDMXXZZ2iQ.text: I think I had the #7 and the #41 add tofu. My friend John had the #8 and the #38 complete with fish balls....who knew...fish...had balls? Or was it the #6 and the #39. I don't know. I was distracted by the ambiance. Old tiled floors. Really funny, faux velvet art deco chairs and tables that could have used a little Windex. We were greeted immediately, sat, received water and then...well...waited and waited. I didn't want to be to rude but finally flagged someone down.   You could tell this was a family run gig...dad type figure bussing tables, little kids running around with rice falling out of their mouths (seriously, it wasn't gross, but kinda sweet) and the big mama just kinda surveying the scene. Meanwhile the younger men ran the floor. Our order was finally taken and food was delivered swiftly. The spring rolls did not dissapoint....so fresh, so delicious...who needs a fried spring roll any more? The menu was so huge and intimidating I basically just pointed at something and blurted out the number.   Taking the safe route was kind of boring I realize but the noodles were yummy, the veggies crisp and the tofu was amazing. I watched the other patrons (i.e. anybody that wasn't white) to see what they ordered. It was Pho all around. Next time it's Pho for Pho sure!   Great experience. Would totally order a tray of those spring rolls for a party. And next time in addition to Pho I'll have Alexander C.'s fave Banh. He says it makes him horny you know!? Oh. The prices were unbelievably low! I could have paid the entire bill with change from the cracks of my sofa cushions.

ff2GhIPCxrSnvsemC-ba7g.text: The pho was awesome and full of flavor. The waiters bent over backwards accommodating me and my 2 little crumb snatchers who were joining me for lunch. Super awesome experience. Definitely the real deal when everyone around you doesn't have English as their first language.  Drove all the way from East Mesa just to try their Pho. I will be back.

cOU3JjJHkCbEHbdzz2KgWQ.text: Yummy, Yummy, Yummy! I've been coming to this place regularly for about 5 years, from the time that my wife and I were a couple, to having a newborn baby and now a toddler.  The food has without fail been good. The only bad experience I had was when I decided to be adventurous and try some unfamiliar authentic Vietnamese dishes. What can I say - some flavors don't translate across cultures...  The staff are nice, without being in your face friendly like at a American casual dining restaurant. Top recommendations - The Shrimp and Pork Spring rolls for a starter Either the Bun, or the lemon grass beef for a main dish. (As a fair warning to you, the lemon grass beef can have a high sodium content if you're sensitive to it)

z2OO260TOwkww-rzf5gtvA.text: I went for dinner on Friday night and remembered how much I love this place. The staff recognizes us and is really friendly and accommodating. The inside has been cleaned up a lot recently even though the shopping plaza itself is a little run down.  My faves are the spring rolls and bun. I tried the family style lemon grass chicken this time and it was fantastic! Just spicy enough to give it a nice flavor, but not so much that you burn your tastebuds off.

mKjm9kp3H8-FM4Omk8JEGA.text: We've been coming here for years, have tried many Vietnamese restaurants on the west coast, and Da Vang is one of the best out there...certainly the best in the Phoenix area!  The pho has the best flavor around, the spring rolls are always delicious, the Vietnamese coffee will knock your socks off, and the BBQ pork is their specialty!  The BBQ pork is served many ways - w/ rice, on vermicelli, in sandwiches or spring rolls - don't miss it, it is absolutely the best thing on the menu!  The service is always fast and courteous, and the prices are unbelievably cheap for the quality.  LOVE this place!

r7BwuBaLPQsLaP7MRdDNUA.text: After a refreshing hike up Squaw Peak, we ended up at Da Vang for some pho lovin'.  And pho lovin' is what we received.  It's kind of in a ghetto area (no surprise!) and the inside is pretty bland like any authentic Asian restaurant worth their salt should be.  The food, however, was the exact opposite!  I ordered the #2, a big heaping bowl of pho complete with an assortment of meats, and we shared two orders of spring rolls (two in each order).  We were relieved that the orders came out quick, because the lot of us were thirsty and/or hungry, and we wanted to get down to business.  Both the pho and the spring rolls were equally as tasty.  Although I didn't finish the pho (strictly due to not being hungry enough to finish the whole thing), I was glad that my friends chose this place as our destination.  They also have banh mi (2.50 each...cheap!), which my friend said was also pretty good.  So you have your choice of noodles, sandwiches or rice dishes here.  Apparently they also serve boba drinks next door.  You can order the drinks at Da Vang and they'll bring them over to you, but if the boba place is closed, then you're out of luck (like we were, but I'm not gonna hold it against them).

A-CMzcNDshQ676Gloa4Gvg.text: 3/16 Update:  I've decided to remove two stars from my rating because my recent visits have just been disappointing.  The grilled pork is more baked than grilled - no smokiness or tasty charred bits anywhere.  The pho tastes more of MSG than boiled beef bones.  And service is as bad as ever.  I wonder if Da Vang's popularity has led it to take shortcuts for efficiency.    Definitely not worth going out of your way for - go to Khai Hoan in Tempe for the smokey grilled pork or Saigon Nites in Scottsdale for the delicious pho instead.  Prior review:  Essential pre-eating check list for Da Vang  1.   Turn your expectation on service down to zero 2.   Voluntary separation of  restaurant decor & atmosphere from the dining experience 3.  Limited peripheral vision is a plus  Now you're ready to enjoy one of the tastiest Vietnamese place this side of San Jose.

0aLM61De6DqnIblzVRTMuA.text: Davang's waiters are always "busy". They text messages or do something in phone all the time. I got nothing helpful from them. Shame on it. The young waiter took my order who has bad English; he talks to much and try to say some funny things. And then, after taking my order he got his phone out and keep texting. Stop waste my time. I just have 30 minutes for my lunch. The service always takes so long. I don't have time to waste at all. Absolutely, I will never be back!!!

XcRAH_AfVOwulzx0oY4jVg.text: Cheap and tasty.  I enjoy the Pho, spring rolls and one of the stir fry dishes (can't remember what it is...ever...even with a menu in front of me).  Very affordable.  Usually pretty busy and noisy.

xf-4Nq0SKPBY2Xds-MKd7g.text: Vietnamese is my favorite type of Asian food and this place was as good as it gets. It was pretty busy during my lunch hour which was at noon, but we were still seated right away. You can't go wrong with the Pho or Wonton soup.

AV45Ca0N8v1vnEdBIXIKqw.text: Cheap Vietnamese food, little portions but the hot pot looks cool. Do not get the pork vermacheli, such a little portion. Food is good, stick with the pho and so down to try the hot pot looks generous and cool!

3WVN17IKQ3VZxHOhTLz-Vg.text: I enjoy coming here. The food is excellent and you get a good price for a large portion of food. The only down side is that every time I come in and have an idea of what I want to eat they are always out of it. I mean it doesn't happen every now and then. It happens at least 80% of the time.

i_zXFhRoMBd2u0224nntgQ.text: This is my favorite Vietnamese restaurant in phoenix. I've tried numerous vietnamese restaurants in town, but nobody else has broth like da vang's! I sometimes go there twice a week. My fav is definitely 3a pho with round eye & brisket. & I also love crunchy noodle. I'd give 4 stars because once in a while, the meat can be fatty .. But otherwise I love it!

eV8nWdrYYJ_rY2x3E2eQFg.text: ate here again just the other day. myself and two friends. and I hate to have to give this updated review, because I genuinely like this place. I ordered tamarind soup and one of my friends ordered beef pho and the other ordered shrimp fried rice. everything was fine to start but myself and my friend who ordered shrimp fried rice both felt warm and uncomfortable after we ate. for me like my blood pressure was going up. then my friend said his stomache was bothering him and he said he does not want to go back to da vang. I know from past experiences that what was causing that was the use of MSG.  Again I really like this place, I wish they would stop using MSG and I would return in a heart beat. I know that they are not the only restaurant that uses MSG. But I also avoid other restaurants that use this artificial food contaminent. I hope Da Vang takes a moment and thinks about their health and the health of all of their customers and eliminates MSG.

r1iRYzzoLdE991eiMGWWQA.text: I love this filthy little shithole!  I have eaten here countless times and swear that I had reviewed it before... guess not?  Much bigger menu than Maxim down the street. I like them both, Maxim maybe has better soup?, but it's great at Da Vang, too.   Just went for lunch with a friend - friend had chicken pho which was good, we split an order of spring rolls, which were tasty as hell and full of transparent rice noodles, shrimp, and pork. I got a lot of exercise in the last few days and my metabolism is feeling fast at the moment so I pigged out... a vietnamese bbq pork sandwich, which had greezy but good pork, jalapeno, carrot, bean sprouts, and cilantro,  and a crepe which was filled with bean sprouts, shrimp, and other tasty things. They bring tons of fresh herbs with your order.   Total bill: $14 and some change... for both of us.    Everything was fresh, the food came up fast despite the crowd, and I felt satisfied. Nap timeeeeeeeeee.  If you like dirty little ethnic dives and Vietnamese food... check it out. OK it's not that dirty. Just a little. Whatever. Think of it as atmosphere.

lA8-MdabqTKIPsH0wx1Pyg.text: I've been back for 3 times in the past month, with take out.  I was slightly disappointed in their Pho this time. The noodle was mushy when I got it, twice. The soup was soggy as a result. But the rest of the foods items.. the steam rich dishes and dry rice noodles... were still good.  So diners, it's not as good as I recall it it. So I will skip the Pho and stick to other dishes. But what's the point of coming here when the staple was not good anymore. I'm still deciding...

UNoomKJRPUIhLhJA7_Cirg.text: Not an oxymoron...Great service Vietnamese Restaurant  I've been here several times and it is about time I gave my review.  I'm from So. Cal so I grew up with very good Vietnamese food.  It is one of my favorite places to come to in the Valley because of the food, friendly service and all this for an affordable cost.  This is a True dive or hole in the wall for sure, but the food makes up for the lack in decor.  Besides the Pho, the Banh Xeo (Crepe) and rice dishes are very tasty as well.  You have to realize that the cost of gathering all the ingredients and cooking it yourself would usually be higher than coming to eat here for any meal.  And if you happen to see Banh Bao on the table in front, you have to try it.  They do not serve this daily which they should, but it is a white pastry filled with steamed barbeque pork and some hard boiled egg.  When you get it fresh, you'll thank me for tasting this hidden gem.  Hands down best in the valley and rivals those made in Little Saigon, California.   The ROA (Ratio of Authenticity) is usually 0.65-0.75. (# of Ethnic Patrons (Vietnamese in this case) / Total # of Patrons) at any given time which for me is pretty authentic for Phoenix.  I've been in other Vietnamese restaurants which were supposedly voted the best in the valley, but is horrible by VN standards.     I would give it 5 stars if it weren't for the decor.

VSFW5_trxv5_Hhl9jnC_Mg.text: Came here again recently for lunch with friends and we had an excellent food. Can't wait to comeback for more!

DhzPt8VNb2k8xlJz4r_dfg.text: Good food, price, and friendly hostess who told us the benefits of retiring in Arizona. Buff asian waiters were a plus

zKXFv8c8Llnmrmtdz1tKwQ.text: This place is amazing! Definitely our new favorite spot. It's inexpensive compared to other pho places we've gone to, and waaaay better!

photos.caption: Photo of Da Vang Restaurant - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Pho A2

Cho-yVCMptGNCCWguofRTQ.text: Came here for lunch witb some coworkers. The spring rolls were the best I've had in AZ. The Bun Bo Hue was okay, it wasnt as spicy as I wanted but it tasted fine. Their Banh Mi did not look that good, it didnt look like they toasted it. My coworker said his Pho tasted good. They were flexible with special orders such as swapping broth and meat. Overall, it tasted good and a place worth trying.  Price: $ Food: 5/5 Service: 5/5

photos.caption: Photo of Da Vang Restaurant - Phoenix, AZ, United States

KxCPXc8IIZ-8-By2BXzXlA.text: The food is what's up here, and being a more than affordable spot (about $35 for two apps, a banh mi, fried rice, two pho soups, coconut water and a Coke!) this place is a steal. The broth of my pho (#1 Pho Da Vang) tasted homemade and delicious, warming me during the cold night. The banh mi was perfect, just the right amount of meat to veggie ratio, but the spring rolls were just okay. Unfortunately, we came during Lunar New Year and the service left much to be desired. Our entrees came out before our apps and it also took forever to pay. Our food also seemed delayed compared to tables around us which left us starving for 20 mins as we waited for our food.  All in all come for the food and not for the service.

photos.caption: Photo of Da Vang Restaurant - Phoenix, AZ, United States
Photo of Da Vang Restaurant - Phoenix, AZ, United States

YN4S4DjYn0MCs1w50U56Vw.text: Good service. Menu amazing variety and waiters able to make recommendations.  Just a perfect place.... planning to be a frequent client!!

6FslEr_s89-GhWW1TQT11w.text: The food is delicious the pho are flavorful.  I love going to this place . I like it all and they're hefty servings

photos.caption: Photo of Da Vang Restaurant - Phoenix, AZ, United States

XEmWkSmcLey7ksN8zYrNsg.text: This is a very good pho spot, a close runner up to my favorite in Phoenix, Pho Thanh.  Everything was fresh and flavorful from the pork and shrimp egg rolls, the bbq pork banh mi sandwich to the DaVang house special pho.  The pho broth was subtly spiced, maybe just a little too subtle for my preference but solid regardless.  Whatever your favorite is in Phoenix, you won't go wrong by checking this place out.

XdNkte-XmQiQKo4xXo7gyw.text: Horrible. As a Vietnamese I find this place to be really bad. I tried to order 2 items and was told it'll be around 30 mins wait, so I ordered another item. It was a rice dish and lo and behold  around 10 mins nothing. I asked another Waiter again to see if my order has been taken care of, thinking that  the first Waiter might forgot. So, 15 mins later nothing. My son was really hungry and we couldn't wait any longer. Finally I told them to make it a take out. Off to McDonald's. Really bad customer service and no apologies given.   Tim an Da Vang  tren ng 19 ngi phc v d i la d. i bng ma phi i 30 phut ma chua co phn cm tm. Phi i ra mua McDonald's cho con trai. . Last time here.

d1qyAGfAPUDXfB3oQn4ZVw.text: I've heard for years that this is the best pho place in town. Went a decade ago and was not impressed. Saw a cockroach in the bathroom at that time and vowed to never come back. Decided last week to give it another chance. Spring rolls were great, but that's about it. My pho tai was greasy, the meat was nasty and chewy, and I got sick from it later that night. My friend ordered veggie pho and the cabbage in it was rotten with black spots all over it. Her broth was greasy too and she got sick that night as well. Also, there are dead cockroaches in the bathroom light fixtures and traps behind the toilet. This place is NASTY!  There are so many better pho places in town. Don't do it, you'll get sick!

LvBxxvTscKx4HzmKQACQsQ.text: This is a regular place that we go for Vietnamese.  My boyfriend took me there  for our first date.  Something in the soup .. I'm in love.  ;) It's always fresh and delicious.  It's a busy place which shows how good they are.. there is plenty of room though.  I get the bbq pork vermicelli with egg rolls (36)when I want something cool and fresh.  The dumpling soup (22) is delicious.. the shrimp pork dumplings are amazing! Don't forget the spring rolls to start.

i6AJrRaMTpckp-12NLVWZg.text: Been going there since I moved to az. Been to a bunch onlf Viet places. But nothing compared to this place . Price is very good too. Servers are very nice

EGeW9_-dixGyGFbkjZ-j6Q.text: Da Vang is Da Bomb! My hubby got a lead that this was the place to pick up really tasty and affordable Banh Mi sandwiches. So we had our lunch date there today. $3 shredded pork or BBQ pork sandwiches. The French bread is crunchy on the outside. They fill the sandwich with just the right amount of meat, a spear of cucumber, cilantro, shredded carrot and radish pickles. Sprinkle a little of the sauce mixture they give you and voila, a delicious sandwich that doesn't bust your wallet.  We also took home a BBQ Pork plate with steamed crab cake and shredded beef (beef and tripe combination). It was the same meats that were in the Banh Mi. The plate was $6.75. We also took home the Pho Tai ($4.25). They package the thinly sliced meat separately. They also have you bring home the rice noodles, bean sprouts, basil, lime, sliced onions and green onions separately. Oh, they give you jalapenos, too. At home, we heated up the soup, tossed in the beef and veggies and marveled at the aromatic broth. We will be  back ready to eat more. We saw a hor fun or stir fried wide rice noodle dish with tonnes of veggies and meats that we want to try. Oh, while I waited, I drank sweetened soyabean drink. It was to die for. I was so sad when it was all gone. Did you hear my teardrop falling? I love you, Honey. You know my love language is food.

photos.caption: Photo of Da Vang Restaurant - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Delicious soyabean drink, sweetened and unsweetened, I believe, but don&#39;t quote me. Try it without ice.
Photo of Da Vang Restaurant - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Tempting desserts freshly made

sb2wi_3xAaMBwKlwQfL3mw.text: Been coming here for years now and finally able to write a review. Over the years, they did some renovation and recently it looks like they redid the check out counter.  Ultimately it's the food that keeps me returning here. The food is amazing. Broth in the pho has depth without tasting instant or overly msg tasting.  There's few dishes that we always get. The combo pho, and flat rice noodle seafood dish. All of their spring rolls are fresh and made to order so the wrapping is still soft. I've also tried their rice plates and vermicelli. All were equally tasty. Whatever you get, you won't be disappointed. I always leave here satisfied and full. Probably would be coming here more often if I didnt live so far.

photos.caption: Photo of Da Vang Restaurant - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Crepe appetizer.
Photo of Da Vang Restaurant - Phoenix, AZ, United States. #1 perfect in today&#39;s weather
Photo of Da Vang Restaurant - Phoenix, AZ, United States. #43

yozLLkqvM2XlPF4YkhWcvQ.text: Authentic food served by a great family.  Don't miss this place, just don't eat the fish sauce.  Everything else was totally delicious!  Good service too.

Nh12X_KHvXn8V9ztsBlbbw.text: I went here with coworkers today for a team building lunch/meeting. I haven't been here in a long time. They remodeled the place, it's much brighter and more inviting. They also got new menus and bowls (fancier lol). What hasn't changed is the food. Still excellent and decent price although they increased it which is fine. I had the bun bo xao (lemongrass beef and vermicelli) which was excellent. Coworkers had pho and bo kho (beef stew) and all enjoyed it. Will be coming back.

photos.caption: Photo of Da Vang Restaurant - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Bun bo xao

OwCztG0CuaUcTD0eq1WOUg.text: Real good Vietnamese food.  I hadn't had com tam bi suon nuon (#40) so good in ages.  I also had the banh cuon thit nuong (#72B) which was also very good.  They make very good food here.  I had to wait in line at 1:30 PM on a Friday for 5 minutes.  On a Monday at 3:30 PM, there was no wait but it was packed.  There is a little wait on the food.  I assume because they put in a lot of love in the food.  It shows.  Other dishes I've had here:  banh cuon cha lua (#72).  very good.  pho da vang xe lua (#1B). .  extra large pho da vang. This has good taste but the MSG content is high in this broth.  The quality of the meat in the broth is very good.  The beef brisket actually tasted like high end slow smoked BBQ meat.  I've had never beef brisket this good in a pho.  It was a nice touch.   The raw coconut juice was very fresh and tasty.  My brother had the shrimp, pork salad (#56C) with added duck, no chicken. He said it was good but the pork was a little dry, overcooked.

photos.caption: Photo of Da Vang Restaurant - Phoenix, AZ, United States. muc rang muoi. salty fried squid. #65b variation.
Photo of Da Vang Restaurant - Phoenix, AZ, United States. #39. com tam dac biet.
Photo of Da Vang Restaurant - Phoenix, AZ, United States. #72B. banh cuon thit nuong cha lua

IdRzZmOQVll05sGJNpZNcw.text: Cute family- owned and run joint in a non-descript strip mall. Lots of locals here. The food was good, the wait not so bad, the service was friendly, however the delivery was a little haphazard. Dishes came out as they were ready, so apps came after some entrees, one entree came out waaay before everyone else's, and a different server each time so no one knew if we had ordered these dishes or not, some were for other tables. No biggie, but still. They should know what dishes belong to what tables at least.  We ordered   Shrimp Spring Roll: (with and without pork) Not the most flavorful I have had, and the rice wrapper was a bit gummier than I like, filing was very dry- but the sauces were very flavorful (loved the peanut one) and livened them up a bit. I probably wouldn't order this again.  Eggroll: Enjoyed these - crunchy fried and good flavor, piping hot. We all liked this.  Ga Pho (Chicken): Extremely light broth- too light? a bit flavorless- but the noodles and veggies were very fresh and abundant. Piling on all the accoutrements helped- along with a solid dose of that chili paste! I guess I am used to a more assertive, saltier pho broth.  Garlic Noodles with Vegetables & Tofu (may have been named "Stir Fry w Vegetables" on menu): Ordered with thin rice noodles (I love your choice of noodle for every dish- egg or rice, thick or thin) and everyone LOVED it-  was really the star of the table along with the Banh Mi. Server came by after and recommended the thicker rice noodle with this dish- will do if I return :)  BBQ Pork Banh Mi: Absolute perfection. For $3.00, this is the best sandwich I've had in a long time. Tender, flavorful BBQ pork sliced thin, pickled carrots and fresh, crunchy veggies, excellent, flakey and tender french bread. Perfect balance, every bite divine. I would order this again in a  heartbeat.  Broken Rice with Beef and Pork: Very flavorful dish, pork pieces were very thin and fried- were these tendons or skin? Kinda weird, but the beef was nice, one bigger piece sliced and served atop the rice.  I'd be ever so grateful if you could click on useful, funny or cool if it applies. Happy Yelping!!

photos.caption: Photo of Da Vang Restaurant - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Stir fry w tofu
Photo of Da Vang Restaurant - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Yummmy

TiWNzBdUE1-ejCTBkrzvpA.text: Oh my... Da Vang, how could I not have written a review for you yet?!  You are my favorite Vietnamese restaurant in this big city called Phoenix!  I order a variety of dishes, most of which I cannot pronounce (properly) and you have never let me down.  The banh mi... fantastic!  The bun bo hue... excellent!  The vietnamese coffee... so so good!  The vermicelli dish with pork and egg roll... delicious!  Da Vang is one of those ethnic restaurants where people of that ethnicity actually go there to eat.  I'm not saying that is a tell-tale sign of the quality and authenticity of the food here, but it's definitely a good thing!    Ok, that's all I got for you.  Yes, this review is a little bit short... but good things come in small packages, lol!  *****FIVE STARS*****

photos.caption: Photo of Da Vang Restaurant - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Com tam dac biet!

uN6yR0-DDLOS7wJs-efwYw.text: I miss going to Da Vang. When I was a student at GCU, da Vang is the place to hang out with my friends and exchange gossips. We would read the menu every time, even we are ordering the same thing over and over. It's just too good. I recommend Pho and Thai tea. It's just the bomb.

UA4omQ4kj3jmRYJUsljjqw.text: There's only one nice lady there of the bunch.  The rest are unfriendly.  The same with the men.  There's one that is nice, the other is as rude and unfriendly as the one woman.    I've given this place enough forgiveness and it is time to pull the plug.  I'm never going there again.  The last time I went there, there was literally 7 people in there, and my food took 25 minutes from the time I ordered for it to-go.  The place has always been slow on delivery.    There is nothing worse than patronizing a place which is rude and does not appreciate your business.  I've experienced far better customer service and appreciation.  My recommendation to this place is be more friendly and appreciative.  We customers pay your bills.  I hope more people boycott your place.  Maybe that will teach you some manners.

WnVdHHa0_KVhXCrYTvQjkg.text: This area of town has many Vietnamese options and this one sits in the middle of the pack.   There are only a few vegetarian options and one must search them out in the menu. I had the stir fired veggies with egg noodles 4.69 +1 for tofu.  The flavors were pretty standard and the noodles were good, what was lacking was the spice condiments, there was just siriacha and sambal, none of the garlic chilie oli you may find at other Pho places.    Server was marginal, it will not impress anyone

xhEaHnDOkQP932sNnpx9xw.text: I've tried several Vietnamese restaurants since moving to Phoenix and this is the best if you're looking for a place that does a variety of dishes well.  Vietnamese restaurants in more densely-Viet populated areas are known for specializing in specific items even though they may have a broader menu.  Therefore, I waited until after a few visits to write a review.   Da Vang wins easily over Pho Thanh, whose menu, price, and location I find comparable.  The pho broth is richer and less fatty.  The bbq pork (thit nuong) on vermicelli and rice dishes is much more authentic.  Their bo kho (beef stew) was very good and banh uot was also good.  I spotted some crispy banh xeo on other tables and I might want to try that next.    I think this will be my go to Viet spot in Phoenix.

photos.caption: Photo of Da Vang Restaurant - Phoenix, AZ, United States

OmBGGGrGEzDhyMPzp-U_zQ.text: I love their pho!!! Their broth is very flavorful and they are very generous with the meats and noodles.  Place need a bit more of attention but it could also be that we were their a bit late on the day. Best of all prices are super low!!  Like other reviewers said, "it's a whole in the wall" kind of place. But definitely worth to try!!!

YPlcxAv2Aydka1c3c5vXjQ.text: My opinion best Vietnamese food in town remember they are closed Wensdays but open 6 days a from 8am. VERY busy lunch and weekend crowd. Friendly people as well!!!!

Ij_3CpwBzi4UXS7DrXLa4g.text: Trying to be adventurous today and try a new pho place, but upon arrival I knew I had be here before years ago as a child. Walking in was a blast from the past, my family and I used to come here almost every Sunday before going to the Seafood market that is no longer there (I guess that's why we stop coming). The food is still as great as I remember it. The menu looks remarkably the same as Pho Thuan Thanh in Mesa.   Got the usual pho number 1 and added the usual basil, siracha, lime and jalapenos. Great flavors from the broth and well cooked noodles that combined to be a party in your mouth with ever bite and slurp. We also order 41. broken steam rice with bbq pork. The pork was tender and easy enough to cut with just the spoon and pouring the fish sauce over the meat and pork just gives the right sweet and savory to make you go into a food coma for a month. Not mentioning that the prices average about $6 a person, and you walk away be more full that you ever thought you could be.

aOqhWafouTBqU9YS9hzsCQ.text: Great place to eat. Very inexpensive and very delicious. It may get a bit loud inside but nothing intolerable.

8CT5qy2ryTQIvTogeRLv9g.text: It's my second time here. In my opinion, this place is better than their competition down the street (I won't mention names). The service is friendly and fast. Also a lot cleaner than the other one down the street. I'll definitely be back. I highly recommend it.

photos.caption: Photo of Da Vang Restaurant - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Worth the drive.

yhIpS6yu5HL8I-qS7VO4ng.text: I've had my first bowl of pho at this restaurant and it was amazing. Very delicious. I had ordered the spring rolls as well and they are very juicy. This is my favorite spot now!

8T8e-tRyigYVhwL9yNTTCQ.text: This joint is reasonably priced and delicious! Brings me back to the couple weeks I spent in Veitnam. I brought with me a Vietnamese food newbie, we got the crepe as an appetizer, bbq spring rolls and the sliced beef pho as an introduction for her - and she loved every part of it! Will definitely be back!

exODrv9uVd5wiE4NHdkd1g.text: Been here twice. Their serving size is large and their prices are cheap is the trade off food quality? Absolutely not. Great food! Try thier spring rolls great stuff and thier beef fried rice is a huge serving, I shared it with the whole table.   We brought a big party our second visit they loved food and loved the small bill at the end.

L57DdNgA6Gxi8agZjgKkEg.text: Great place for Pho but a long drive for us. Drove over here yesterday based off of the good reviews on Yelp and really enjoyed it. Pho was outstanding, egg rolls were good and the Bahn Mi sandwich was great.  We got there at 11am and there was plenty of seating but by the time we left it was packed. Service was ok but you had to ask for help they didn't check on you.  Highly recommend this place.

Z-pRii7GRTDGw7SSuzliLA.text: The food is bomb but avoid this place if you're  too hungry and do not want to wait. The service was horrible! I went with some friends, we got seated and they brought us water and menus so it started great. They took about 20min just to come back to take our orders and I get it busy, we went on Sunday and the place was pack but wouldn't it be faster for them if they had faster service. Then another 30-45min to bring our food we had asked for more water too and they brought the food but no water. We reminded the server but after the food was delivered we didn't see him again! He didn't came to check if everything was fine, he never delivered the water and we had to get up and asked for the check our selves. If the service would have been better I believe they would have gotten a 5 star in my book.

5OCDFj6ofvM9z6hL_RTS7w.text: Not my favorite but it's ok for once in a while when I drive pass by and couldn't find any asian restaurant around.
