hD0UiSu348xMzIuTB8dlCQ.text: Good chicken  pho with great flavor.  And hey have fresh young coconuts too which is a plus in my book!

bhkmjSlt_ULenLF2z80OWw.text: My absolute favorite place to get quality food at a low price. Honestly the best Vietnamese place I've ever found.

6EDNKFkyhCCD4vIiAV-vgw.text: Pho for $4.95? Yes, please! Great service and extensive menu options--pho, bahn mi, cold noodles, it's all really yummy, fresh, and met with a smile. Quick seating, clean, great spot to get your Vietnamese food fix. A regular stop for me.

nsDOw4m2SQ_xjctiil20qw.text: This is my go to spot for a hearty Pho fix. I always order an extra large special pho with the menagerie of sliced meats. The both is fragrant and devine with no off flavors. Noodles are plentiful and filling. The only suggestion I would have is I wished the sliced eye of round was slightly thicker. The slices of beef here tend to be very thin to the point of shredding easy. Veggies are always fresh and plentiful also. The iced tea is also very good. The banh mi are a nice addition to a hot bowl of pho. After all...who doesn't like a good soup and sandwich? But I digress. The Banh Mi here is the perfect sized for sharing with an extra large bowl of pho. Meat is tender and flavorful, veggies crisp and fresh. I just wish the bread was a little heartier. Its not bad; however, its reminiscent of toasted wonder bread. I wish they used a True baguette. Though maybe I'm asking too much as I frequent this establishment often. Aside from these 2 small issues, I really can't fault them for anything else. There are quite a few pho spots around the area of 19th and Camelback but I feel like this one is the best!

9PV6wd6UQdbXtdZJrC5lmQ.text: Best place to get authentic pho....I've tried most of the other places in the valley and still love this one the most.

5NoSYx1mlCB18ixaGaa89Q.text: First time going, heard good things but, no high chair not children friendly. Order it to go missing half of the food when we got home. Will never go there again

xYQG7LpTq40WE6EgDYWLwg.text: 15.95 for two bowls of pho and 2 orders of goi cuon spring rolls. It tasted yummy!!

L6RBfkPFGnDBbikgIkbh0g.text: Definitely my favorite Vietnamese restaurant! I used to go once a week! They have the best Pho I have ever had! So delicious! :)

5NlPi7jgx7X8KibzEj0S2g.text: If I could rate this a negative number I would. I swear I was being punked. It was like a bad episode in real life. I love Pho and so I looked this place up in a Google search for top 10 pho places in Phoenix. This was a meet up lunch with my girlfriend and her toddler. Myself and my toddler arrived a little earlier we got a table, and I asked for a high chair. They brought the highchair (dirty with grime and sticky stuff all over) no big deal, I had disinfectant wipes. I cleaned it up and sat my kid in it. As I sat down myself, I realized my chair was wet. I immediately stood up and noticed there was a yellow urine like puddle under the table. I told the waiter staff and they just replaced my chair, claiming it was just water spilled. It def smelled bad and it was not water. Whatevs, I went into the restroom and wiped off whatever it was with soap off the back of my jeans. My girlfriend and her kid arrived so they asked for another highchair. Another dirty highchair was brought. I handed her the wipes and she did her thing. We ordered our food, which took a little while Pho Ga (chicken pho) and a sandwich for our kids to split. I tasted my Pho and it was descent, however before I could take a 2nd sip we looked over on the wall by our table and saw a cockroach just passing by like we were in his territory. This is when we got up and walked to the cashier and told them what's up. They thought we were lying or something. I walked them over and pointed at the cockroach. At this point they just started cleaning up the table and muttering something under their breath. That's cool. I walked back to the cashier and his response was "Don't worry it's on me"  .....I paused with silence and had to make sure there were no one jumping out with cameras telling me I was on an episode of some sort of disgusting restaurant joke. The most horrible restaurant experience ever.

ivkZ-VXKHcargUh3kotv8w.text: The restaurant is infested with roaches! At my table a roach crawled up when I told a waiter he killed it and walked away without giving an apology. We then told the manager he said they sprayed but couldn't get rid of all of them! Even before we saw the roach the food was disgusting. Please do not go to this location this is not sanitary.

VgIuf5FJcUMPXSqbJRD2CA.text: Are you looking for a Restaurant to eat ?Da Vang is the one have really good food and good price! That why they are always busy . I love #2B and 42A.

9CCUnZnyc1NX2dzYdnH5jQ.text: This place has the best spring rolls that I have found in the Phoenix area.  The prices are very reasonable and the service is fast and friendly.

VqA5PkhP4fEPVCX158YDwA.text: So glad I found this place! Authentic and fresh pho soup!! One of my favorite places so far and so affordable! Don't let the area or outside fool you, it's awesome Vietnamese food!

EJNR-0QQNezHxS3Gjv6jKw.text: Here's the thing: IT IS SO CHEAP. I am not the type to go out of my way to get excited about a meal because it's only $5 and you can eat for days-- but in this case, it's also genuinely tasty! This isn't gourmet, it's not fancy pants--but it does satisfy the palette of a girl who enjoys some excellent Vietnamese cuisine on a seriously tight budget. Also, its location is nice because there isn't a ton that I've tried in the area that isn't chain-oriented. I appreciate that it's family-owned and operated.  I got the buon thiao nuang cuon-barbeque pork and noodles. The pork was marinated well and tasty. The egg rolls are small, but the spring rolls are fresh and pretty fantastic. Their version of the peanut sauce is more like hoisin and their noodles are pretty standard. All in all, I would definitely come back for a quick and easy meal!

felBal7gXMIju_SZKeB9-g.text: So glad I found this place. The pho ga is awesome, simple chicken soup with rice noodles. Also love the 27 - seafood and chicken chow mien but with skinny slightly crispy egg noodles. Also tried the fried beef with peppers and green onion over rice which was good. Lastly, even though I'm not a big fan of the banh mi (Vietnamese sandwich) everyone says these are the best in town because of the quality of the bread. Can't wait to try new things here.

luOj1sUJ2KuCLsI7QgkPHA.text: The best place to go for a tasty bowl of Pho! They have a variety  of other dishes that are also oh so good.  Such as the Shrimp and Pork Spring Rolls and BBQ Chicken rice plate.  Don't forget the little containers of Che in the fridge on your way out.  Haven't found a place yet in Phoenix that beats out Da Vang on flavor and price.

v0rS6qHzyRwr5JjCbOD7Rg.text: Now that I posted my picture on my profile- I have to be careful with my Viet restaurant rating.  ;)  Da Vang---This restaurant is older than me!!! I think every Vietnamese in Phoenix know Da Vang and have been to Da Vang at least once!  People don't know this but personally the best dish at Da Vang are Banh hi cho tom, mi hat co, mi xao don hi sn and bo cun la nho - i must warn that this is for authentic Viet food lovers only.  If it is your first time at Da Vang - I suggest the Ph or Bun Ch Gio Tht Nng are your best bets.   I love coming to Da Vang on Saturday to get a warm cup of freshly brew soy milk (sa u nanh) and pork buns (banh bao) - in the morning these two are the best combo.  For coffe lovers- try the Viet coffee - it's brew French style =)   Do not come to Da Vang expecting a clean restaurant and good service- because you will be very disappointed .  most people there are regulars and can take jokes from the guys waiting on them; however, they are much nicer to the foreigners ;)

ZVfCanJ_lqks6PXHUa4VGw.text: This place isn't bad. The Pho was pretty average. I'm still on my quest to find the perfect place for Pho and unfortunately this isn't it.  It was reasonably priced and the service was good. I was sad that the spring rolls came with Hoisen instead of peanut sauce but, ah well.  Since 3 stars is A-OK, that's what I will stick with.

ZzjcmpRQLEIvnCnRV08sGw.text: The service is quick and efficient; the portions are big; the prices are low. The only thing is the food is a little under flavored which can be a good thing if you know exactly how you want to flavor your own food. Overall good experience the two times I have been there.

H1B-vsMnp3wQ-hmZpyB2qg.text: This restaurant its okay.  I wouldn't recommend anyone to this restaurant because the food doesn't have a nice presentation. Its also not flavorful or memorable compared to many other restaurants, I have experienced.

DktpZGwXm9RRNQt_sWs4NQ.text: Springs rolls had big portions of lettuce, mints, rice noodles and spring. The sauce was perfect!

jLsqDrAor6mvq9M4MfNcLw.text: I love Pho!  I could eat it everyday and maybe I will as I want to loose 50lbs this year and I think eating soup just may be my new diet plan.  I have always had friendly service here and not sure why others have noted that the service is not friendly.   I always get the 2A which is a  good sized bowl of beef broth soup with beef slices, noodles and veg on the side.  I also order the hot tea.  All this for a grand total of $4.50 plus tax.

TCh1183ExDxz4su1jvpN2Q.text: I have been going here since I was a baby. I am now 23. It hasn't changed at all. I love this place, it is consistent with it's menu items. Prices are great &food is flavorful! Give this place a try!

nJ2sWDTFssL0Bls79AjDeg.text: Hands down best PHO in PHX

q06H8jTfaYX0NmnsShQtHg.text: There are a couple of things you have to realize about Da Vang. It's worth the 4 stars, but a lot of the traditional things that you'd expect from a regular restaurant you can't from this place.  First off, it's been here forever. I've been coming here since I've been like 12. It is, IMO, one of the BEST Vietnamese restaurants here in Phoenix. Like all good Vietnamese restaurants, it is in the hood. It is also old, and grungy, and the service is not always on point. (I actually find that the service is usually better than some other Asian places. Some in Cali are truly AWFUL.) It is, in my opinion, usually brisk, to the point, and gets things done. I don't often have to wait for my water to be filled or feel like I've been ignored when it comes to being seated. But they're not smiling at you making conversation about how your mani-pedi just went. This isn't that kind of place. Same with the facilities. It's not disgusting. The bathrooms are clean and dry, there's always tons of TP and soap and it doesn't smell. But there are cleaner, newer places around. If that icks you out, go find one of those nice new Pho places in Scottsdale. This place isn't for you.  The food is, in general, outstanding. It's got one of the best ranges of Vietnamese food that I've seen. Most places just serve Pho, and that's it. But they have amazing beef stew, bun rieu, banh mi... I checked out their banh xeo here after my vietmanese coworker said that's his favorite thing, and it's the best I've had so far. So crispy it shatters, with tons of flavor in the dip and great toppings. My husband always has to take away their liver spread banh mi after we've come here. Their spring rolls are fresh. And it's all cheap. We can get an appetizer, drinks, dessert, noodles, and banh mi to go for $35, including tax and tip. The only dud for me was the bun bo hue. Bland and disappointing, there are places that make it better.   And the proof is in the pudding. This place is almost always busy. I get my food quickly, it's hot and good, and you get taken care of well. If that's all you need, then this is your place for Vietnamese food. If you need cute decor, spick and span facilities and wait staff that all speak great english... then pass.

-KabP1QW5GmmOAwQTvccRg.text: Just go. Take a ton of friends. You can't get a better dinner for a better price. My favorite is the pork bun. It's filled with savory ground and shredded pork, and boild egg. The dough is so fluffy and tender, I can't describe it. I haven't had anything here that I didn't enjoy. We go with family and order lots of tasty items to share.

CZmCRiIYmjdSjfGWPT8suA.text: Da Vang is awesome.  I have not been back to Phoenix for a few years.  Just came back this week and the food here is still as good as I remember...  Awesome place.  Great Vietnamese food...  Friendly staff...  Not in a great neighborhood, but, definitely worth the trip...

9GnRnnlWQ7nemmSMuLqnuQ.text: I love Da Vang! I always order the lemon grass chicken, but have found myself forced to veer from it when they run out of it.  From what I can tell, the meat is low quality (hence the great low prices), but still prepared to be totally tasty!  Service is not especially speedy or friendly, but given the atmosphere, that is to be expected.

wx2qqdAq4hXnLqkf1kHK6A.text: My standard lunch order is BBQ pork spring rolls and sliced beef pho. Consistently great. Have had many a bowl of pho across the valley but Da Vang is easily my favorite. Do not expect the servers world to revolve around you but do not interpret it as rude or lackadaisical either. I am convinced it is merely a difference in culture. That being said, you are promptly seated, attended to and served. What more can you ask for?

OOtEzob8tuLVt5zozOLDsw.text: Love this place cheap n good! Don't expect much service though

09RrtQpTVM74HA-aMmeRHQ.text: I had the best lunch ever in the history of lunches at Da Vang today!  So many nice things have  been said about Da Vang in other reviews, so I won't repeat the details, except that it is good, fresh, and cheap.  Every time, without fail.  I've been there often, and just realized today that I hadn't reviewed it.  Atmosphere?  It's a room with some tables, no frills, but who cares?  Service is purely functional, no chit-chat or pleasantries - fine with me.  Bring on the pho, or rice stick noodles or stew, or .....drum roll please... the rice soup with fish.  That's menu item 61B.  They use lemon grass in it, and must put in a pound of lovely, perfectly cooked cod.  It's heavenly, and takes a little longer than most items to make so be prepared.

MBZly7er8_jIFBF82utYFg.text: Oh my, I truly hate to do this, but my visit to Da Vang was horrid! After reading all the lovely reviews I was so excited to take my husband and child to a place near our new digs, to prove that we hadn't moved far away from good food experiences. We knew that the outside was a strip mall locale, we don't care. We knew the inside was going to look like it did, we don't care. We go to places because of food, service and price.   When we went they were working on the one entrance so we entered on the far side. There were two people eating and a few children running about playing. My first thought was great, this is a friendly, family place and light crowd would mean attentive service. We didn't know if we should seat ourselves, so we walked to the silverware table where we saw menu's and stood for a moment.  Three times servers walked right past us and ignored our presence. Other workers were in the kitchen area, but no one noticed us.   I whispered, "Maybe we should get menus and just sit down?" So we took three menu's and as I turned around one of the servers came up and made motion for us to sit right there at this huge circle table.  A very large table, but we slid into the corner and he took drink orders from us then dissappeared.  We sat. We sat some more. He walked by twice carrying water. Another server walked by twice, once with food, once with dishes. They greeted two more tables and brought them menus and took their orders. A server came and poured three water glasses for our table and I interrupted him asking about our drink order. He said something I didn't understand and turned away.  We sat.   Finally I said, "Excuse me, please..." I got the attention of a different server and we asked about our drink order which he took again and we didn't want to wait any longer and gave our food order as well. Just in case they'd never come back. I told the server we were new to this cuisine and would need some help. My husband just wanted to leave. I coerced him to stay, it's going to be fabulous Pho I said remembering the wonderful Yelp reviews. The food would soothe him. I smiled smugly. We ordered several dishes all recommended in Yelp reviews. Spring rolls, two Pho's and the Ban Xeo for my egg and shrimp loving child.  15 minutes later two drinks and some plates of leaves and garnishes were placed on the table. No drink for me and no way to get the garnish plate persons attention. We sat. "Are we supposed to eat these," asked my husband?  I said , "I believe they go in the soup when it comes." But after another 15 minutes of nothing else arriving, he started to make a mini salad. Several more tables had come in, everyone else had their food. The two tables who came after us were finishing up.  "This is Bullshit, " I muttered to my husband, and just then the crepe and the Pho's came out. I was starting to see a trend here. Just when you get to the point where you want to leave they finally do something to make you stay. We were starving and we didn't want to drive around for another place, just eat and go at this point. It was getting late. I hadn't eaten my garnishes so I shared them with my husband. My daughter's crepe was extra crispy bordering on too dark and she didn't know how to eat it, so she sort of plucked the little shrimps she found out of it.  "It's not egg mom", she said all grumbly. "It's Vietmanese egg I said, " as if I knew.   "Well then I don't like Vietmanese food." Sigh. Maybe she would like and try the spring roll? Or some of my soup? The sping roll, one nibble. She didn't appreciate it, which was ok with me becuase I loved them.My husbands Pho was full of fatty gristle meat and he w/couldn't eat any of it.  My Pho was wonderful! My garnishes made it very tasty.   So I fed my daughter some Pho, but she wasn't too fond of that either.  The only real consolation was the price. It cost about $25 for everything we got and everything we didn't.  Maybe I can get someone from Yelp who loves Da Vang to come with us next time and show us how the experience is SUPPOSED to be, becuase I can't imagine this is what people are raving over. Sorry. They get two stars for having a low price and food *I* liked, but I can't give them any more than that.

oj9VC3XvqlZLEeJHUar_Yw.text: Get the Spicy Lemongrass with Beef. Awesome! And one of a kind. Service is usually fast and pretty friendly too. Been coming here since 2007.

EEW4ZHa-s-i2FxaHQ5Brfw.text: $4.50 for a huge bowl of incredibly good Vietnamese soup noodles? Oh Da Vang how I miss you!  #21, #26, #36 (or was that #32?), and let's not forget the cafe sua da.  Over the years I've eaten at most of the Vietnamese restaurants in Phoenix and in the end I've always come back to Da Vang.

s4elRnUuliF7iwcpizD_Og.text: This place has become my favorite Pho in the area. It's not the kind of place you would take a date, well unless you knew them well and they like pho but the food here is awesome and it's very inexpensive. I'd say -1 for atmosphere but +2 for the food. Every time I go here they are fairly busy but there is always a table available. It's quickly becoming my favorite lunch hangout. I give two thumbs up, Vietnamese hole in da wall pho at it's best!

OjhlCGweLyrLfnlOiPWAqw.text: Divey. Authentic. Awesome spring rolls. Cleaner than what I expected from the reviews. Not happy they use MSG, but my body didn't react to it as it normally does so I wonder if they really do. I got pho with chicken stuff in it. It was a bit too authentic for me, to be honest. I haven't decided if I'll go back yet, because I don't know jack squat about Vietnamese food and it was hard deciding on what to pick other than the spring rolls, considering the effort it took me to get there. It's a walk of about 3 blocks from the Camelback-19th Ave train station, which as I like to say is something I don't recommend at night in this part of town unless you're Chuck Norris. The service was really friendly and I enjoyed the fact that it was packed with Vietnamese customers, family and friends. A fun cultural experience but just not sure if I'll return for the food.

nZajV9-FNtdSJbkGk2Ahow.text: Found a roach in my drink today. YUM YUM! I didn't make a big deal, I expect bugs in my food no matter where I eat. They brought me another. I was more upset by the fact that I my pho bowl looked smaller, or did my stomach get bigger?

5yXjcHG_GsBj8bp4NnIGzQ.text: For Vietnamese food, I am used to eating at the hole in the walls in Little Saigon in Orange County, CA, and I wasn't expecting to be impressed by this place.  Fortunately, I was.  Da Vang would complete favorably with most of the hole in the walls in Little Saigon.  The shrimp spring rolls are fantastic starters, the soups are all great, and the seafood dishes are well prepared.  The only negative I had was with the baguette sandwiches where the bread tends to be dry and the bbq fillings overly sweet.  The place is a hole in the wall, so don't expect ambiance, since there isn't any.  I have had no problems with service, and I have probably eaten her 10-12 times.

tm8tV1uKyUqW88dD1O080g.text: so I recenlty returned from a trip back home (Seattle) and forgot how much I loved Vietnamese food. I moved to Italy for a long time, and moved down to AZ so I hadn't had Vietnamese food for a looong time. Have been wanting to check out Da Vang for a while now, but kept it on the "places to try" list. Decided to go check it out as soon as I got off the place from Seattle and BOY WAS I HAPPY!   I got the Pho 1 with the Beef, Tendon, Tripe. This was just like being back at home where there is a Pho shop on prety much every corner. I ended uip going back a few days later and getting a Banh Mi (gread BBQ pork sandwich) which was the best I'd ever had, along with a few appetizers. The fresh spring rolls were gret, and just over 2 bucks. We also got the BBQ pork appetizer with Rice Paper which was nice, we caould make our own spring rolls. Wifey chickedned out and got fried rice, which wasn't very good.  overll, this place rocks.

JwwZVYG85Jb4JUrm6ZPZXw.text: This place is hands down the best pho I've ever had. If you know of a better place please let me know....Great flavor and price, can't beat it. The place is a little dirty but that's the way a pho place is suppose to be.

2Og_Xz2jZzogQKTjmVuuKg.text: Me and the GF went here for dinner last night. Have had a cold all week she brought home from NYC. Their pho broth is probably the best in town. Spring rolls are also tasty (but I like the ones at Pho Bang better). Always have to pig my way through the Ban Xeo, wonderful egg crepe with pork, shrimp and bean sprouts. Wrap in the greens, dunk in fish sauce, and enjoy as all the happy points in your brain lite up. 2 orders of spring rolls, 2 orders of pho, 2 teas and the crepe=20 bucks of bliss. One kvetch for this trip: we ordered 3A I think, and while the brisket was excellent, the flank(?) was a tad too done and tough. Even with that, I still give them top marks.

gkWQCNL5DkOkC36CX1F3DQ.text: YUM!!! pho here is amazing good, the best I've had in AZ so far. The service is ok i guess, not the best, Price is pretty cheap, not expensive. Absolutely love the spring rolls here, can't beat them.

Dt9OvTe42PYPIHIIgdLqsA.text: This is the best Vietnamese Restaurant in the valley! First off, their prices can not be beat!!! You get awesome portions, and it always seems like you are paying less than what you should really be paying for what they give you! I love their fresh spring rolls, I always order mine without shrimp and it's always made to order! Some places I go to come out in a heart beat and the wrapper is always hard, you can tell it's been sitting in the fridge.  I also would recommend their BBQ beef or Pork with rice, marinated so deliciously!! Add a fried egg on top for an extra charge but so worth it =) ALL of their Banh Mi (vietnamese sandwiches are great! Their vietnamese iced coffee is as strong as I want coffee to be so yummy with condensed milk! Go give it a shot! Don't expect the best service here, but the food makes up- for it! And if you don't like the food here, at least you didn't spend that much (trust me) that's how cheap it is!!

GqvQqw58H7vMI1Gai70-4g.text: Da Vang is nothing new to me. I've been coming here for awhile now. I frequently visit Da Vang, at least once a week. I'm giving it 5 stars for the Pho, fried spring rolls, and bbq bhan mi.The reason my overall rating is 4 stars is because of the fact that its hard to get passed the overall environment. Kinda slumpy, dingy, and the waiters are pretty forward, showing very little personality, which in a way makes it more authentic. Next time you go visit Da Vang, order the #1 no tripe, #50 and the #75 and there is no way you will be disappointed, especially since you will still some how spend under 10 bucks.

WGHBFdJsPDbWAH68Dm3y0Q.text: I've been here a few times and love the place.  The staff is ultra-friendly (especially my first time there) and the food is nice and light.  I love love LOVE the summer rolls!  Also, there are several different types of sauces for you to customize your noodles.

LFJpcSsv6ltzf9caxCmkZQ.text: Very good Pho at a very good price. Two of us ate there for only $10! It's a must try if you don't mind the little hole in the wall places in the middle of the ghetto - but have good food. thumbs up!

CCr8lE4nFj6mqEnzhHjhUg.text: Coming from LA to visit Phoenix, I wanted to try the local Pho.  I have eaten at numerous Pho places in Los Angeles area and was dying to hear what all the rave was about.  I picked "DA VANG" because of the great reviews.  All i have to say was that this placed literally sucked.  The service was horrible. The waiters took our order then took almost 20 mins to get our food. I don't know if they cared that their customers came to eat and were hungry.  Second, the food that arrived was overcooked. The meat was hard, the beef tendons were obviously old and the soup was too sweet.  Overall, if you want pho, try some other place. If you're in Los angeles, I can recommend tons of great places that are fraction of the price with great service.    Overall, Da Vang was a horrible experience, overpriced, bad food, bad experience. I will never go back to this place.

aUWWK4D8FBMax2q4J9NYvQ.text: most authentic, you see many vietnamese eating there.  very friendly.  huge bowls of pho and great spring rolls, fresh coconut iced tea but they sometimes run out.

L44rWsPsECLisydRI_wMZw.text: This place is my second favorite place to get pho in  Phoenix (Pho 68 being number 1). If you come here expect the broth to be oily, or as my girlfriend put it extremely buttery. I loved the broth because it was a drastic change from my usual place, and it was very tasty. They also have an array of international sodas which you should try, stay away from the egg york though.

Gqez86xy8Yi_MssfHQ0Rtg.text: The only reason why I didn't give it 5 stars is this place is the hole in the wall.  Pretty much the hole was made by a wrecking ball.  The food is awesome and and very tasty and authentic.  Don't expect too much on view.

YoCcOlUJl6-RcsZCfdtDTA.text: Talk about authentic, this is a place I would be excited to take a Vietnamese foreign exchange student, not because I want to impress them, but so they can translate the menu and get the waiter to bring me another $2.50 beer.  I will say, I was a little disappointed that there were no vegetarian pho options, but I don't think authentic pho is vegetarian, so until I learn to say "can I get this without beef" in Vietnamese, I don't deserve it. I will stick with the few veggie options provided, which are delicious, ridiculously cheap, and easily enough for two meals.

-U6CWQmfy6w4FHtGsYsDhA.text: This place is located at a somewhat "ghetto" area with no decoration, but overall environment is clean with friendly staff.   The menu is authentic with unbeatable price. Their order of spring roll with egg and pork are two for $2.50. Their Egg Sandwich with two sunny side up and Asian pickles are $2.50. Most their noddle dishes are around $5. I usually get two appetizers with one entree for about $10 or so. If you feel trying something adventurous, they also have some authentic exciting items such as duck with sour bamboo soup and such.   They are very good at accommodating your needs. My vegetarian friend got her Tofu Egg Roll and Veggie Pho was super pleased and has visited the place many times since then all the way from Tempe.   I just want to say this place is truly un"PHO"gettable~

zKchTlczbmkbzpnZBU-HKA.text: This is the hole in the wall Vietnamese place that i love in every city. Located in a strip mall, Da Vang has great pho and cheap prices. Go here, eat somethng, and be happy.

HlhXBLi8dkVh2tbm4XetIA.text: Since they have known me already, my service have got much better than it used to be.  The periodically have steam pork bun on sale which is a True delight.  This time I've ordered 2 Che (ice dessert) which are made of sweet mung bean, seaweed and lotus seeds..Another came with red bean and sweet coconut which is a utter delight.  This place also offer hot pot at very reasonable price and I even seen Mexican patrons order it.  It has won New City Best Vietnamese Restaurant and it is well deserved.  People needs to know that you pay at the cash register on your way out which was the way they done it in Asia.  This establishment is time tested and is here to stay for good.  Not many places will say that since most restaurant in the Valley will fold less than 3 years and it has endured a good 20+ years.  That is always a gold seal of approval for me

YL5LALm_B5RyUTiWc449sg.text: Normally my favorite neighborhood spot with fantastic food at a great value.  However, today i was totally embarrassed bringing a friend to lunch there. I tried to put all cultural differences aside, but the floors were filthy, an older woman seated with her family had her shoes off and was rubbing her feet on the floor, while a young couple across the way was eating as Mom was brushing knots out of her 7 year old daughter's hair and putting rubberbands from her mouth in her braids.   Lost my appetite.  Not certain I will ever go back and I feel terrible to say it since its such a wonderful Mom n Pop establishment and they are so friendly.

-VAo2YG3dDuwppBQVtq-hg.text: Amazing authentic vietnamese food. Not to mention it's very cheap! Love it! I recommend the Pho... Delicious! It reminds me of the little restaurants that dot the streets in Vietnam.

h0Dy8PoyohMdOOCEQz-Z0Q.text: Use to go here alot growing up but stopped when I ordered a huge amount of spring rolls for a work pot luck.  People were excited as they knew what spring rolls were. They cut it in half for me but when we opened it, there were tiny ants crawling out of the noodles!  I proceeded to contact the food inspection authorities and found other complaints on their website from the general public.  I can't believe I had been eating here for the last 10+ years even when they had no AC (one summer) or would sometime run out of the dish that I ordered!  I'm Vietnamese so I have gone to plenty of hole-in-the-wall restaurants and they were great and so was Da Vang until my incident and reading those other complaints.  My appetite is gone for them.

sBXWT_SJ9LQ-5O457js6Xg.text: I've been coming here since I was young and I adore it here. The pho is always great and the drinks are wonderful! I love drinking the red bean coconut dessert for my beverage and they are usually prompt with the timing. However, the other stuff may get a bit pricey, so thus the 4 stars. But it's all worth it :-)

Q2MZMMqYmYQlE3xxc844TQ.text: Some of the best pho I have ever eaten was consumed at Da Vangs. All the produce was super fresh and the wait staff were friendly and attentive. All 4 of us left, stuffed, for $43 including a tip. Minus 1 star for not serving beer/wine. They used to.

QgIBuOIPsKqQOgaoudwilw.text: You get what you pay for... The food is ok but consistent. But it's dirt cheap to eat there! So you can get stuffed for 20 bucks and still have leftovers for another meal or two...

R1-XMzlkFhJ8n_pL_w3eug.text: My favorite pho place in the valley!! I got 2 bowls of soup and an amazingly delicious iced coffee for my friend and I for 13 bucks! It's a must try:)

e8ufpfj79wxNdTAcZwkkOw.text: First time here. Will come back:) I loved the prices!!! Loved the spring rolls! The pho was incredible. Love to see my meat cook right in front of me. There were minor cons which weren't enough for me to not come back again. They had ran out of Thai tea which I was looking forward to having, they don't use cilantro as the condiments (love having cilantro in my pho), and last no boba. The fried rice was a little to "eggy" for my taste but still was okay. But like I mentioned the prices were awesome and they were attentive if we needed anything even while it was busy. It did take a while to get the check but we weren't in a hurry and if we wanted it sooner I'm sure we could have walked up to the counter and get it. I had the dessert with the mung bean and coconut milk with ice and was delicious! I am looking forward to trying the other desserts. Til next time...

2S4D9w79q-orXmCEgNAiWg.text: After a recent trip to Seattle, my husband has been on an Asian food kick which encouraged him to finally try this place. On his 3rd or 4th time eating there, he convinced me to order take-out. Normally, it  hadn't taken long to get his food in the past but this time, we sat in the parking lot for over a half hour. Apparently, everyone had to wait awhile. I ordered the chicken/shrimp fried rice that was extremely flavorless and dry. So disappointing as I haven't had a good fried rice in awhile. My husband ordered banh-mi, spring rolls and another app that you basically put together (pork, vermicelli noodles, lettuce). I loved the banh-mi which was a sandwhich on a type of hoagie roll with pork, mayo, shredded carrot, cucumber and peppers. I was so surprised at how much I loved the sandwhich. The sandwiches are $2.25 and our whole bill was approx $17. I didn't exactly enjoy my meal but I think this place is definitely worth a try. Everyone has their off nights, right?

aYMQR7aJ3ecEMEWe6RcZNg.text: Pho makes me warm and cozy on the inside and makes my nose run on the outside. I love the authentic environment. Mmmmmmmmmmm.

zAmDzk3FibrCErMMLKT8vg.text: Had the beef and white onion very flavorfull and ordered the coffee as well. Vietnamese coffee is very strong but really good a.must try for coffee lovers

H5WG40K0c1cudH7TQxTqrg.text: After spending several minutes looking at the menu i was ready to order.  The first five things I pointed too was not available.  BOO.  Food is cheap and portions is decent.  But I won't be back.

J7SrMPbLRODxvzvpcjA_gQ.text: Very good place for a comfort-sort of soup and sandwiches.  The pho and the beef stew are big, inexpensive, and the meats are not skimped. Whether it's the #1 pho, #7 stew, or the one with the seafood I get warmed by the broth, satisfied by the different cuts of meat, and filled up with the noodles.   The #50 deep fried egg rolls are good and the BBQ pork spring rolls are very tasty. Occasionally I get the coffee with cream - I think it's much better than any of the chain coffee places. The banh mi used to have amazing, flaky French bread and now it's just okay. But the BBQ pork #75 with fish sauce, hoisin sauce, and Sriracha is still yummy to the tummy.  There is no decor. The service can be trying but it has gotten better in the last year or so. Twice in about 50 times have they forgotten my order. You just have to be aware and speak up when something isn't right. I used to go here once a week for 2-3 years about 4 years ago.  The place is all about the food. And I'm all about their food.

kObWfqk5R2OruFVCioSgkQ.text: Disappointing, disappointing, disappointing!! For the first time, I didn't finish a Vietnamese sub.   They call that banh mi? If their pho is as off-base as their banh mi, it must be made with linguini. Though the price was right ($4 for a sub and a big steamed bun), everything else was wrong. The bread seemed like it was cut from a cheap grocery store French bread, the veggies weren't properly pickled, and it was just.....boring. The pork was tasty, but I asked for BBQ pork and I'm pretty sure that was lemongrass grilled pork. Finally, the steamed ground pork bun was a little off. Not sure how else to describe it. This can't be Phoenix's best Vietnamese, so keep looking for it, hungry jack.

3vLa6yCkJbHk779bGDZjMA.text: No vegetarian pho or bah mi sandwiches, which was unfortunate. The staff was nice and found something they could prepare.

x872Xv7SUrihVE9of6tUfA.text: California has much better vermicelli. The fish oil had no flavor. The grilled pork wasn't seasoned like it should and the vermicelli not good.

mkQB4kNdehvYBPAPEXYnzQ.text: Yes.  Vietnamese food done correctly.  Cheap and easy to order.  If you're looking for a good bowl of Pho, they've got all of the staples you're looking for.  They also serve the traditional Vermicelli dishes.  Quantity is big, price is low and taste is spot on.  What more do you need?

-obu7O54-Ij0kTTNct9A7Q.text: This is truly a hidden gem. I only live 5 minutes away and have passed by this place on countless occasions. Stuck in an unpleasant looking plaza, I can imagine a lot of people, especially with Vietnamese food not being extremely popular in the area, passing this place on looks alone. Do not judge a book by its cover!  This place is amazing. The restaurant is much bigger inside than it appears. Plenty of seating, but always packed. The portions are huge and prices are excellent!  The menu is extremely vast, and may be confusing for people not used to this type of cuisine, but I highly recommend their XL Combo Pho.  Wash all of that goodness down with their freshly made soy milk.

oCZzbHCOChuN0xGgbn7V6A.text: Have had lunch here several times. The food is very good, you are served very quickly and the prices are cheap! The over all place is kinda divey, and is located in a small strip mall with very small parking. Being said, there is always a line when I  have gone and will continue to go. I recommend the Pho and the spring rolls. Very flavorful.

QlFSW_rIhtk486NRYgjEDg.text: AMBIANCE: I am a big fan of Vietnamese food, but have avoided coming to this place because people kept saying it's a dive. Well, when I arrived, I didn't think it was any more divey than most of the outdated, awful Chinese restaurants in Phoenix. I walked out of Pho House on McDowell because it was "divey" and there was practically no one in there, but then again, that is a newer restaurant. This one was packed, however. The restaurant was open and bright and coming in from triple digit heat, well-air conditioned. So, the ambiance was quite comfortable. Later, it became almost too cold, but going back outside was nice.  FOOD: We started out with crispy egg rolls, which were crunchy, hot and delicious, and the shrimp spring rolls, which were loaded with cooked, cold rice noodles, veggies, and shrimp wrapped in a delicate, thin soft rice paper. We also got an appetizer (don't remember name) that looked like dolmas, cooked pork in grape leaves, that you build yourself into a roll by wetting the rice paper and loading with the fresh vegetables. Btw, I love that you get so much lettuce, mint, seasoned vermicelli noodles, cucumbers, etc. to add to whatever you get...very nice. And don't forget to add the fish sauce and any of the multitude of other sweet, savory, and spicy sauces and pastes, Sriracha included. I had the #39, which is broken rice with BBQ pork, shrimp cake, a couple cooked shrimp, meatball, and fried egg. I wanted a mixture of different things and this dish delivered. My only complaint would be that the individual shrimps were way overcooked, but this didn't ruin my experience because everything else just shined in a major way.   SERVICE: It is apparent that everything is cooked to order and not just dumped from a can or stir fried from a frozen bag. Therefore, not all your dishes may come out at the same time. In fact, I really enjoyed the staggering of appetizers so that I could enjoy each one individually. But the service is efficient and always moving amongst an almost packed restaurant of tables. The server that took our order was very friendly and was able to recommend dishes and another server was able to help me identify something on another table that looked very good (the pork ribs, which I will try next time).  In conclusion, thanks to my friends for encouraging me to finally try this place. The prices are extremely reasonable, so I don't care if they don't have fresh paint, music, or whatever to entice me because the food is the star attraction and what my senses are tuned into here. The ingredients are fresh, there are a ton of Asians, and it's just a good time. I will certainly be back for lunch or dinner and definitely will try the pho when I crave a hot soup. I'm not sure if I will try the other Vietnamese restaurants in Phoenix. I've already been to Rice Paper, which was just okay, but sometimes having something to compare to is good. But then again, when you find something amazing that you like, it's just a waste of time and money to try something else that may disappoint.

fvvCrr25VRN96o3rHZ_Nig.text: No ambiance or customer service, but excellent food at more than excellent prices.  I have tried various phos, com the rice dishes, apps, and bun the noodles. All are great and super inexpensive.

sJ_oea1nuWplEGfHDVWxrQ.text: Simply the best! Definitely one of my favorite places to eat in the Valley!!!  Once you eat here, no other Pho will do.  It definitely sets the standard! It is also very inexpensive at only around $4.50 for a decent sized bowl! The veggies for your soup also comes in generous servings!  If you love Pho, but have not tried this place, you must!

aIpmnQT95tMbE_JirdKiwQ.text: My favorite place in the town. :-) I love their #24. We went there after a meeting on new year and we ran into a group of friends. Chinese people only pay for the good food.   The price is good and the food is great. I found take out gets a bigger portion than eat in.

wckZjUDHtkm4IoTHuclPpw.text: To be fair, Vietnamese food isn't high on my list of must-haves.  In fact, every time I go there, before I even open my mouth to speak, the staff lets me know whether they have French bread for sandwiches, because I apparently order them all the time  (and didn't realize it till they said so).  Vietnamese food is overweighted towards soup and I'm not a huge soup fan.  I'm especially not a huge fan of this place's soups:  either a clear broth loaded down with noodles or something oily and heavy.  The Mi Xao Don and Mi Xao Men are the closest things to stir fry, but come with either fried noodles or actual noodles instead of rice.  But it makes no difference:  it's watery and heavy on basic vegetables with little real meat.  Most of the other "main" dishes are rice-heavy.  But this isn't the restaurant's fault:  if you know Vietnamese food, then you know Vietnamese food means "rice and ..."  or "soup"  (Pho).  Now, let's go to what this uncultured Westerner DOES like:    The sandwiches are to DIE for:  simple, sandwich sized French bread stuffed with jalapenos, cucumber, pate, mint and mayo.  Or maybe one with an omelette.  There are a number of different sandwiches and while the two I mention above are my favorite, any of the others will hardly disappoint.  The spring rolls are always fresh and crisp; the egg roll is more like a Chinese "spring roll"  (while the Vietnamese spring roll is nothing like you've had before:  lettuce and shrimp --- or pork --- wrapped in rice paper ... I call them "alien rolls")..  The egg roll usually comes VERY hot, so be careful.  Wrap it up in a lettuce leaf before eating, like the Vietnamese do and find yourself surprised at how well those go together!  As far as beverages go, I can't stress how good their "Thai Tea"s are.  Easily as good as in any Thai place and priced unbeatably low.  In fact, this restaurant has two things going for it:  very low priced, but very authentic food and, of course, being low priced, it's a good value.  When you see that a large percentage of the clientele eating here is Vietnamese, that should be a clue as to what their own people think of the food.  Now, one must have a bit of a strong stomach to eat here.  It's not the cleanest of places; very basic furniture and fixtures, and the tables so close together as to make the dining experience almost communal  (Ho Chi Minh would have been proud of this Socialist experiment in seating).  Kids are frequently here and frequently loud.  Apparently, there's an unwritten rule, that any visit to this Vietnamese restaurant must have children under two in attendance and they must scream or at least throw noodles on the floor.  You've been warned:  don't show up here in a formal gown and leave one star, because you didn't realize you'd be eating in what can best be described as a former electronics store after all its furniture's been repossessed.  And just so you know, that other loud "noise" you hear is the wait staff screaming at each other in Vietnamese like hot dog sellers in a stadium.  Don't worry:  eventually, you'll be too distracted trying to figure out what that food is in front of you to notice it at all.  Overall, despite the negative sounding review, good food if you like Vietnamese; not good at all if you're expecting something similar to Thai or Chinese  (not even close).  Helpful staff  (though one time, I sat for 50 minutes while my partner ate only to be told they forgot I ordered a sandwich).  Dinner for two rarely hits about $25 and we're talking a LOT of food for that.  Cleanliness could be better, but we're not talking about a street stall in downtown Saigon with mopeds racing by.  Oh, and as long as we're on the subject of vehicles:  be prepared for an overcrowded parking lot with unusual parking.  Apparently, some Vietnamese believe that parking in the lines  (or on the street, for that matter) is optional.  Oh, and one other warning:  they tend to close early (8pm) most nights, so don't dilly dally putting on your stockings.  The traffic on I-17 getting there can be murder.

2fH2CauQ734tYyt_nyPxGg.text: I go here at least 1 a week with my wife.  I get the meatball Pho along with the BBQ pork Bahn Mi.  The food is great, cheap, and quick.  The staff is friendly, not in your typically way, but they do a good job.  Da Vang has become of my favorite places period in Phoenix.

AdzvA5uv8fiyCrqTryqt9A.text: Alrighty, this place is extremely legitimate. Large authentic Vietnamese menu, smiling faces for service, FAST SERVICE, EXCELLENT ON POINT CUISINE, and excellent excellent excellent pricing. Makes me wish this place was right next door! I would be coming more often. Probably every day or other day at that. The herbs were fresh and aplenty, and the condiment to-go station was well organized to do it yourself. Great dessert options for authentic Vietnamese choices. Apparently, my girlfriend tells me this area is Vietnamese-ville? I don't know, but the prices for great Vietnamese food in Tempe and Scottsdale is WAYYY more... and the menus in these cities I've found don't even touch the menu that is offered here. Here, its way more extensive. Two appetizers, and two main dishes was $21. There was take home too! OH YUMMM! BTW growing up being "Asian" myself, and eating authentic pho every week in China Town Honolulu makes me a good judge of good Vietnamese food... ;)

1iKZJIaIF_Qs74SOFXAVcw.text: One of my all times favorite restaurant regardless of price.  All i have to say is go there and try it.  Always delicious!  Always a treat!

G7QTalMmuLwu1X0xhxcArw.text: I went sunday and everything was delicoius. Try the thai tea and the lemongrass beef witb fried rice is delicious. The eggrolls too, they have a perfect crinchy. Yummmmy!!!!

QUm5aCBoGNgBtIOhEbZwNQ.text: I love Pho. Yes I pronounce it right. "F-UH" I have been an aPhocianado for quite a while. In Vancouver, I lived near Kingsway aka Pho-alley where it was like little Vietnam: Starbucks: 0.  Pho places: a plethura. Some even right next to each other 'cuz like any good Pho lover knows each shop has its own broth style. I can't say that Da Vang is the best I've ever had, because it's not. I can say that I have been there about a dozen times because it's good and consistent. Great prices, good selection for the more adventurous and it's always really busy with Asians of all ilks including Vietnamese (good sign) and everyone else. That isn't due to it being a tiny hole-in-the-wall: it's huge inside. Busy=high turn-over which means fresh food. Now it has all of the typical elements one comes to expect in a Pho place: emotionless but prompt service, divey atmosphere and horrible bathrooms; all fine by mean as long as the pho pleases. It does at Da Vang.  I'm always suspicious of any pho place that's quiet, super clean and empty. Give me busy and a tad gross any day.  My wife and I were brought that much closer together thanks to our mutual love of this delicious soup. We often had Pho for breakfast when we were first dating. Any woman willing to have pho as a cornerstone to a scrumptious breakfast rates highly in my book! If you're new to Phoenix and need a little comPHOrt, look no further than Da Vang!

jDrLYIpMRzl-rC_ell3ggA.text: I tried this place when first relocating to the Melrose area and was satisfied with their pho. Their Pho is flavorful and spring rolls were great as well. It's not the best I've tried and I've taken a couple of people to this place and have agreed that It's good but not GREAT!

rYA1owDaNlgH8FMlcQtYZg.text: Oh this hurts.  I was so very excited to check out Da Vang as I am a Vietnamese food nut and have longed to find a decent joint here in the valley. Da Vang is not that place.  Let me clear this up first. When I say that I'm a Vietnamese food nut I am not joking. I used to eat Vietnamese two or three times a week, there were eight (!) Vietnamese restaurants within a block of my house back home, my best friend is Vietnamese and his mother and sister cook for me when I go back for a visit. I know my Bun from my Banh, Pho realz.  Let's start with the good. The Bun was indeed tasty, well prepared and inexpensive like Bun should be.  Now for the bad. The service was terrible, they were out of bbq pork, they mixed up the salt and sugar in my drink (a briny drink is not where it's at, fyi) and their Banh Xeo was an abomination that likely would have begged for death if it could speak.  I wish that I could say that I had found my Vietnamese oasis in the dull and bland desert but I have not. My search continues and so should yours.

DOFe8wiHqXiVDNojei2UVA.text: My friend Sage and I ate here this evening because we wanted to try some Vietnamese cuisine.  I've heard good things about this place on yelp, so we decided to have dinner here.  I'm sorry, but this place is sad!  I hate giving 2 star ratings especially if it's a family owned business, but their service needs improvement!  When we sat down, nobody bothered to check on us or even offer us water.  After waiting and being ignored for about 5 minutes, we finally waved someone to give us water . Our waiter seemed a little impatient and when we ordered our drinks, the server just threw our beverages on the table, turned around and then walked away.  We were like, what is his problem? Maybe he had a long day, but that's no excuse!  When he finally took our order, half of the things I ordered weren't available. He kept saying they ran out and he seemed very short with me. Then why put 100 items in the menu if half of the items are not available? I am always nice to service industry, but this dude didn't even bother suggesting an alternate selection. Sage ordered a beef pho and I ordered a vegetarian noodle with tofu and vegetables. This place is not vegan friendly and all their pho is made with beef stock. Most of their dishes either contains animal tendons, pigs blood, tripe and other things i couldn't identify.    Then when we got our food, he didn't even bother to check on us to see if everything was satisfactory.  I don't know why this place get 5 stars. It's not even a 5 star restaurant. It's in a sketchy strip mall and the restaurant is dirty. Stained ceilings and filthy floors. I would be scared to find out what the kitchen looks like.  Sure you get good value for your money and they give you large portions, but the service and atmosphere left much to be desired.

YUDaqUSK_pubwzJcBRuevQ.text: Very cheap and tasty vietnamese restaurant. Always packed with a line though. Staff were nice and quick to service you. I had pho with duck soyp and it was just marvelous! We always order fresh sping rolls which are a sure thing to have. We saw the next table order rice with bbq pork and the portion was HUGE and it was below $6!!! Our pho comes in a large size as well. My favourite place for vietnamese food!!!

3zNW-BK3YlJnGBdCxpE46g.text: Been here 3x and no beef #45, will stop coming; what's the point if it's always out. Take it off the menu since it's never available. Portions getting smaller, prices going up. And the table that came after us got to order first.

Photo of Da Vang Restaurant - Phoenix, AZ, United States. see the little bug in the wall by table 16? one of the reasons why they got 2 stars with my updated review, so repulsed i forgot to post pic

FGfCLSxYbPdtAVYHtRud7w.text: Exquisite. Super quick and polite family owned establishment. Just wish they were open a little later in the day.

i_Z-wK5WiQnFTtno05OP_A.text: Omigawd I would probably starve to death if it wasn't for this place. Of course their pho is spot on, I get the thin sliced beef, but 47B on their menu is BOMB! Give it a try. Oh and when you walk in they have a table set up with individually wrapped deserts/treats. The two that I recommended is some kind of banana thing cut into squares, I'm sorry I don't know what it's called I only know what it looks like lol. And then I recommend this thing called yellow bean. I'm sure that's not the Vietnamese name but when I asked the lady what it was called and she repeated it like three times and I still didn't know what she was saying, then she said yellow bean and I understood  that lol! Hysterical!  Great place, love it there!

iiOP_z7v0Qf4yDgCmenHTw.text: I've been coming to good old Da Vang for 10+ years now.  I first stumbled upon this eatery when my high school friends [did I just age myself?] took me here for lunch.  It was love at first bite~  The food is cheap, plentiful, and extremely tasty.  While the parking lot isn't in the best shape and the restaurant itself is as alluring as a dumpy gas station, come for the food!  Just make sure you don't need to use the restroom...  ick!  Service here is decent.  They always try to speak Vietnamese to me even though I'm not Viet.    Anyways, give this little hole-on-the-wall a try!  The food definitely makes up for the lack of ambiance.

OEVHxSiR0hNs1JAkLcC3Zw.text: Looked around and this is the best restaurant for pho and other Vietnamese food. :) Went in for pho....good and fast customer service.  Inside was cleaned and well lit.

MB77y1bAHDz6t6JOsfiycQ.text: We decided to give Da Vang a shot one day. Instead of our usual Pho Thanh, since everyone always compares the two and notes how similar they are (& same family owns it, I believe). We ordered the Pho and a broken rice dish to share. We also ordered spring rolls and egg rolls for appetizers. Everything was standard Vietnamese fare, but nothing was outstanding. Comparing it to Pho Thanh, I liked the appetizers, eggrolls and spring rolls, here better but the main entrees (especially the grilled pork) at Pho Thanh better.

uLCUi1FIGwFYUoeTupqjZQ.text: Place is quite casual and since I m a quite informal and casual person so I kinda like it.   Food was unique, it was like a variation of Chinese food but Vietnamese style.   Pro Reasonably priced menu. Decent environment  Cons  There is only one restroom( keeping in mind that it has a capacity to accommodate 50 people. Takes a while to get the ordered item.

photos.caption: Photo of Da Vang Restaurant - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Biggest noodles I have ever seen and ate.
Photo of Da Vang Restaurant - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Leafs and vegetables to be used as topping.

zYPbi1xg0uP5OIRhbDeaMQ.text: We come here often, despite my stark lack of check in's because I suspect their restaurant walls are lead lined, or perhaps T-Mobile's crappy network doesn't reach 19th Avenue and Camelback?    Anyway, we do come here often.  I like their food, I like their prices and I like their service.  The food here is maybe a half a star less than the food at the other Viet place right up the street, but the service is a tad friendlier here and I have never, ever been approached for money by a panhandler in the parking lot at Da Vang, whereas I've never NOT been approached in the parking lot at the other place.    It's a simple as that, good food, great prices, friendly service and no gauntlet of panhandlers to brave in the parking lot.

-jNySxlJId5YvPqCwzc_Ig.text: The food was alright. Enjoyed the spring rolls and thought they were a good size. The BBQ meat and rice dish I ordered was okay but forgettable. I should have probably just ordered pho.

Jmltcm4qSCbmZB6RDCdtcA.text: Great food, the most authentic V beef soup in all the V restaurants I have been to. And really like how they pack the take out order. And every try was great, so please be open minded, and you may find something new you love.

rewjQFphI6bbvNDekedRGA.text: Horrible pho, meat was chewy and they barely gave me any meat  in the soup. After giving the soup a try I thought maybe there coconut macaroons they supposedly make from scratch would make me change my mind about this restaurant lol they were dreadful as well. If the owners of this place are reading this, I say you need to teach your chef how to make food or fire them.

nGXTsE_btvWMa77eAx5Kvg.text: This is one of my favorite places to eat pho. The prices are very reasonable and the portions are great. I would definitely recommend this place.

UKu3zUax9hfTsIx8smQ1wg.text: Best pho in Phoenix - I was about to give up too then found this gem. I come here only for the pho, it's always consistent in taste, and actually hot, being that I've had warm pho served before which is a letdown. Love this place! Worth the 20 min drive.

HdJ2Mi07SWiy92lcUNz8OQ.text: Great unassuming little place, while I'd consider it a bit of a "hole in the wall", it is clean and well presented. I'd much rather have fair prices and good food in a less than stellar environment.  Plus if you've actually been to Vietnam, you'd realize the grungier the place,the more authentic it is, but I digress.   Prices are cheap, really cheap. My wife ordered an egg noodle duck soup and I had a combination broken rice plate. My wife complained about the broth being a bit bland (but she always does, and restaurant soup broths are never as good as a homemade) but it was still very tasty. My broken rice dish (com) came with shredded pork, grilled pork, shrimp balls, egg cage and an egg over easy. While it wasn't quiet as good as I've had in Little Saigon in Garden Grove, CA it was still very tasty.  Lastly the staff were all very friendly and attentive ( a rarity in our experience with Vietnamese owned restaurants)

laKqVR4qzMox0Em67A9Qnw.text: Best Vietnamese food in town! Always friendly and usually very busy the staff at Da Vang goes the extra mile to make sure your meal is exactly what you wanted.

NBOgq6a_IKpevPjMi4PrOA.text: This was a fantastic find.  My kind of place.  A "hole in the wall" which serves great food at very reasonable prices.  This is a hole in the wall Vietnamese place.  Great food, including seafood Pho and sandwiches very cheap.    I'll be back.

U1IOXdB_OphxKUX1VZar-w.text: Unbelievably delicious food at very good prices. I can't even remember the last time I was able to get a great, filling meal for $6-7 and here, you truly can. The pho is a consensus Phoenix favorite and has gotten many good reviews from the Phoenix New Times and Yelpers alike, and for good reason. Pho places are really trendy right now, and popping up all over the place, but this one has been here forever and been making top notch pho the whole time.  If you typically get your pho from more anglicized places like Rice Paper and unPhogettable, try Da Vang. If you're used to having to use the usual pho fixings (sriracha, hoisin, jalapenos, etc.) to get flavorful broth, TRY DA VANG. The broth is extremely flavorful on its own, and in my view, really doesn't need any modification (though the usual fixings are provided). The Bahn Mi and spring rolls are also very tasty, even if not the best I've ever had. Solid Vietnamese coffee.  Now for the bad: service could be better. It may also depend on when you eat there, but I've been there several times where they didn't really check up on us, took a very long time to take our orders, or brought out our dishes at completely different times (not too fun for my friend, who had to watch me eat for 15 minutes before her food reached the table). Oddly enough, I found this was more True when the place was less busy for whatever reason. Also, if you or anyone in your party is vegetarian, you'll probably want to go somewhere else. Da Vang has a gigantic, hulking behemoth of a menu which has a grand total of 2 vegetarian items on it, and both are stir fry style dishes (no vegetarian pho). My friend found this out the hard way.  While we're on the topic of the menu, it's a little overwhelming and really could use some paring down. Years ago, having a huge menu may have appealed to people, but when you make certain items extremely well (see above), I think you're better off consolidating a bit and focusing on them. Personally, I almost always get pho, bahn mi, or spring rolls, and those seem to be the consensus strongest options.  Finally, yes, this place is dingy and perhaps somewhat sketchy-looking. The decor could use an update. None of that bothers me even slightly, but if you think it'd bother you, you may want to go somewhere else. Personally, I'll sit at tacky booths all day long if it keeps the pho under $6.

IOI7QW7mPgQxVNncUd55-g.text: Since Pho Thanh was closed today (Tuesday, their day off) I decided to give Da Vang another try. This time I ordered the rice vermicelli with grilled pork and shrimp paste slices. The dish was good but the service was slow, especially since I came here mid-afternoon, way after the lunch rush was over. So next time I need my Vietnamese food fix and it's a day other than Tuesday, I'll be headed for the nearby  Pho Thanh; for me, it has better food,  faster service, and more generous portions.

photos.caption: Photo of Da Vang Restaurant - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Rice vermicelli with grilled pork and shrimp paste.

ccRcpsGrTLisg0j2EUlxiQ.text: This is the best pho in town, family owned and staffed, the broth on their pho bowls is outstanding. Never had any issues with an order, and they really give you more food than what you paid for, especially in regards to quality.

pyvrwC4uAj9fpSHkHEPteg.text: Came here on a Saturday around 4pm. There wasn't any wait, due to the random time, but I'd say about half the tables inside were still taken. I came for one reason, and one reason only - a Banh Mi.  Quick story: about a year or two ago, someone brought some Banh Mi's in to work, and I was so put off by the way they looked (mushy, soggy, messy, funky smelling), that I never EVER wanted to try one. Fast forward to 2018, and another co-worker was telling me about how amazing they are. It took me some time, but I eventually came around.  So there I am, driving around in the middle of Phoenix, dead set on trying a Banh Mi. I did my research, I did my comparisons, and everything led me to Da Vang. The space is by no means "nice". If anything, it just seems like a typical hole-in-the-wall type of Asian restaurant, which I have no issue with. I had high expectations for this meal, and I was not let down. I got the spring rolls to start off, and everything about it was good. I can't explain what puts a spring roll high on my list, but this one is up there. Finally....the Banh Mi. I got the BBQ pork sandwich, and I ate every. single. crumb. I couldn't believe I spent the last two years in ignorance. Prices seem to be very very decent here ($3.75 for the sandwich?!)  Anyways. Highly recommend Da Vang based off my first Banh Mi experience. I'd definitely come back to try some of the other menu items, all of which looked delicious.

photos.caption: Photo of Da Vang Restaurant - Phoenix, AZ, United States

0s8GaSMb2pymtJ0IBwFyow.text: Came here for a late lunch after hearing a lot of good things about this place. Your typical vietnamese joint. Parking was easy, place is spacious, no fuss. Ordered the vermicelli with pork and eggrolls. Portions are big, food was good. No complaints, will be back without hesitation. Looking to try the pho next!

photos.caption: Photo of Da Vang Restaurant - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Vermicelli with pork and eggroll

L2qIOMxMDJaAluT79sFP0g.text: Everything here is good. EVERYTHING!  So let me just start with something special there. At the cashier area there's a table with baked goodies. If the green bread is there. Get it. It's gone by the end of the day. The guy only makes one batch a day and if it's gone it's gone. The bread is a tapioca bread with coconut flavoring. Maybe pandan?  Pho is hot and ready. Probably one of the better places in Phoenix. Can't go wrong there.  Spring rolls. Fresh. Has shrimp and pork. Their sauce isn't THAT special though. But still good.  Their sandwiches are a good price for a sandwich. They have different types from BBQ pork, deli cut, and eggs.  They have rice plates (broken rice). Can't go wrong. Recommend the chicken one.  Their desserts are awesome. I recommend the 3 color dessert if you're adventurous. They have coconut jello that is very refreshing.  Always my to go place when I need Vietnamese food!

ng089DXoRJucGVXaP9qXpg.text: On a trip to PHX from Tucson I had to get my viet food fix! I was debating between Da Vang and Pho Thanh (ate at Pho Thanh the last trip) and decided on Da Vang bc of the reviews and distance. We were greeted immediately and seated with orders taken in less than 5 minutes. I ordered the com tam special (broken rice) with spring rolls. My hubs got the beef vermicelli dish. The food came out in less than 10mins and were delicious! It definitely assuage my craving for decent viet food! I'm just a tad disappointed about the fish sauce that accompanied the dish--it was too watery/sweet. It needed more fish sauce to be honest but otherwise it hit the spot!

photos.caption: Photo of Da Vang Restaurant - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Number 39 and 32! Stir fry beef with vermicelli and the com tam special

QVYzQGjxsb-ode0gdkI_WA.text: Great choice in food, all tho they don't serve the pork sandwiches on Sunday was a bummer for me and Thai tea.   Priced very well for what we ordered.

T7kfoU3EqpZn7q5z1TVPcg.text: Such a tasty joint.  A total hole in the wall but loaded with people.  Come early or expect to wait for a seat.  This place is good for groups or for 2.  They have great catering options too.   All the parking out is for this place.  Come over for some good ol' Vietnamese food.

photos.caption: Photo of Da Vang Restaurant - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Best light and crispy Banh Xeo
Photo of Da Vang Restaurant - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Vietnamese Ice Coffee

ed7w_Qa7wlZImA_uiwoGpQ.text: Fast service and reasonable pricing. Big menu with plenty of dishes I had never tried before. Neat selection of desserts.

uw0hVIofakfzI7HPTj4Tqg.text: The food is hot and fresh here. I had the bun no Hue and hubby had the beef sauteed with spices and white rice. Staff was friendly and the service was very good. Feel very homey here.

photos.caption: Photo of Da Vang Restaurant - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Very good sautéed beef and bun bo hue here.

s2i7NM8P3ofR6qpyoNARmQ.text: The pho here is authentic as you can get. We've ordered other things on the menu and they are great as well. The restaurant seems super busy but there are enough tables to keep traffic flowing nicely! Do yourself a favor and order Vietnamese iced coffee to compliment your meal! You won't be disappointed.

photos.caption: Photo of Da Vang Restaurant - Phoenix, AZ, United States

VXzxE1j7lUtQ8bWfjR-fpw.text: Very good food and fair price. The owner is very friendly. I ordered Spring rolls and Ban Xeo and the vegetables were fresh. The bean sprouts were very fresh and hard unlike some other Vietnamese with soft soggy bean sprouts. The service was fast and good for a lunch time quicky. Very traditional and homey setting.

kDYNSNjYwX7jKZ7fNBR4vg.text: Best bbq pork spring rolls  Also the bbq beef is the best deal for a meal you gotta try it also if you want Noodle soup they have it to come on down give it a try if you're down for the food that come from the far east side lol

photos.caption: Photo of Da Vang Restaurant - Phoenix, AZ, United States

LIrm85w6axonxbTSzpplZA.text: Once again yelp did not disappoint. I went to this unassuming spot that I must've passed 1000 times and never noticed before, so glad I did. It was packed, 90% Vietnamese clientele which is always a good sign if you're looking for something authentic and it was. Fresh herbs, mouthwatering flavors, great service. We always order a ton of food and even as busy as they were, all of it arrived within 10 minutes....and sooooo freaking good.

exTXil6l_sfQAgQNTnE52Q.text: Great value for money and food was very good. There were plenty of people in there having lunch, therefore, it was a tell tale sign that restaurant was decent.  I highly recommend this place.  I ordered the 38D Bun special.   Service was okay.

25iQv4pi3mpabs8iZjn3XA.text: Well I'm not Korean and only do karaoke rarely. But that's the gang over there. Constantly playong this board game out front and screaming at each other in Korean. I say hello to The Boss the past 10 yrs and she still doesn't speak or understand English. Very nice though.

bkdD9AkrVDFT7F5CnRlPDQ.text: Da Vang Hole in the Wall Restaurant thats been around for quite a while, good traditional food and very inexpensive.  We ordered the following Mi Hoanh Thanh at $6.25 which consists of Pork wonton with soup, shrimp, squid, imitation crab, and fish-meatball which is very solid. Broth and contents are all what you would expect from a traditional restaurant.   Also shared the Pho Nam Bo Vien at $6.25 which is Special beef soup with rice noodle, beef brisket, beef meatball served with vegetables. Yum.  Started with Cha Gio (2 Rolls Per Order) $2.75 Deep fried shrimp-pork egg roll served with lettuce, mint, and fish sauce.  Very inexpensive and very good, great Hole in the Wall place for Asain comfort food.

photos.caption: Photo of Da Vang Restaurant - Phoenix, AZ, United States
Photo of Da Vang Restaurant - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Condiments
Photo of Da Vang Restaurant - Phoenix, AZ, United States

NG1QuZIAVlooUeID5TNmrw.text: This review is based on my second visit. Was not very impressed with my first visit but thought we should give it another try after a recommendation from a friend, and we were passing by it.  Why 2 stars? Service: 2 stars. We got seated right away and even though they were fairly busy on a Sunday after church, we got our order quickly but didn't see our waiter after that.  I got the Bun Bo Hue. I am a mission to find a place that would offer that authentic taste that I missed. While it comes pretty close by having the blood pudding and the ham hock in the broth, the meat didn't taste fresh but like old, freezer burned. Did not offer the shredded banana blossom as side condiment. So this gets 3 star  Husband ordered the "lemongrass" chicken. Not at all authentic, and again, the chicken itself tasted old, like it was re-heated one too many time. The flavor was like bland and barely had any lemongrass flavor with some yellowish sauce. So this gets 0 star. So bad that he had to order pho.  Pho Dac biet was good, probably the best out of the 3 dishes according to husband. So this gets 4 stars.

photos.caption: Photo of Da Vang Restaurant - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Bun bo Hue
Photo of Da Vang Restaurant - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Lemongrass chicken? I doubted it but that&#39;s what they served.
Photo of Da Vang Restaurant - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Pho dac biet

hWMbt1uTJfInqlvSeu7Kbg.text: Best pho in town!! The prices are amazing for the amount of food that you get. Definitely will always be my #1 spot.

vtW8zU67LLZFzkNQFTj0qA.text: This stuff was the bomb. Middle aged waiter/owner was yelling at me as soon as I walked in. I knew it was gonna be good food because the service sucked and the place was packed. The menu was mostly indecipherable. You could make out words like beef and chicken, and a number by the food.  Ordering consisted of you telling them a number, and then them repeating back the entree name in perfect Vietnamese like they're better than you.  The food was delicious, the cuts of meat were premium and the Vietnamese iced coffee came out unmixed. Meaning you had to mix the drip coffee into the condensed milk.  After we were done instead of using and iPad or register. This fuckboy used a TI-84 calculator to split up me and my buddy's tab. I left a 30 percent tip, but he was unwaivered in his misery. 10 out of 10 will put up with hot girl bullshit again.

0N7UkyzyHoBAEpsK4rUwYA.text: This is definitely one of those authentic hole in the wall type of places. It's my second favorite in the entire valley and has amazing fried spring rolls and my favorite pho is the beef brisket. They're quick, cheap, and the flavors are great. If you're in the area definitely stop by. It's always full of locals, which can only mean one thing. Delicious authenticity.

T8ZCP2PIX92bcf8WN1CQWA.text: Went here per the recommendation of a fellow Yelper and am so glad I did! Phoned in my order and it was ready by the time I drove 10mins from my office (love when restaurants are efficient with to-go orders). Some of the best most flavorful pho I've had and ridiculously cheap. Got the Pho Tai (A2) and my total was $6 out the door!? Only bad part was the parking, I had to park down the street in a residential area and walk over. A little annoying, but you never want to go somewhere that's not crowded right? Will definitely be back when I'm back in the area.

_eENkmeinWjFsoJW6E2Y4A.text: One of the things I became aware of after so many bowls of "Pho," is that I much prefer the robust flavorful broths. The broth here was delicate and almost fragrant, but not as robust as I might like. It also didn't have as much meat as I would prefer. It is easy to see why it is a favorite (Restaurant was packed at Noon on a Wednesday) as it is just a nice "bowl of love," at an amazing price ($4.50) but was not nearly as memorable as my Phavorite Pho Places and not what I am looking for in Phlavorful Pho.   Spring Rolls (Shrimp this time recommended by waiter) were excellent.

k2g_7Dsmevj3BsxuUyuZUQ.text: Been coming here since I was 7 years old.  Other restaurants are good, but this place is always the go to for pho.  Always.

sH2QGcHDpqhmsGKdDrKijw.text: I have heard great news about this place so I decided to go there one day. Turns out, it wasn't that good. The service wasn't that good either. They are unsanitary. I don't know how they get pass the health inspection. They seem to never clean their things. I found some dirty marks on my plates and my utensils. One word. Disgusting! Who would want to be at an unhealthy and unsanitary restaurants? I know I don't. I got one of the employee to change my utensils. They seemed to rolled their eyes just because I had them to change them. While they walk away, they probably think that I did not understand Vietnamese. Just because I'm Asian, that does not mean that I don't know any other dialect besides Cantonese or Mandarin. They were talking crap about me. They said that I was annoying and I took up their time up for getting me another utensils?! Really? Seriously?  Second thing I want to talk about is their food. Da Vang's meals are not as good as the past anymore. I have no idea what they have done to it. Their food are really cheap but are not worth it. I rather go to someone else to spend a little more money for great food, great service, and great sanitation than be at Da Vang..

lUUFvoks5_D4I65eqd-q_g.text: Da Vang is Da Bomb! it's nothing fancy by any stretch of the imagination, but the food is worth it. I've ordered a number of different things here and loved every dish I've ate. It's one of the best in Phoenix, just wish they had a couple of more women working here. lol.

lyCCsBHkQXXvuWPJ0Fma4w.text: West side hidden treasure! A hole in a wall that if you can get past the less than desirable store front you will be treated to fresh prepared authentic Vietnamese cuisine. Noodle soup, spring rolls with peanut sauce an a monster pork stuffed soft pastry dumpling that was just D-lisous!!!!

W14EgsQbbKkzvAg0WyH9sg.text: I've been going here for years. Like most Asian places Da Vang has no atomosphere, but really tasty food. I usually get one of the pho dishes.  Try the soup with Duck and egg noodles.The Banh Mi sandwices are also very good. Prices are great and the menu has many selections including dishes for vegetarians. I'm going over there for lunch today!

6BTBFrHHbTeA7ZTva866qQ.text: You guys in Phoenix are blessed to have such a good Pho place as such good prices. Nowhere else I have been on the west coast has this quality quanity and service for this amount of money CHEAP! and GOOD! is allways hard to find. Lots of Vietnamese customers in the place so it must be good. Anyone know of a better place in Seattle San fran or LA? I hope they don't get a swelled head because of yelp and charge to much. I eat like a pig and the big bowl is way to big. Spring rolls $2.25 for two and a small bowl $4.75  HAHA amazing! Also pages of vienamese food I havent even heard of.

WOInfBAr_11hpy5gKV0ipQ.text: I went to Pho Thanh a few times before because of Yelp's review but today I had a lunch here. I think I like Da Vang better, because of bigger parking, clean restaurant, more waiters working, cooler indoor and a little cheaper. I always order stir fried rice noodles with meat, shrimp and vegetables, more veges and I like it. I enjoyed very much and can't wait to have a lunch again.

hDdl3acVPWJdra3tjUt-DA.text: There's a reason Yelpers are rating it so highly...the FOOD! With such great food, and low prices, it's no wonder you are never alone in DaVang. Atmosphere? Well, pretty spartan. However, an older co-worker once taught me, "You can't EAT atmosphere".  Service? Not rude, just efficient...in perhaps a German sort of manner. I've had up to 4 or 5 staff(family, hangers-on?) taking care of us on any ONE visit. From bring out the appetizers, condiments, main course, cleaning off empties, etc. Very, very efficient.
