The son used to own Phoung Huang in the former Lee Lee complex at Dobson and Southern where Asiana Market and Hodori Restaurant have taken up its space.  Da Vang is a no frills kinda Vietnamese place, yes it's dirty but I've never gotten sick and I have a very weak stomach. We usually order #18 and #19, #22, #39 or #40, #42, #43, and #44, and #50 for the egg rolls. Their wide rice noodle stirfry with seafood and egg closely resembles a Malaysian favorite of mine that's usually sold by street hawkers and that's Kway Teow. YUM! Their egg noodle soups are good and quite large, and their prices are not pricey. The restaurant itself is not in a great area, since it borders Maryvale... so it's kinda sketchy. The food makes up for the restaurant's appearance and atmosphere. It's just wholesome Vietnamese home cooking, nothing special nor fancy, a place to go for a quick bite of pho, or noodle soup, and finish it off with either Vietnamese coffee or a glass of Soy Bean Milk. Simple fare and very good too!

IDIVkzhDYljFNSC9djo6ZQ.text: Sorry Omer... but it probably was the carbs too... lots and lots of carbs.  And you had already said you were starting to get ill.  This is the BEST!  Do you hear that?  The BEST!  When I go, I get the Pho Tai probably the most.  I usually start off with an order of Bei Cuon and get a "fresh fruit drink" (sorry, the gringo in me does not know what the actual name of the ch is).  I'm not a huge fan of their Bun Thit Nuong (sorry if I can't spell this, remember I'm a gringo) because the barbecue pork seems greasy to me.  Every once in a while I order their red pork sandwich (hands down the best baguette bread on the planet!).  Pour a bit of the nouc mam (fish sauce) with the chilies on the bread--mmmmm I'm salivating.  (Can not wait to go to lunch here tomorrow!!!)  But the real reason we go is the pho.  Everytime we go, there are a TON of Vietnamese there.  Yeah, the place could probably be cleaner, and I have no idea what they are going to do when they enforce the no smoking ban... but man, I sure forget about it when I am face down in my pho bowl.

B7lhPSMuhyP1Qjc4AxWpLA.text: Missing the delicious pho in California I was seeking a good place in Phoenix. Da Vang delivered. The service was decent - not stellar. Their pho picked up any slack and exceeded my expectations. Good amount of meat, perfect portion of noodles, and fresh bean sprouts etc to add.

fWgaIUrhH6dwrSJ45AT57A.text: Wow, really fellow Yelpers?  Why not more reviews for this wonderful restaurant??   Well, all I can say is many of you must really be missing out because this place rocks!! First off, you know this place is good and authentic because every time you go in there are plenty of Vietnamese people enjoying their wonderful traditional Vietnamese offerings.  If you never have had Vietnamese food before, it is exceptionally flavorful, french inspired, light, clean Asian cuisine that couldn't stand out more from Chinese food and Thai food throughout the valley.  Vietnamese food is truly a refined cuisine and this place hits every mark.  I have lived in the bay area for many years, a place which has excellent Vietnamese food and many Vietnamese people, and let me tell you this place does not disappoint.  Very clean, fresh, well prepared, delightful food.  Awesome pho, great noodle dishes, rice dishes, and amazing spring rolls.  The BBQ pork is a must try an in my opinion the flavor rivals traditional American style BBQ in deliciousness.  I have not tried the Vietnamese style sandwiches yet, but I assume they are great.  This place is AMAZINGLY LOW PRICED as well!  Like I'm talking $5.50 for a huge plate with shrimp, assorted seafood, and pork chicken or beef, low priced.  Really the value here is unbeatable.  Be sure to order a Thai iced tea to complete the experience.  We are very lucky to have this place here in Phoenix.

LZn9hwfqQIFBDrf-u4jIlA.text: I was looking for some cheap spring rolls and I am a happy girl.  I ordered carry out.  Phone service was rude, no total, no name  lol...  Food was ready in less than 10 minutes.  After looking at the picts on YELP I ordered the pork spring rolls and Veggies with large rice noodles.  I paid less than $8 for both out the door.  Carry out came with cutlery and sauces (YEAH)!  Food was pretty darn good.  The gravy on the Veggies and noodles was a bit greasy for me, but tasted GREAT!  I will go back again.  Oh, there wasn't a gringo in the place at lunch time.

efE-f2Kec6yf4C7BZR50Lg.text: I haven't had better pho anywhere in az. the large pho is enormous for the price. i usually go with my family and order a regular sized pho for myself and a number 45 (beef/rice plate) to share with another person. the one down side of this place is that it's located in a little more run down area and the restaurant's cleanliness isn't that great. nonetheless, their food makes up for it. i would definitely recommend this place.

4u0yMpr7BpwnI3Mgzf7k5w.text: OVerall the food was good, however the service was crappy!  We waited forever to get someone to not only bring us water, but to take our order.  WHen I got up to look for someone  they were sitting at a table just relaxing.  Our food was literally tossed to us without any regard to whom it was going to.  My friend asked for two seperate items on the menu and was told "they were out".  for two items, one after the other?  I have had PHO at many places.  I WILL NOT be returning, my recommendation would be to go to MAXIM  up the street on 19th ave and Osborn.  This place was the pits!

isris3Isxb9u-Owgtogotg.text: Pho for under $5 & good/fast service= one happy customer!

I9l4WyLBzFz6Kh9q3Zf_rg.text: This hole-in-the-wall Vietnamese restaurant is awesome and one of my office's favorite lunchtime destinations. The Pho and various soup dishes are great and they don't skimp on all the goodies to go with, providing large plates of Thai basil, bean sprouts, peppers, etc. The rice dishes are good too. I especially like the beef with lemongrass rice dish. The pork and shrimp rolls are also excellent and very big - almost a meal on their own. The best thing about this restaurant (besides its very authentic and yummy food and quick - never a wait - service) is that it is cheap, cheap, cheap. Check it out!

R4Z7ayIL5ov3UuWmfIjTdw.text: We have been coming to Da Vang for years. It is consistently delicious. The service is efficient and pleasant. The ingredients are always super fresh and authentic (real Asian basil). I recommend the spring rolls and beef pho soup.

photos.caption: Photo of Da Vang Restaurant - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Beef pho tai
Photo of Da Vang Restaurant - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Two orders of spring rolls (pork and shrimp.)
Photo of Da Vang Restaurant - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Soup is here! Now need to add herbs and sprouts

lFnwk7619hTBfEmq3KAQjQ.text: This is one of the best authentic pho resturants in Phoenix. The broth is O-U-T-S-T-A-N-D-I-N-G! The pho garnish plate is always full of fresh thai basil, bean spouts, jalapenos and limes. My husband and I also enjoy their fresh pork and shrimp spring rolls. We are NEVER disappointed with Da Vang.

X5eu7oaE2spUJ7wpkKdkBw.text: Come here for the Pho! It's not in the best location but that doesn't matter if you're looking for awesome food and great service! I'd highly recommend this spot for Pho in this part of Phoenix.

GMpl23G3zxPYzZ4iZ9Unnw.text: My husband pho was not that good, the Vietnamese crep was not that crispy and beef stew with egg noodle was average.  We are spoil from the great Vietnamese food in Cali so this place could not compare.  Price is so reasonable here!

9QWd0ecENTYKemT09rbVHg.text: Very friendly workers, affordable, spacious & parking! These are the key to a 4 star & Da Vang got it. Their pho is good, very affordable.. they quite have a variety of options from pho to lunch plates.   My first impression of the place was sketchy, but during the day it looks totally normal.  I still love it & would highly recommend!

c36a1SkuOEkq376SIv_8Kg.text: Love this place - it's a bit far from my house, but when I want a good rice or pho dish with out-of-this-world soy milk, I make the trek.  Don't be too afraid by the looks of this restaurant sitting in a raggedy strip mall.  The inside doesn't get much better either.  The place is mostly run by men - and on occasion I see a female at the register.  But these guys know their stuff and are quick.    I always order their com thit nuong trung chien - translates to their bbq pork with rice and a fried egg on top. It also comes with a side of nuoc mam (fish sauce) that I love to pour over my rice and leave a little in the bowl to dip my meat in.  I love the sauce that much.    I also order as an appetizer, their goi cuon - spring rolls.  Their rice paper is so darn chewy and perfect.  I don't know where they buy it from, but I have to find them!  But if you're ever there, please order the soy milk. It's made in-house and is sweet and delicious. I always order it in a large to-go cup as it's bigger than their regular glasses.

photos.caption: Photo of Da Vang Restaurant - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Com tam thit nuong trung chien. Broken rice with pork and fried eggs. Perfectly delicious with a side of fish sauce (nuoc mam)
Photo of Da Vang Restaurant - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Banh Xeo with no sprouts. Perfectly crunchy.

bj3MzobYzbxD3zc1jOcHFw.text: We usually love Da Vangs but this time was different. I called to make sure they where open (Since it was a holiday-Day after New Years) and they where so my family and I headed over.  When we arrived it was 7:20pm and we where rushed to order and then when we decided what we wanted we where told that they don't have it because it takes too long to make. Its was crazy to think that 40 minuets was not enough time to make rice with beef.  I ended up ordering the Pho and iced coffee and my husband decided not to eat. My daughter shared my food and although the customer service was horrible the food was good.  Also, my daughter (2 years old) broke a pepper shaker and the waiter proceeded to scold her as she tried to grab the salt shaker, I'm sorry but please don't talk to my daughter. Leave that for us- her parents!

XMukyeOJtb8AgfoEpYIRTw.text: Super friendly host and the service was fast. The pho was awesome not watered down like at other spots. Definitely coming back soon!

EpCCmvYpvne_lrr89JrdDg.text: I love this restaurant. Also Pho Thanh,  these restaurants are the best and also they are the same family-owned. Da Vang is owned by the 2nd brother and Pho Thanh is owned by 3rd brother I guess, since they have like 10 siblings. One of the other restaunrants of this family is in Mesa called Phu Thanh, which is also an excellent place to eat with cheap food.

pJQW-IbSJUcBaOQZQrynGQ.text: This is a outstanding hole-in-the-wall vietnamese restaurant. I've been to my share of vietnamese restaurants, even in the famed Eden Center in NOVA. This place is comparable, if not better, than all those places both in quality and price.   We came here for lunch on a weekday and it was filled with people. The service was prompt, efficient, and professional. There were a couple times when the waiter forgot our request and we would have to gently remind him.   I ordered vermicelli noodles with BBQ pork and an eggroll (~$6) and my mom ordered combination no. 1 pho  (~$6). The portions were satisfactory. The food was fresh and hot. The pho broth was flavorful. The BBQ pork was thick and juicy. The price is unbeatable with no compromise to the quality of the food.  I will definitely frequent this place anytime I'm in the area. This is the best vietnamese restaurant I've been to in Phoenix.

photos.caption: Photo of Da Vang Restaurant - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Vermicelli with BBQ pork and egg rolls

kW2eZyjU2RSV2AmWqTXeMg.text: Hole in the wall in a sketchy parking lot. Bathrooms questionable. Restaurant packed with people of all kinds. Menu choices extensive and fabulous. Service was abundant and constantly on the move. Smiles/laughter/rushed looks/attentive and enthusiastic attitudes. Busy. Front table stocked with homemade cookies and giant slices of plain cake (but cake that is unassuming--packed with oh-so-amazing flavor--looks are deceiving!) Take some home on your way out.  Had the pig knuckle pho with pig's blood. It was amazing. The spring rolls are huge and cheap. The pancake was perfectly crispy and huge. The bbq pork and fish cake bun was served with lots of meat in a huge bowl and we had more herbs/lettuce/limes, etc. than we ever could want or need. The shrimp stuffed tofu was ample. The whole meal for two was under $30, including a Thai coffee and iced tea. We were stuffed and walked away with leftovers.

zRdBL-nZhq4n6aYMlqTLEA.text: Been going here since 20 years ago. This place is always good and super cheap. Pho is amazing. Beef stew is amazing. Bahn mi is decent. I always get the three colors drink if they have it. If they don't, they recommend me a different drink and I have always been pleased but still like three colors the most. The BBQ pork with broken rice is tasty but sometimes there is a lot of fat and oil on the BBQ pork. Spring rolls are fresh. Fried egg rolls are what u expect. The Vietnamese coffee is legit. The place used to be full of flies and look dumpier, but the renovations over the past few years have been nice. The staff is efficient.   I always leave this place completely satisfied.

Uwhnfm90lk2I6AKrA6HhMQ.text: We have been eating at this restaurant since 1997. The quality of food is very consistent and quite delicious. Every dish we have tried has been very good. Service is with a warm greeting and smile. For us this is the best Vietnamese restaurant in Phoenix. The flavors are what we experienced in Vietnam.

gOf7xuYzU49QsETUV387eQ.text: Don't be confused at how fancy this place looks on the outside the Pho hits the spot and is decently priced.  We arrived around 12:30pm on a rainy day. The place was busy. We had a small wait for a table, but everyone was pleasant.   We got the 2B (Pho), fried rice for the little one, an array of spring rolls, iced coffee and of course the Thai iced tea.  $25  I didn't try the iced coffee but apparently if you need a kick in the pants to wake up this is the stuff. Mr. C was jittery for the next hour.   I was stuffed and satisfied. We will be back.

photos.caption: Photo of Da Vang Restaurant - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Fancy. Ha
Photo of Da Vang Restaurant - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Shrimp Spring Rolls, Thai iced tea and drip coffee in the background.
Photo of Da Vang Restaurant - Phoenix, AZ, United States. 2B Pho with Beef and meatballs.

azY6SPDQDiVjWGCbVkJV7A.text: I like this place a lot. It follows all of the rules of finding great ethic food in a big city (e.g. family-owned, always packed, and lots of folks from the country of origin), and the price point is impossible to argue with. It's probably the cheapest delicious meal you can get in the city.  Of course, you'll want to try the Beef Pho, but there's so much more to explore on this menu if you wander around a bit. I don't love the Bahn Mi here (too much bread), but they're wonderfully cheap if you're looking to fill your belly on the fly. I also love the chicken porridge when I'm not in the mood for Pho.  Some folks might be turned off by the location, which is definitely modest, but we're here to eat good Vietnamese food, not luxuriate in leather armchairs. I go here regularly, and not out of habit. I wouldn't recommend it if you only have time to try a few places on a vacation, but if you live in Phoenix, it would be a mistake to not make a habit out of Da Vang.

photos.caption: Photo of Da Vang Restaurant - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Vietnamese iced coffee. Slow drip and condensed milk... It&#39;s a kick in a glass!
Photo of Da Vang Restaurant - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Beef sausage  in grape leaves with rice noodles to build your own spring rolls!

2FA1fE73FMt1CGoDwQG37Q.text: This is my to go when it comes to Vietnamese food. Its cheap, flavor is awesome and they have consistency. This was also my first place to go with pho. Its been years since my first taste and every time I go eat Vietnamese food my taste buds always compares it to Davang. That says a lot. The only caveat I have for the place is that sometimes they don't have a lot of the foodsin the menu- like their curry. Also the place could really benefit on a make over- been to places like little miss Saigon that has the atmosphere and decorations on top of their delicious food. But other than that its all good.  If its your first time- get the BBQ bun. Its very delicious and very cheap then grab a pho - number 1.

S-SG-OanfQZHdhNmD7V_BQ.text: When I walk into Da Vang, it feels like I've accidentally stumbled into a Vietnamese mafia den. But not just any Vietnamese mafia den. A Vietnamese mafia den that serves the best Vietnamese food in the Valley.  The bun is on point. The egg rolls are fantastic. Pho is always good. Even the pancake is worth a try.  Sure, the service is a little sub-par. I've been forgotten on numerous occasions, and my order has been wrong once or twice or twenty times. But that's not why you go to Da Vang. You go because the flavor to value ratio is ridiculously in your favor. Pho for under $6. Bun for under $7. And vietnamese coffee done the right way with plenty of condensed milk for under $3.   If you don't like dives, don't go to this place. But if you love great food at a great value, then look no further. This is the place- mafia family included.

yUgYpHEBLDx7b5vacBCOjQ.text: Bahn mi sandwich is the worse ever. Baguette came from Safeway or Fry's,  there was some kind of processed meat in it and A LOT of cheap mayonnaise. My male colleague enjoyed it though (maybe because he got it from me for free?).

F6KIIn2svg4ZHEu1D2Wtlg.text: First sit down vietnamese restaurant I've been to in Phoenix. Most of their dishes are under $6, banh mi is $3 and che (vietnamese desserts) are $2. Mike and I ordered the banh xeo, a vietnamese coffee, bun bo hue and a com nem nuong.... hey, I just got off the plane and my eyes were bigger than my stomach okay? LOL... everything was good and definitely worth the $18 including tax. Geez, I can't even get a bun bo hue and a com nem nuong for $18 in Nashville. I will definitely be returning!!

photos.caption: Photo of Da Vang Restaurant - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Doesn&#39;t get any fresher  in PHX!
Photo of Da Vang Restaurant - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Bun Bo hue
Photo of Da Vang Restaurant - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Banh xeo

0XatylCG8IR6bpTiz1pifg.text: Hands down my favorite pho place in Phoenix. Service could be better but I don't mind unless they take longer than usual. You can find my family and I here every Sunday.

FmiKfP8KDYW4NfHSxdZ4ag.text: Very authentic, family run, family Pho house restaurant. All the food is tasty, well spiced, aromatic, hot, and fresh! You can tell it's good, they're always busy and full with pretty much all Vietnamese customers. They have nice big family sized tables and small 2-4 seater tables. Great service! The only draw back is the location but very well worth the drive!  -what to expect? fresh, authentic Vietnamese food (especially Pho) for a very fair price!!  save this one in your GPS fav's!

nnlJ1sIUkhAGqQyJ8qdmow.text: this is the best pho spot i've been to in the valley. it's in a ratty little strip mall in an ok part of town, but it's absolutely dirt-cheap and definitely made from scratch by a family who knows what they are doing.   my iced tea was kinda gross but the food is divine, and i absolutely stuffed my disgusting face for about $8.   go here if you're hungry and nearby, it's 1000% worth it

HqKbx2sYmZgLwsdXzIB4NA.text: Ordered a large chicken pho for takeout. (Yes, I know, original.) Guy on the phone took my order and immediately hung up. ...Guess he was busy? Good thing I've eaten pho before, so I know how long it should take.  I get to the restaurant. Eh, a little dingy, but when I'm eating a bowl of good pho, the universe could implode, and I wouldn't notice. I personally didn't have any problems waiting to pay for my order (maybe five to ten minutes) but apparently from the other reviews there's sometimes a backup. I pay, but they have me wait a little longer because they thought I had ordered a small instead of a large. Only takes a few seconds, so I guess all they do is add more? Apparently so, because I had an OUTRAGEOUS amount of noodles. I mean, the whole container was almost exploding full of noodles. It didn't look like they gave me any more chicken, but the chicken was the real deal - good mix of white and dark meat.  Now. The Soup for me is 95% of how I view a restaurant's pho. Theirs... sucks. It was bland, smelled strange, and just didn't do it for me. This is the second "popular" pho place I've tried that has had a weird, onion-y, dregs from the deep fryer vat smell to it. I don't know if this another regional version or something, but this ain't the pho I'm used to. I've eaten pho with Vietnamese friends, so I trust that it's been original. Where is the flavor, man? I had to dump four spoonfuls of gochujang (Korean chili pepper paste) into my soup to give it any sort of flavor, and I usually prefer to eat pho bare bones. Don't even normally stir in hoisin and sriracha.  C'mon, Arizona. Is this some sort of weird initiation process I have to go through before I find a place that serves decent pho? (Now that's not totally fair; there's a place in that corner plaza on Dobson and Southern that has pretty decent pho.)

aEHEp2wKRXWBpvi7zV62bg.text: Very good pho. The spring rolls were a bit dry but still delicious. Will come back again. I'm picky when it comes to pho but this is simply delightful. Always busy during lunch time but this is always a good sign.

bN_XAk19pAqN6hAc7PX7WA.text: First visit: 5 Stars. We had the "22," "1B," "48," and the "50." Five stars. Everything was excellent. That being said, usually I drink the pho soup, but this soup was too fatty to drink. Second visit: 3 Stars. Food is still good, but the service was bad this time. Last time, there were hints of bad service, but this time (we were there with friends we'd told about this place) they didn't refill our water, remove empty plates, and the never brought over a "48" we ordered. Again, the food was good, though. Third visit: 4 Stars. Yes, the food is still really good. The service was a bit spotty again, but the food makes up for it. By the way, we liked the sandwiches a lot. The bread and the filling was very fresh.

24qQojGr1VzYlT_JKIromw.text: If you're not full by the time you're done eating here, you are not human. If you have been here and feel like service was not 'up to par,' 'accommodating.' or 'it's dirty,' you obviously do not know what a real Asian restaurant is like. Believe me, most Asians dgaf when it comes to this but in my opinion, the more they dgaf, the better the food is.   My family have been all around this state trying out Vietnamese restaurants and we have been coming back here despite the distance since I was little. Portions are big and prices are still cheap to this day, what more can you ask for?  No one does egg rolls better than them and no one, in my opinion can do a better pork and rice dish than them. If you're a novice, just simply order a #1: a big fat bowl of pho and nomlicious meat. Squeeze some lime in your broth, add some bean sprouts, and squeeze sriracha sauce and you have a meal fit for a really really obese 17th century king/queen. If you're not so much a noodle fan like I am, order a #41. I bet you have never eaten such succulent fatty pork in your life before. Douse the rice with the fish sauce and eat it all together with the lettuce they give you and you'll know what's going on. Or at least your stomach will.  Top it off with some Vietnamese iced coffee and I'm sure you'll be coming back to this somewhat shady but absolute gem.

iCE5gPIZ1HzxxyrvomirYg.text: I had even looking for a good Vietnamese restaurant and came across this little hole in the wall place! Service was a little slow but the people there were awesome explained things and were very helpful. Food was fantastic!!

photos.caption: Photo of Da Vang Restaurant - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Spring roll and Thai tea yummy

K8skrdghpyEUe53hhJ2Gcg.text: I LOVE LOVE LOVE THIS PLACE!!  I was in Phoenix visiting my family, and my sister took me here, and had to come back 2 more times before leaving!! I wished I could have taken them home with me!!  Food was excellent!!  Service was nothing to be desired, our waiter was not very friendly, but it didn't matter everyone else was!!  The serving size for the PHO was excellent, plenty!!  I LOVED the  fresh and fried spring rolls I crave it so bad!!  Definitely will want to come back!!

05vYzmuVO4e_erJuhGwtng.text: If only zero star was available. We have had given this place so many chances, based on other people's reviews. But now we have given up on it. We ordered rice plate with pork chop; the pork chop was old, dried and re-heated in the microwave before being brought out to us. Does anyone know good Vietnamese restaurants in the valley?

a810i8O-JxI-JdzAoDjTVg.text: I haven't been able to find better Pho in Arizona. Today I had the DaVang Pho and it was wonderful! I have been a fan of this place for a few years now.   The decor is a bit outdated, but the service and the food are always great so that keeps me coming back.

-kz6TZV97RcYczC-YlCyJg.text: I am have stopped in regularly over the years. Outstanding selection of Pho and what I believe to be the best Bahn Mi in town. Regarding the sandwiches, I have had them all, but favor the bbq pork. Try the spring rolls, also excellent !

kMr-4XAvGXA-kV54iPML9g.text: So far everything I have eaten here is awesome and it's so cheap. From the pho to the springrolls to banh mi to whatever, you get soooo much for your money. A cheap eatery that has good food is hard to come by in az!

photos.caption: Photo of Da Vang Restaurant - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Spring rolls. #48b. :)
Photo of Da Vang Restaurant - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Half off a Bbq pork banh mi...too hungry to take a pic of the whole thing lol.

RNwi-pCBFLaPhl88oa_OTQ.text: This is my backup.for phone than. The place seems a little  dark. The portions are smaller and more expensive . It is OK there are a few dishes that I like the wanton soup and fried rice

rMplM19ffn1cJTm23uxyYQ.text: Been coming here for years. Rude service and semi-cleanliness= ridiculously great vietnamese grub! If you can ignore the above then you'll sure to be able to enjoy the food! Cheap, semi- fast, great selection from noodle soups to hot pots to penny wort juice and even pate or bbq pork sandwiches;you cant go wrong with this place. Just don't try and modify the menu selections and don't even think about asking questions, so you should be familiar with the food or you just may end up with the coagulated blood soup bowl. Sux that they close so early too(8pm). Delicious.

oyiVYepi4afzeowX17zCLg.text: Best Pho in Arizona! You heard me! Absolutely delicious! Service is precise and efficient, food comes out exceptionally quick, ingredients taste so fresh and the broth in the pho is clean and heart warming. If your ever in the valley, stop by Va Dangs. Price is really, really, really cheap for the quality food they serve.

-QB7Oe1iH2j-oWBF5Pdu0Q.text: This place has many memories, we used to go here all the time since I was a kid. But it really lacks that "umph" factor to be honest. It actually carries some of the cheaper prices, however, you kind of get smaller portions with it. Service is pretty good though!

N9pwXX0HQzKkTWoTKZygjg.text: Craving for some pho. Decided to stop by this hole in the wall place. The prices were good. We received our food pretty quickly. Though the service of getting us silverware or refills sucked. They never asked if we needed a refill. Besides the service it was okay.

yAxmmSj3eQRyg7dU7_1z1Q.text: This is the restaurant that my chef friends take me to. I should be able to stop my review right there because that should be enough of an endorsement.   Bahn Mi Sandwiches, these are really the only thing that gets a "meh" from me, just too much bread not enough meat.  -But-  Any of their Pho's, Yum  BBQ Pork spring rolls you make yourself at the table, yumm  Whole fried, head on shrimp with onions and jalapenos, yummm  Their Cafe Sua Da (iced coffee and condensed milk) YUMMMM!!!!  This is the best bang-for-buck restaurant in Arizona, period.  I do have to say is the service is hit or miss and the ambiance is pretty much non existent but at their prices, who the heck cares?!?!

4lddl4_EC6mwwb56T677Cw.text: In Phoenix, this is one of the best places for Vietnamese food!  Good flavor. Good portions.  Good prices.  Enough said! :)

JM1V8GH_aVQR8TMtbiQnDw.text: We went here because Maxim and Pho Thanh were both closed. All of the good Pho in Phoenix seems to be nestled around 19th Ave between Osborn and Camelback which is not my favorite part of town. Don't let the sketchy area put you off, it's worth venturing into the hood. The prices are  incredible. We got two orders of spring rolls, two bowls of pho, and two desserts (SAVE ROOM FOR DESSERT OH. MY. GAH.) our bill came out to $23.  The service was "meh" at best, but this is not the kind of restaurant you go to for ambiance, or service, you patronage this establishment because you want authentic cuisine. I could eat here on a daily basis, and it's so cheap that I could afford to.

I2dsu_v5jXH9rEFIjZmO0A.text: I liked the Pho it was very tasty, the food came very late for my boyfriend,   The place is not fancy at all but food is really good.

TKxfudf06drCpMG1sCUizg.text: Quaint and authentic family favorite for some of the best Pho in town! We travel 40 min from Surprise and always well worth the drive.  We've tried what seems like every Pho spot from CA to AZ and Da Vang is definitely on our top 3 places to eat.  Food is always hot, flavorful and plentiful.  Service is great, generally busy but quickly accommodating and did i mention we can feed a family of 6 for under $40. This includes an xtra lg bowl of Pho for the hubby, 5 reg bowls, and 3 orders of spring rolls. The pressed iced coffee is amazing and great service on the water refills. I also recommend the vermicelli bowl with seared tofu on an extra hot day in Phx. Great food any time of the day, any day of the year, including 115 weather. Dont let the location fool you because this place is not your typical commercialized Vietnamese restaurant. Simple ambiance make you almost feel like like a guest at your friends grandmothers. This is the real deal!

photos.caption: Photo of Da Vang Restaurant - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Tofu w/eggroll vermicelli bowl

1iA5V2HTGQC-OfK5ayhOEA.text: I would never have assumed that I'd have so many options for pho in Phoenix. Looking on Yelp, quite a few Vietnamese restaurants were received very well. I settled on Da Vang, which turned out to be exactly the kind of place I picture when I think of a pho restaurant. Well, the outside was a little more plain than necessary. But you can't read a book by its cover, you know. Da Vang was actually having a lunch rush, with people coming in and out all the while. The decor is nothing fancy. The chair I was sitting on was pretty worn out, and the brown walls could use repainting. It's definitely a place with history. Da Vang has a big menu with all the standard fare, plus some family meals (Chinese dishes), banh mi (for only $2.50!) and even lau (Vietnamese hot pot). Pho was really cheap here, ranging from $4.75-5.50 for regular sizes and an extra $1.50 for large. I had my usual pho tai nam, at $5.25, and it came out in five minutes. For the first time ever, the pho arrived before my garnishes, though they were delivered soon after. The first taste of the broth was pleasing. It was light and clear, with a skilled use of spices. I thought it had the perfect degree of saltiness, and it was a little tangy even without lime. As for the meat, the rare steak was almost fully cooked, unsurprising because it was placed under the flank steak. Personally, I would have put it on top, but what do I know? The slices of flank were the fattiest ones I've ever eaten, too. Regardless, both types of meat were tender and had good flavor. The noodles were cooked to perfection, too. Rating Breakdown: Taste (11/14): Broth flavor- 4/5 Noodle & meat quality- 4/5 Garnish selection- 1/2 Portion size- 2/2 Restaurant (12/16): Service- 3/5 Cleanliness- 4/5 Atmosphere- 3/4 Speed of arrival- 2/2 Total: 23/30 Read more about my phoventures at phoacrossamerica.com

x3PsKfhNiTqw2Sai5NOrmg.text: This restaurant is probably the most authentic Phoenix has to offer. The staff was friendly and the food was okay.   I ordered the Bun Bo Hue and was surprised at what I received. It was not the Vietnamese bun bo hue but another dish that kind of resembled it. I felt as if I was eating pho with a hint of some other spices found in a typical bun bo hue dish.   The house fish sauce tasted like it came straight from the fish sauce bottle. I was actually pretty impressed with the peanut sauce though.   I am aware that Phoenix does not offer a variety of Vietnamese restaurants but this place will get the job done.

TBnsUXGNC8TwmgSdpbnEYw.text: What a great find. My wife and I went here for the 1st time a few days ago. She made me take her back again today for lunch. The restaurant itself is typical Mom n Pop Asian style decor...nothing fancy in other words. I'm not there to look at the walls, I want great food and this place has it. Busy both times we have been, but never had to wait for a table or good service. Chit-chat is a minimum when ordering and food comes out relatively quickly. Beef Pho is awesome as well as the fresh spring rolls and fried ones. The portions are ample and the prices are cheap. It's clean, quick, friendly and most importantly YUMMY! We've found a new Vietnamese place to frequent! YES!

photos.caption: Photo of Da Vang Restaurant - Phoenix, AZ, United States. BBQ pork w/ broken rice
Photo of Da Vang Restaurant - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Small Beef Pho
Photo of Da Vang Restaurant - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Beef Salad

w_-cMv_AxJnQW8csaV2OgQ.text: There's no way you can go wrong with a GIGANTIC bowl of pho after a rough night out. So, go extra large or go home.  That magical mixture of salt/msg, soup, and meat just tells your hangover to 'shut the fuck up.'  I feel like I'm stealing food at their prices, so I'm coming back no matter what.   Sadly though, the service was horrendous as it took 25 minutes for 2 bowls of pho to come out. And they got our appetizer order wrong.  But yeah, brb next weekend.

vR0xiUMeUthkHvwSbJ7Sqg.text: Awesome food. Great service. Super tasty. Definitely will be back. It's a good place to bring a large party.

NCV-_YJiSU8ufWFtPNN-fg.text: Ok... let me warn you... DO NOT BE ALARMED BY THE FRONT OF THE BUILDING. I had just moved into the area and needed a pho place to satisfy my weekly cravings. This one really did not fall short of the reviews I read. The pho was fantastic, and the spring rolls were stuffed full of delicious shrimp and veggies. The price was way less than I would expect, the whole meal was around $6 and I saved most of the spring rolls for dinner.   One thing I do wish about the spring rolls was a better sauce. The sauce they have for it is a bit syrup-y but I can deal.

jpntYN0yLANtCNeQMgZfJA.text: Certainly one of the best Vietnamese places to go to in Phoenix!  It's a hole in the wall place, but they have a great clientele and the food is always very good!  Service at times is slow, but you have to basically call them to get drink refills!  Overall their food is very good!!

HnP3Tgw7MeA3uua9mO8WHg.text: My favorite Vietnamese restaurant in town. I'm originally from Houston where there was a huge Vietnamese population so food was in abundance. finding a good Vietnamese restaurant was a huge concern for me when I moved here.   Da Vang has a pretty extensive menu of most of the Vietnamese food well represented. Pho and bun thit nuong are my usual go to, both are good here. Price is probably the lowest I've seen in town. Good food and good prices! Win-win. A must go!  --keep eatin'

x4aA4bBgHQK9QwpenWXxew.text: I used to come here all the time as a kid, and they were all good memories. But I don't know what happened because this place has gone waaaaay down. I typically go to Pho Thanh (which is much better by the way), but they were closed today for some reason. So I decided to give Da Vang another shot.  When I was seated, the table next to me asked if they could be served and the server said he'd be right back. The table got frustrated and left, which was a red flag I should have taken into consideration. It took 15 minutes after being seated to even be acknowledged by a server. Then after we ordered, we got our pho before we got our spring rolls. We brought this to the server's attention and he brought it out right away, so he basically forgot.   But now onto the actual food quality. The pho was mediocre at best. There was little flavor and tasted pretty bland overall. I ordered the large while my friend got the regular. The bowl sizes were different, but I'm almost positive that they just put the same amount of food in both sizes. The large just had more broth.  The spring rolls were mediocre as well. Didn't taste fresh like they should have. Their "peanut sauce" wasn't even peanut sauce, it was hoisin sauce with crushed peanuts on top.   Overall, this place has fallen off. I hope Pho Thanh is only closed temporarily because I won't be coming back to this spot.

aR6U0KI6rYGfycR9AMYHbw.text: Tried DaVang for the Bahn Mi.  Got the BBQ Pork & it was delicious. Prices very reasonable. Also gave the Pho a whirl-portions are a bit small, brisket was on the dry side but the broth was flavorful. Outside appearance is a bit unpretentious. Will Go back for the Bahn Mi & possibly try a broken rice dish.

Vu4WvUzgcWysvQxqz2KPzA.text: I recently got relocate to Phoenix from las vegas at first I was so depressed because there is no 24hr pho restaurants like there is in las Vegas and to me eating pho and going to walmart at 3am is my favorite thing to do. I came to this restaurant today because all the good reviews after work and let me tell you.it was the best bowl of pho I ever had I got the fried rice with chicken and pork and a no 1 large and my friend got s regular no 1 and the bill was only $18.50 wow what a good price and I told myself I want to eat here everyday lol

dZNvQ9evuwK_pSP0N-zS_A.text: We ordered the following for breakfast: Ban Xeo (Pan-fried flour crepe with shrimp, pork, and bamboo shoots) Banh Mi Trung Rang (French bread sandwich with fried egg omelette) Chao Thap Cam (Rice porridge with shrimp, pork, squid, fish ball, and imitation crab)  The Good News: This is one of my favorite places to eat, I have become a regular here, and it is the best Vietnamese restaurant I have been to thus far in southern Arizona. All of the entrees are always freshly and properly prepared. The service is quick and about as friendly as it gets for a Vietnamese restaurant and the prices cannot be beat. The crepe was cooked perfectly as was the meat and veggies inside, all of which were very tasty, and the serving size was plenty for two people. The French bread was fresh, light, and flavorful, the egg was cooked just right for a sandwich like this, and the veggie toppings(carrots, onions, cucumber, and jalapenos) were a perfect accompaniment. My dining companion had originally decided against having a sandwich, but once she saw how much I was enjoying it she joined in and ate the other half. The consistency of the rice porridge was just right (not too heavy or watery), there was ample portions of pork and all of the different seafood, and the serving size was plenty for two people.  The Rest of the Story: The place is a bit run down outside and there always seems to be the usual suspects hanging out in front, but don't let that deter you.  The Verdict: I make sure to eat here at least once or twice a month and will continue to happily do so.

photos.caption: Photo of Da Vang Restaurant - Phoenix, AZ, United States
Photo of Da Vang Restaurant - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Rice porridge
Photo of Da Vang Restaurant - Phoenix, AZ, United States. French bread sadwhich with egg omelette

b7uyaA5ExQxczbDgX1_c8A.text: Best coffee of any Vietnamese restaurant.  So so so inexpensive!!!  Best sandwiches, best pho, best everything.  It's the quintessential hole in the wall.  Everything is a comforting about the food.  My ideal meal here is an order of spring rolls, barbecue pork sandwich, and hot coffee.  And when we go to pay I always pick up one of those chewy green coconut desserts.  My husband orders pho and I always drink the left over soup.  For about 10 bucks, you feast.

_WKFB8q8RBlGrnUXPReokg.text: Still the best in my book. Over 100 visits in the last year and I've been going here for several years now. I've tried other places and they don't compare. The pho here is the best in the valley. I've been to 10 other places and none of them even come close. Not on flavor and certainly not on price. I've switched from the 48 to the 48b (I like the BBQ pork more) and I've gone to ordering a Bahn Mi every visit.   Most other pho places, for 2 orders of pho and a couple appetizers, will run $30 for 2 people with tip. I'm consistently leaving Da Vang for $20 including a generous tip.  They are friendly, they refill your drinks continuously. They remember their regulars and our orders. What is not to like? The neighborhood? Get out of your hole!   ...Just don't use the east entrance... that incline is a killer! Use the entrance off the side street to the north. Your car will thank you.

c0ZcpWAIDsDjXX8orMTITA.text: Da Vang gets a GOLD STAR in the Pho department. I stress this more because that is their staple. Aside that, they are generally consistent in delivering a satisfying meal. Gosh, it's really hard to sway my Pho-mentality whenever I stop by! I always glance at other items but when you do a price compare and the amount of ingredients, it just cannot be beat! Some might complain its a tad oily, but sometimes you just have to suck it up! They give you a generous-fill-you-up amount of noodles and meat! (Under $6) However, I have managed to try other things such as Bun Bo Hue and Banh Mi. The Banh Mi is pretty basic--baguette is usually toasty with fresh veggies, meats and smothered with liver pate spread ($2.50). One will not fill you up, so add an appetizer. Bun Bo Hue is not as great when compared to other places. The beef stew is missing the braisey, stewey-ness. Not terrible, just too simple in flavors for what I would expect. And of course, how can you not order spring rolls ($2.25) when you sit down at a Vietnamese restaurant? I would say the ingredients used is fresh enough (i.e. Shrimp, Pork Slices, Veggies). I always say, a fresh spring roll is a happy spring roll. Just before I checkout, I almost every time grab one of my favorite desserts--sweet, cold coconut rice with beans that comes in a small cup. Unlike other places, they make their desserts in-house. Because I like this dessert cold, I multitask on the road hoping to not cause some kind accident on my way back to work. I am just grateful that places like Da Vang still exist! Been a loyal customer since 1889. I kid, I kid (of course), I'm not that old! yelp.com/biz_photos/Jj8u...

photos.caption: Photo of Da Vang Restaurant - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Pho #1
Photo of Da Vang Restaurant - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Spring Roll
Photo of Da Vang Restaurant - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Banana Dessert! Taste better than it looks!

0kqHZK-sf9UM2xlzVqoczQ.text: Amazing chicken pho!! Love it! Some of the best I have found in central Phoenix! Authentic place - not fancy - cafeteria style.

Diuu3Dd3Iv2tqnpORyZ4qQ.text: The food was above average.    The price for the food is a good value.  The service is really what keeps it from being perfect.  Imagine a friendly hole in the wall kind of place and that's what this is.

Qz47WAsLN7rcr8fLnfX83A.text: Hands down the best Pho in Phoenix! I'm a regular customer usually go about twice a month. I've tried other pho restaurants in Phoenix and they don't come close.

0Lq15gZMhoZmF26aMIeKTQ.text: This place is really far from me. But I went to a friends house and he drove us here. This place is larger than I expected it to be. I felt bad. We showed up 30 minutes before it was closing. I had told my friend he should have looked it up because he goes here all the time but he forgot lol. They were pretty quick at getting our food out so that was nice. For some reason they didn't have Thai tea so I was really bummed. The prices were fantastic! I don't think I've seen a cheaper pho restaurant than this before. And man did the pho taste great. I could really taste the cilantro and basil so that was nice. I'm big on the flavors. I was so hungry and it was so good, I finished the whole bowl. And honestly I could've kept eating more it was so good!! I won't get to come often cause I live far but every once in a while I can come with my friend. I look forward to coming back when I have more time.

photos.caption: Photo of Da Vang Restaurant - Phoenix, AZ, United States

UxXyLZ1Ylw_aTP6DG1eklw.text: Totally fun experience! The staff was so friendly and patient. Delicious, great price, amazing portion sizes, fast service. Highly recommended.

xzm8eXA3kwHaX1arGjga9Q.text: My first review for Da Vang but I have been coming here for years and have brought many others that are now regulars. The food is always excellent.

sN8b1mYbd494DDMKhM3rvg.text: Yo, I'm gonna' be pho-real here and say Da Vang (Yellow Skin/Vietnamese/Asian) is indeed run by Vietnamese people, it's a family run kinda business so expect that. However, I ain't hating on my own people but there is better Pho out there.  I typically go to 43rd for Pho since they come the closest in flavor and quality to that of the Bay Area and of course reminds me of Vietnam. The restaurant is pretty big, blasts Vietnamese music and even sells prepackaged goods up front, seems that a lot of it's customers are also for take out.  I ordered the Pho Tai, which is rice noodles, broth, sliced round eye steak and onions. The basil, bean sprouts, lime and jalapenos looked fresh when it was brought out separately. I love putting the basil in my Pho. I also wanted to order Soy Milk but they were out, as well as the Coconut Juice so I settled with a Thai Tea. Talk about drink rejection.  The Pho Tai was light in color instead of on the browner side, more similar to Chicken Broth, you could see the fat on the surface and it was slightly cloudy. The flavor was very simple, you could taste the spices but there wasn't a lot of depth or complexity to it. I also suspect a bit of MSG additive. My tongue was a bit numb/tingly and my thirst after my meal was unquenchable. (MSG sensitivity). The noodle bowls are premade- this I could tell because the noodles were stuck to each other and on the bottom of the bowl I had to stir the noodles around in the broth prior to eating. You do get a large amount of noodles however. The steak pieces were okay and it also came with brisket which I wasn't that fond of because of the fatty pieces.  Don't expect much service because you will only order and get served your food, that's it. Then again, I don't know many Vietnamese spots that continuously check up on you during your meal. Take it (eat it) and go! That's usually how it works.  For a bowl of pho and a drink, it came out to around $8 which isn't bad- but it isn't the best tbh. Great for your wallet, Pho craving or to fill your belly.

photos.caption: Photo of Da Vang Restaurant - Phoenix, AZ, United States. 3A Pho Tai - Rice noodles, brisket, sliced eye round steak, onions, cilantro

zDHs-dJHVLbCKplD0gdXFA.text: The food was delicious and very authentic. We had pho with beef and beef meatballs, pancake, spring rolls, and bun. All of it was delicious! The BBQ pork was delicious and not too fatty like many Vietnamese places. The pho broth had great flavor. The pancake was crispy and the portions were very generous. Overall everything was so good that I could resist taking home some green tea rice cake at the end. We also bought bahn mi to go for lunch the next day despite all our left overs. At 3.50-4.00, hard to beat a better value lunch like a big bahn mi! It's a casual place. To pay, you note your table number and go to the register.

oA0zqrbKGLoaSJZ_6piUFg.text: The best Vietnamese in Phoenix, as it was the one we went to.  My wife and I had their pho tai nam and shared a plate of their broken rice dish special.  The pho tasted home cooked with some fat just like the one we made at home during Christmas.  The meat was done perfect and tender tasty.  The noodles were cooked good.  The ingredients were great.  The broken rice dish special came with 2 kinds of fish cake, egg cake and grilled pork.  Because the food took a while, I did not send it back, when there was a piece of hair on the egg cake (refer to my picture of it and zoom in on the top).  The dish was done perfectly.  The fish sauce was good.  Of course, I didn't eat the extra ingredient, I picked the area with hair and placed it on the table.  After we left the restaurant, we noticed it did not have shredded pork and pork skins.  But the dish was executed perfectly in all the meats, vegetables and rice.  The service was pretty good.  The conversations the staff had were in Cantonese and Vietnamese, so I am guessing the owners are Chinese from Vietnam.  A place to come back to.  The prices were cheap and decent.  I almost forgot, for this place, the food is good, but yes, you have to deal with their creepy restrooms.  I felt their restroom was similar to one that you would find in a hospital basement.

photos.caption: Photo of Da Vang Restaurant - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Pho Tai Nam
Photo of Da Vang Restaurant - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Com Tam Dac Biet

BVxhGHFRvJnatepKIipmMw.text: We came on a Sunday  based on good reviews. I had to get my usual grilled pork with vermicelli noodle bowl.  We were seated in an awkward sitting area right by the kitchen. I know I shouldn't expect top notch dining service at a pho restaurant  But where I was seated the busboy cart full or dirty dishes was 2 cm right behind  me.  What was unpleasant was having my seat near the kitchen door with people goin in and out. What was stomach lurching was when I switched seats I had a view of their kitchen which looked grimy. The man at the front counter was wearing sandals when making drinks. A waiter who was taking out the trash I'm not sure if he washed his hands when he was later handling food.   Our noodle bowl itself was small, but decent. We enjoyed the grilled pork as they were marinated properly. But towards the end the noodles became mushy because of temperature and there wasn't enough  lettuce. The pickled veggies were sad strings.  We left full but unsatisfied.  .. The pro are the prices but you get what you pay for. This place needs some work.  Dining experience: 2 Food 3 Overall 2.5

IReYrO1uAR5u81iwvPLiQg.text: This is my favorite pho place in Phoenix.  It can be a bit of a wait but worth it.  The service is fast.  The prices are cheap... $2.50 for fresh rolls and $6-8 for a bowl of pho.  My favorite dish is the vermicelli bowls with grilled pork and egg roll.

-yjqQfbstffgpqbu_AaKGA.text: Stopped in based on a recommendation from a Vietnamese friend so were excited to try it out. We were greeted and seated right away. We started with the 48B BBQ pork spring rolls and a 75 BBQ pork banh mi sandwich, both which were amazing.  I have another place I go to for banh Mi's and this blew it out of the water. For our entrees my husband ordered the 66D Spicy stir fried beef which was served with sauteed onions over a bed of rice. The dish reminded me of something that you might find in a Chinese restaurant but we both really liked the flavors. I ordered the 38 which is vermicelli with shredded pork, coconut cream, lettuce, and crushed peanut. I was expecting more of a coconut curry style dish but this dish was served with thinly sliced meat and lettuce over wider noodles with a cold thick cream coconut sauce on top. I did not care for this dish, just very strange textures and tastes but my husband ate it for me and I ate his dish. The portions were good size and I think the prices were very reasonable. I look forward to going back and trying the Pho and other menu items on a future visit.

photos.caption: Photo of Da Vang Restaurant - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Rice cake and mung bean desserts
Photo of Da Vang Restaurant - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Coconut cream noodles with chicken
Photo of Da Vang Restaurant - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Spicy beef 68d

qwgDU5Hz-f8xe_Xf07IWTg.text: First time here and the food made me come back for a second visit since I am not locally here in Phoenix. Good service, good food, and overall good experience. Highly recommend this restaurant for authentic Viet food!

MeVPh0zFvK1Ricr05zYS8w.text: The pho broth is on point. It is full of flavor. The egg rolls are crispy. It's not too greasy. Their steamed rice plates have a perfect meat combination. It's great for a quick lunch and great for families.

photos.caption: Photo of Da Vang Restaurant - Phoenix, AZ, United States
Photo of Da Vang Restaurant - Phoenix, AZ, United States
Photo of Da Vang Restaurant - Phoenix, AZ, United States

fWoB5aKxFHhDNAKU1CCrNg.text: Went here for lunch with my half Vietnamese brother and he loved it. He grew up in Phoenix and actually remembered coming here as a child 25 years ago! The service was great and thanks to his helpful Vietnamese ordering skills we were able to try a variety of things that i normally wouldn't consider but found out that i love. Pho was delicious and very reasonably priced. Fried egg rolls were so good as well as an appetizer with rice paper and sugar cane shrimp which i can't remember the name of but I'll never forget those flavors. Have to order the iced coffee for a sweet pick me up after the meal. This isn't your trendy hipster Vietnamese spot, this is a timeless, authentic, Vietnamese cultural experience. Can't wait to go back.

1-HastTkLy_QXLyFqWA7kg.text: I'm going to give this 4 stars now. Let's do the breakdown:   Service: 5 stars. My second time in here was today at about 10am. I walked in and within 15 seconds I was greeted and given a table and menu. I did not feel rushed at all while looking at it, and as soon as I decided I was asked my order. All throughout the meal they were kind and they spoke good English. When I went up to the counter to pay, the cashier was extremely kind and made conversation. They are also open at 8am because people come in for coffee. So if you want Vietnamese for breakfast then go for it!  The Food: 4 stars. The pho I had last time I was not a big fan of at all...tho now I think that might have been because I added in the sauce they gave thinking it was supposed to be added, but without the sauce it would have been better....hey it was my first time ever eating it! Today tho I decided to try the #46, which was steamed rice with plenty of stir fried veggies, seafood of all kinds, and some chicken and meatballs with gravy.  The serving size was one gigantic plate full... I ate until I could eat no more and got a take out box... that was full. In all reality, this would be three decent sized meals. I really enjoyed this meal.... the rice was good texture as well as all the seafood (sometimes seafood, especially squid can be really rubbery) and the gravy just made everything perfect.   The Drink: 5 stars. So yeah.... um they have Vietnamese coffee.... the thing that has me going to every Vietnamese place I can find. I liked it better here than from Pho Thanh. But it still wasn't as good as from Mi Maxim. They did explain to me tho that the bottle of ht water they brought out of water was to pour into the little glass of coffee if it was too strong. I filled the glass up some more with the hot water (mainly just because hot coffee and more of it) and when it was about halfway gone I filled it back up . The coffee is strong and a little sweet.   The Price: 5 stars. #46 was only $5.75 (one of the more expensive meals on the list... most of the Pho is under $5, and the sandwiches are only $3. All deserts are $2. My coffee was $2 (cheapest out of the three places I've been) So it is very very affordable. Especially if you take in account the serving sizes.... You can get a rice dish (most are $5) 2 coffees, 2 orders of spring rolls, and feed two for under $15. That's hard to do at McDonalds!  Overall I will likely be back to this place since it is so cheap and very conveniently located like a quarter mile off of the light rail.

photos.caption: Photo of Da Vang Restaurant - Phoenix, AZ, United States. #46 and a coffee. $5.50 and  $2. Notice how small the normal fork is compared to the plate
Photo of Da Vang Restaurant - Phoenix, AZ, United States. #46

YlqA60tFtFIa7lV0YOixPA.text: Been coming here practically since I was born. Absolutely love this place and their food is incredible. Besides their Pho my all time favorite is the Com Bo Xao.

yHdjzqdczbRn6epYgTgDDQ.text: Da Vang is a little whole in the wall located in a strip mall in an "interesting" part of town. My husband and I stopped in for a late lunch/early dinner at about 4pm on a Saturday. The place was packed! We were seated quickly and our order was taken 2 minutes after that. I already knew what I wanted, so that part was easy. We ordered the spring rolls, I had a medium sized chicken pho and husband had the extra large sized beef/brisket pho with egg noodle.   I'd have to rate the food 6 out of 10. The spring rolls were really good, but they were missing the little crunchies. My pho was hot and steamy, but it didn't have enough chicken. My husbands pho was delivered with vermicelli noodles and not egg noodles like he had ordered. We brought it to the servers attention and he happily corrected it. It's no fun sending food back. Ever see the movie "Waiting"? Yeah. That's why. Anyway...  Total cost for an order of spring rolls, 1 medium Pho, 1 extra large Pho and 2 Pepsi's came out to $19.47.   I will say I noticed the floors were really dirty. When I say really dirty, I mean food, plastic utensils and napkins on the floor dirty. So dirty that I slid on my way to wash my hands in the bathroom. That kind of grossed me out. A little sweeping in between patrons might be a good idea.

photos.caption: Photo of Da Vang Restaurant - Phoenix, AZ, United States
Photo of Da Vang Restaurant - Phoenix, AZ, United States

2yVa3P_qW732TT3vFKzjUg.text: Don't let the outside fool you, this place is BOMB! Came for my farewell work lunch and it was worth it. Authentic Thai food, don't come expecting Pad Thai Americanized food, don't come here. I had noodles with shrimp and veggies and my coworkers had pho and rice noodles with pork. It was savory, flavorful, and rich! Even my lemonade was fresh squeezed... I mean lemon squeezed with sugar and water and ice. I'll definitely be back!

photos.caption: Photo of Da Vang Restaurant - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Noodles with shrimp and vegetables

5LisBMsOFaRz0wbO3kmxhg.text: It's so good delicious for Pho soup anything you choices what kind of meats & seafoods  as you like... and fresh Spring Roll ate it greaty yummy as I  go there once on Sundays...

m4Mi9yYHshtWToYNkae9hg.text: I was first introduced to DaVang's in 2012, by my Vietnamese coworker. It quickly became my favorite Vietnamese restaurant. The service has always been decent and the food amazing.  By the way there is nothing better for the common cold than a hot steaming bowl of chicken pho with extra vegetables.

Gq2e2PgllzjzFZqtGWX2CQ.text: Love this place does the best pho. Customer services hasn't always the Best Buy you bi pass that because the food is so good. Food does always come out Quick though

eocK1G2BN5txuAQf0cEsRQ.text: They feed my family frequently.  Often greets me with familiarity and friendliness.  Great variety of selections of vietnamese food.  I love their:  Bun Bo  Bun Tam Bi Nuoc Dua  Pho Tai Bo Vien  Banh Xeo  Mi Xao Don  Tom Rang Muoi  Goi Cuon  Cha gio  Cari Ga  Hu tieu xao  Canh chua ca thac lac  Mi dac biet kho  Mi hoanh thanh  I can't think of all the food, they have so much! :D   Thanks for feeding my family!!! :D

TLPeHh4D6IVojGmp_A0tCw.text: This is the best Pho so far in the valley! It's very inexpensive as well. Also the spring rolls ,egg rolls and their Bahn No sandwich is delicious. I haven't had anything bad at this place!

tC6Yh7SPzL6fvesBVxijiQ.text: Da Vang is an interesting place. It's unglamorous, it's in an interesting part of town, but damn, is the food fucking fantastic! And cheap as hell.  I came here and ordered the #1, a big bowl of combination pho. I also ordered number 39, which is the classic broken rice dish. Check out my photo submissions to Yelp to see how delicious it fucking looked.  Then I ordered the number 56, which is a barbequed sausage wrapped in grape leaves; it was fucking delicious wrapped in rice paper dipped in fish sauce.  Would return to this place again.

99jxQPLvIMMxGQBbyLFfIQ.text: Our favorite vietnamese restaurant in the valley! This is truly a whole in the wall gem, great reasonably priced food. Try their salted spicy fish, amazing

ooHTOlIbGbtkKuqXiQsFGg.text: Excellent Pho and appetizers! We had the traditional Pho with sliced beef and vegetables, a BBQ spicy pork Vietnamese sandwich and, shrimp wrapped in tofu crisp. All were outstanding. The ingredients were fresh and the banh mi super delicious!

N_drZLPXsYWw6J2TtxrFeQ.text: The food was great and I'll come back but the customer service can be better. It took forever to just get a refill for water and waiters don't acknowledge you when they drop off the food.

_egEEiJ_2nLDNd6OQEnJpg.text: Bomb pho!!!  Broth is amazing!! I would recommend hands down every time. I would eat here everyday.

PMpv-SHZB1aoNswbC2xukw.text: I make it a point to come here whenever I'm in Phoenix! Westcoasters can argue with me about the sanctity of their favorite pho places, but I live in NY and there is a surprisingly slim number of decent pho places here. Da Vang has everything I'm looking for in a bowl of pho: fragrant flavorful broth and quality meat/tripe/omosa. You know it's a good bowl when you don't need to add all the extras! No hoisin or Sriracha needed. Also good here: the spring rolls, banh hoi, and coffee!

tMyySpFkSw3WuccWXGbjYw.text: In town for business and my first order of business was to get some Viet food. Saw the reviews and head straight to this DaVang's from the airport. Had the Pho Da Vang. It was good. Nice depth of flavor and seemed to be made from scratch. You never know anymore, as there are some pretty good instant pho "enhancers". The broth was a little sweet for my taste and for a combination, it seemed to be heavy on the tendon and light on the brisket. Like..no..brisket.   Aside from that, service was quick and friendly. Food was good, I would go there again and probably try a Com Tam dish. I saw one come out of the kitchen and the look reminded me of my time in Vietnam. Check it out.

0kudaqL7iWAyXKZKIrZAbA.text: Not a fan of this place :( The glass of water provided by the waiter had a jelly on the side (see picture). The pho is mediocre, the meat is tough and taste old. The wait staff is using a swatter to kill flies inside the restaurant and that grossed me out while I was eating. When I saw that, I lost my appetite and didn't want to finish the pho. Overall, in my personal opinion is this place is dirty and the restaurant serves low quality food. If you want cheap food go here. This place makes me want to be vegetarian again!
