Photo of Da Vang Restaurant - Phoenix, AZ, United States. The glass has a jelly stuck on the side.

p-KlzkWefGEoVJFchWpH5Q.text: My favorite Vietnamese Restaurant in all Greater Phoenix! I like their pho, rice dishes, egg rolls the deep fried ones, congee the rice in soup form, and their extra off menu items and desserts by the cash registers!  Can't beat the quality and their reasonable price elsewhere.

jyIHj1ARjep-Aj-cySNU-g.text: My favorite asian place to go eat at. The people are nice the food is amazing. Great family own restaurant.

yHn5OAWw7FkzjFNE6C95SA.text: I've been here so many times and I love their foods and service however, I hope they pay more attention to the cleanliness on some of the vegetables that being served.

AobaeUBDc-0JKo5RKnQJLw.text: Beautiful spicy berg noodles soup , my favourite soup in the town , I always come here for Viet food

89FzNdLdu6SYYw9vhPiRMg.text: This place is the most authentic Vietnamese place I've found in AZ. The pho is on point and the iced coffees perfection. So happy to have found this place I'm just sad it took me three years of living in the valley before I could get delicious pho.

SoBsZ4-4mlJsK2t7-je3OQ.text: I've been here twice and It's very, very good food! Fast service and nice staff. The prices are right too! We will be back soon! Working until 8pm, so unfortunately I could only eat there on the weekends.  If the hours were a bit later, we would have had dinner there 4 nights a week.  Thank you!

qxv_iLqLY2jdM1mt2FHWfA.text: Go to spot for Vietnamese food in Phoenix. Fresh spring rolls are always great quality. Pho is usually great. Only downside is sometimes the noodles seem like they've been sitting out for a long time as they don't separate very well in the broth.

NKhw7QuL1vMqDp8ryeUmTQ.text: Wanna good chap eats? This is the place. Simple tasty, fast and reasonable.  Love it!!!!! Grilled pot with vermicelli salad was tasttty!!!

Fw8F3E2lD2DWWTttOccosw.text: My family and I have have been faithful patrons of Da Vang for over 30 years, from the time they only had 1 suite, then expanded to 2 suites, and then 3, and now four.   We have planned a trip for a nice family dinner to Da Vang for serval months, and finallly was able to go there yesterday.   We casually know the family who own this restaurant, but some of their workers leave much to be desired --- particularly the older, short, skinny man who takes the orders. He never ever seems to listen to the specifics of our orders. He does not repeat back to us what we ordered, especially when asked he heard what we just said. SMH.   We ordered several items and one of which was 2 extra large bowls of wonton soups. The wonton fillings were hard and the taste was sour, as though spoiled. The broth was off from what we are used to with their cooking.   We ordered the spring rolls with grilled pork and chicken. The grilled pork was extra dry and tasteless.   This is so unusual for them, or maybe not.   We have come to the conclusion that as their reputation expands and more people are coming in, they are too laxed and banking too much on their popularity, and NOT ENOUGH on the quality of the food and services.   We will not come back. There are just too many options now for good Vietnamese food in the Phoenix metroplex, to waste our money and precious time/energy on subpar food and low-level service.

Dy7dpVvb_TKRF4Min7Y86A.text: I can't believe I haven't reviewed this place before. It's my wife's and I go to place for Vietnamese noodles. This place is always busy, so don't be surprised if you have to wait. The only time I find this place quiet is first thing in the morning when they open; stopped in one day for iced coffee after dropping off the boys to school. Anyways, I am a creature of habit and typically get the Pho (beef ball or beef stew) but sometimes I get #36, the cold noodle with fresh veg, grilled pork and egg roll, and of course an iced coffee. I really enjoy the cold noodle and veg with the hot meat and egg roll. I see many other things that look good, but it's hard to resist the Pho.

oC3ntk2nerT-eP49knbKmA.text: I have been going to this restaurant since I was 10 years old, and I am 20 now. I haven't been able to go as frequently, although this place is the best pho place on the west side! I love how they have improved their service and food quality. It was also a good investment to upgrade the restaurant. This place looks amazing!

photos.caption: Photo of Da Vang Restaurant - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Number 12!

JP5V2RwT3AKAsWBqt5i39A.text: I'm salivating thinking about the Bun with BBQ pork and egg roll, can't write a lot, because I'm going to get take out in about 2 minutes, except why wouldn't you go here?  Vietnamese family kitchen ambiance, ridiculously low priced for lovely quality fresh food.  I'm not sharing one bite of mine tonight, no, no, no.

Uz3YTjhksSutMCzjK9icQQ.text: This is a great spot for some Pho or any other classic bit smear dishes. Love that I'm so close now!

rgCi-zp1Bq6BQA4pi2usEA.text: Went there for lunch with a coworker. It was pretty crowd. We were sat down quickly. My chair was pretty dirty, so I wiped it down with napkins. This place is a hole in the wall, but the pho and rice plates are good.   Love number #41 (BBQ pork with rice); the egg roll; and a soy milk. I am a happy camper. Love the #1 Pho!

ICTld6QF4lTAm0IZBgrtdg.text: I usually go to Pho Thanh but they were closed due to Chinese New Year so I decided to try out this place after seeing that it had 4 stars. When we got there, service was horrible! After waiting 20 min to get seated, took us another 15 min to order our food then another 25 minutes to get our food! We ordered appetizers and it came out after we were halfway done eating. My group ordered pho and we had to ask for spoons 3 different times and anytime I asked for something, they ignored me, looked irritated and walked away. I understand if they are busy but don't treat people that way. I lost my patience with the 4 different people that came to our table. None of them were on the same page. We ordered the extra big bowl of pho and it barely had any meat in it. They might as well call it extra big bowl of noodles. I will never come back here again! It was ridiculous.

l0g8Zfu-zOlcR9u1UaYlFg.text: Im from San Diego and here in Phoenix.  One of our clients recommend this.  We find the staff very friendly.  The food and price are great.

WEwgTm6pwHrm3zOQjgsSuA.text: We've been going to Da Vang for years and I love their food.  You get more food for your money than if you go to fast food and their food is a million times better than any fast food.  I live in North Phoenix and we'll drive there while passing many Vietnamese restaurants on the way.

9jA1Y-UOLx_oH79mhs_0IA.text: The food is amazing. The service is fantastic. Try the 66d. Best ever. I come in so often. Great prices. Super popular and the food is good for you and perfect. If you are considering Vietnamese, DeVangs is a must. If you don't you're really missing out. The pho is to die for.

voZVUDWnr-93jmzjUnm7_Q.text: We came with a group of Yelpers and this place delivers. Get the spring rolls. I don't know which but just get some. They were amazing. The phos were good. Probably the second best I've had in the valley.   The place is popular and deserves it. But just keep in mind that it can get crowded and chaotic. Definitely one of the best pho experiences I've had around here.

y7VsfocYddOKsiTxX4uLEw.text: I can't stop coming here. Hands down my favorite place for Pho. I always order the 1b, and 48b. An extra large bowl of pho, and bbq pork spring roll. I would eat here everyday if I could. Friendly place, fantastic food, and very inexpensive.

photos.caption: Photo of Da Vang Restaurant - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Extra large pho with beef brisket, pork, beef trip, beef tendon, pork meatballs and bbq pork spring roll.
Photo of Da Vang Restaurant - Phoenix, AZ, United States. The number 1b. My favorite.  This always fills up the bottomless pit I call my stomach.

bCtj4MH3DE_-22aUN4hCog.text: 5 stars for a place whose first impression screams, "what health code risks?"    You know you have stumbled onto greatness when you look around and most of the patrons are from the motherland.    Without question, a Vietnamese restaurant's legitimacy is measured by the quality of the ubiquitous pho broth.  Da Vang's has all of the earthy, aromatic, citrusy, salty richness that a pho connoisseur seeks when sitting down to a steamy bowl.  Add the bean sprouts and torn herbs, a squeeze of lime, and some peppers for hotness, and you are reveling in savory satisfaction.     Truth be told I've been here a dozen times, and despite the allure of the rest of the menu, I have ordered the large bowl of pho every single time.

n_514FWN_1Vxk98kJteX_A.text: I came here during my lunch break on Monday.  I walked right in and was seated right away.   I came here to try the vietnamese food because someone recommended it to me.  When it comes to vietnamese food, I love Bun Bo Hue so when I saw it on the menu. I had to try it.  I ordered it. The dish came out. It looks like how I expected except I didn't expect bean sprouts, lemons, basil, etc to come on the side but no big deal. The noodles in the dish was good, it was not under or overcooked. The broth was flavorful, not lots of msg. Some places use so much it's so salty. It was slightly spicy, just the way I like it! I would have like it more if it had more noodles but for about $5, it's not a bad deal. The pork's blood is okay, it's not the best or the worse. It had other meats in there as well like pig's feet. The meat was good. Overall, I would definitely come back to this place to get the Bun Bo Hue. (I don't know any other places in phoenix that would serve this and it's definitely decent)  Service is like any asian place. They just come to get your order and give you your food. You need to grab their attention to get the check or get anything else from them.  This place is very cold inside which was a good thing since it was so hot that day. It's nice and cool. They definitely crank up their AC.   I think the prices are the menu are very affordable and it's worth it.   Be aware that the neighborhood isn't the best either. You just need to be street smarts, driving through it I was like ehhh. Da Vang can also be hard to spot if you don't know what you're looking for. It just blended in through that complex.

1eWn_arKStFj6v74wb2fYg.text: My boyfriend and I come here often. Customer service is average since they do not talk much but the pho is out of this world.

oDX94gK4qlU2vnl2cAnBmg.text: This restaurant is not to far behind Pho Thanh. I think they have better fried egg rolls. And the costumer service is better than Pho thanh. The only thing is pho thanh garnishes the dish better. They give you more garnishments. Also pho thanh uses lime, and Da vang uses lemon. But in my opinion the pho is just as good.

photos.caption: Photo of Da Vang Restaurant - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Pho-to-go
Photo of Da Vang Restaurant - Phoenix, AZ, United States. 1 order of fried egg rolls...better than Pho Thanh I promise.
Photo of Da Vang Restaurant - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Brisket, shrimp, tendon pho. YASS HONEY!

2LDuEBlyqFZZM7e-7JbZ7g.text: I already didn't care for this place, only go when my other place is closed. I will NEVER return to this place as there was a Roach crawling on the floor and wall I almost puked!!!!

aK9ao66bVN8KS2tgOoqUgg.text: We were just introduced to the Jewish tradition of going to an Asian restaurant on Christmas by some friends of ours.  I understand that Chinese is apparently more "traditional" in this sense than Vietnamese, but I can think places far inferior than Da Vang to go to for this purpose.  Da Vang has a LOT more than just Pho (although they have just about every type and permutation of Pho possible), and the menu is chock full of all different kinds of Vietnamese cuisine.  I opted for a Vietnamese fried rice with pork sausage and chicken (which was quite good), and a type of Pho with beef brisket.  I really should have chosen the sliced beef over the brisket as I found the brisket pieces too tough to eat, although the Pho itself had a wonderful taste.  Service was good, prices are super low for the quantity of food, and my wife and I enjoyed our meals.  We'll be back, and we won't wait for Christmas 2012 next time. . .

WuIW4CXasWJM0LrVVUNTgw.text: I love this place but I have recently made the switch to Pho Than down the street. Da Vang's food is delicious. My only negative would be service and consistency. In my opinion their chicken and beef soup is not as good as pho than. Their bahn mi sandwiches blow pho than out of the water. Their egg rolls are very comparable.

Edu1P_K0609ZLevnO1ZGEQ.text: Da Vang is Da Bomb!  Hot soup for comfort food, and really nicer on the wallet.  Don't forget to try the Thai tea and soy milk!  Always happy at da vang!

photos.caption: Photo of Da Vang Restaurant - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Beef brisket w rice noodles!  Yum!

e-xvmCY16zEgIPGFWTRj1A.text: Always have great food!!! It's even better on Sunday! I have been coming here for YEARS and they never disappoint! 2B is what I always get. They make the best pho! Would highly recommend

9lE_wBCx2PMYdMYgxRhKkQ.text: DA VANG = DELICIOUS!   First time dining here and we both ordered the Pho Tai and young coconuts to drink/eat. I do wish people would inform the staff if they don't want the vegetables when eating pho. It breaks my heart watching plates of fresh basil, jalapenos, limes and sprouts being tossed left and right at all pho restaurants. I guess we need to learn to appreciate our vegetables more in America! Anyways, this place is an awesome hole in the wall with the best pho broth I recall consuming! I almost don't even want to tell you how good this place is because it was already busy enough this fine tuesday. Get some!

URhHHJf_E5FSpUlYAyMHyA.text: This is also very good Pho.  I think I still prefer Song Lynn over this but this is still really great Pho.  This place is slightly cheaper than Song Lynn which is great but same problem I had, the bowl is too small.  I wasn't even asked if I wanted a large bowl or not so when it came out I was disappointed by the portion size.    Taste wise, great Pho.  Price wise, perfect.  Portion size, disappointing.  Get the large bowl if you're getting Pho.

mkkLR9Bou_-nqnTJwCMUBw.text: Always love the smell as I sit and wait for order Togo inside the restaurant. Night time is not as busy so you don't have to wait long. The wait is worth it!

xbsXOvidLuIdjY3FgoNqLA.text: It's all about the broth. The food is great. Bonus: the staff =  attractive asian men. ha ha

K9v7918YJ49teVwjMKtOYA.text: AWESOME!! If you don't love this place we can not be friends... It is delicious and authentic!!  I recommend the Pho Thai, it's what I always get. The service was extremely fast and people who work there were amazing as well, very friendly. You can take out, pick up or dine in whatever you choose to do you will not be disappointed. Very reasonably priced as well. I can't wait to go back to Da Vang!!

photos.caption: Photo of Da Vang Restaurant - Phoenix, AZ, United States. WHAT under $5!!! Omg so coming back, like tomorrow!
Photo of Da Vang Restaurant - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Empty bowl... Thought about ordering another it was so good!
Photo of Da Vang Restaurant - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Menu

t-nuzd1rQYMS19QccJVBdw.text: This restaurant is definitely authentic Vietnamese food. Very reasonable prices and portions. I come here often.

4kqFQwbWbbR9sLgLee787g.text: Very great prices for what you get! We got the BBQ chicken sandwich, spring rolls, fried rolls, and a beef & brisket soup. We wish they had peanut sauce for the spring rolls. Also, the soup didn't have as many veggies as the menu seemed to say it had.   We will for sure be back though!

LLm2EC4w1Cog6d6yB6MzAA.text: I think this is the #1 PHO RESTAURANT IN PHOENIX in my opinion.  I come here at least 3 times a month (more if my coworker persuades me to go get some pho) and always leave satisfied.    The price and portion is great!! A variety of pho ranging from $4.75 - $6/7.  If you're really hungry, you can ask for a large.    My typical order is #1 with meatballs, spring rolls, and a thai tea.  That comes out to about $10.

A5tmF-pV1WKlyAgKFk6wIQ.text: First time visiting this place, which is highly recommended by a pho expert I know.  This place had been in business for over 30 years and there is a reason why....their food speaks for itself.  The broth is amazing. Got a 2 go order,  super fast...I was in luck arriving when it wasn't too packed. Try this place out.

Qn7x2eBc86gUbhKKFaLvqA.text: This place seems to be pitted against Pho Thanh quite often. I'll have to give it to Da Vang, but it's a NARROW, like a hipster's trouser leg narrow, win. One of the best Vietnamese sandwiches I've ever had, and I'm from California, the place Asian food snobs usually say has the best of the best of anything Asian. The bread, baked on site, was airy and soft. Too often a Vietnamese sandwich shreds up the roof of my mouth, but not this one. I opted for the bbq pork, because I eat way too much chicken at home, and it was juicy and well flavored. I will say the pho broth is a little better at Pho Thanh, but DV's is no slouch.  Portions were not a problem. And really, just look at their menu prices! I'm not quite sure how many pounds of food per dollar people expect. You'll spend about the same here as you would at McDonald's for a much more enjoyable meal.  Sure the outside looks a little rough, but the interior isn't bad at all. Someone did complain the ac was too cold, but how else are you supposed to eat pho in the middle of a desert summer?

oFUIQafulDED6N9mGiVyOw.text: If I could call this place heaven, I would. Every time I head for phoenix, I make sure I visit this place. Been going here for years and it hasn't disappointed me once. Their food is delicious and CHEAP. So far to me they are the cheapest Vietnamese food around. Here's what I can get for about 40 dollars and that's with 3 people. An appitizer, pho for each person, drinks, and also dessert! That's a lot of food for a fantastic price. Will always go here until I basically die.

_2YIIa4_wylMhCmPUJXTew.text: Nasty cockroach infestation. Food was not good quality. The food is cheap but still isn't worth getting sick.

HqmX-v5kVi7KVYY9i4UyxQ.text: Stopped by on a weekend for dinner.  The restaurant is in a tiny strip center on N 19th ave south of Camelback.  As we walked in we stood around for a while trying to figure out if we should sit or wait to be seated,  Later I realized that the regulars just walk in hold their hand up with the # of people and get seated.  We went with the traditional beef pho which was very bland.  The kiddo thought the broth had a seafood flavor and I may agree.  We are pho snobs and this was a disappointment.  Hubby had the crunchy noodles with chicken that turn soft with the sauce it comes with.  That was pretty good.  The other kid and I had the pepper beef which was really oily and I thought the menu said spicy but it wasn't.  It was really thin beef with green pepper chunks and sliced onion.  It also came with white rice which seemed old, it was dry.  We also tried to start with crunchy egg rolls and spring rolls, but on this night service was pretty quick so it all came out together.  The service was efficient, and the price was really nice but flavor was lacking, at least for us.  As a family, we gave it a c+ and not coming back.

3AjfMnUiGxOOT3L40vFrTg.text: Best Pho in Phx by far! the secret is.the broth; so flavorful! the. 1a is bomb w/a side of spring rolls and Vietnamese ice coffe! bueno!!!

Ky3F6kf8iw3L9YHibL4XDA.text: My husband and I along with family and friends came here today for lunch and the food is great, but service wasn't so much. I ordered the large rice noodle with beef stew, my husband had the big bowl of pho and we split an order of spring rolls. His food came out within 10 minutes and mine took about another 15 minutes. I didn't mind because I was enjoying the time with family and friends. After our meal was out I placed an order of fried rice to go and thought it would be done and ready by the time we were all done and eating. That didn't happen. I waited 20 minutes AFTER we finished our meal and paid.   Overall food was great, but service wasn't. Next time I'll order the to go food when I'm ordering my meal.

GGx2ftpzkegvywwxOJnABA.text: There are only so many ways one can describe the glistening, slightly sweet, luscious, and deeply satisfying broth at Da Vang. What more can be said on the matter? I shall try, but will most certainly fall well short.  I know it takes hours of first roasting, then gentle simmering of beef bones, oxtails, flank steak, charred onion, charred ginger and spices to get that complex, layered, richly verdant bowl of delight. Steam slowly rising off its surface as you lower the vegetable accoutrements into its golden embrace.  Could you go somewhere else for pho? Sure.  Are there better bowls of pho out there? I'm sure there are.  But we're in Phoenix, so why would you?  Best pho I've had in Phoenix. Period.  Cheers, Until then, get the beers in...

NdE8h7Q2wBYyuUUbJFUDnA.text: I work in midtown phoenix. Da Vang is the perfect lunch get away. Quick service, spacious parking and the most important, unbeatable delicious food. My Summer favorite is their No.37 - Bun with ground shrimp and grilled pork, topped with fish sauce. Will come back again, again and again again...

photos.caption: Photo of Da Vang Restaurant - Phoenix, AZ, United States. No 37, Bun with ground shrimp and grilled pork

vOK9CY7_DuSntn9pxO-lAw.text: There are a couple of things I forgot to mention--my bad since I was rushing my review.  Sorry!  The beef in my Pho was very hard to chew, and they aren't very generous with the fresh greens and other veggies that go in the Pho--no cilantro either. :( Three days later we went up the street to my favorite place to make a comparison---Da Vang is a solid 3 stars but  no where close to 4 or higher.

Hr4F8PQJdUHn9NC3KwROZQ.text: Bravo!   I live by two, yes TWO kick-ass Vietnamese restaurants! Pho Thanh and Da Vang are by far the best places in Phoenix (that I've been to so far) to enjoy a hearty bowl of delicious pho! If you love pho and haven't eaten here, you're doing yourself a disservice. I had the Da Vang (basically the special that's everywhere else - cuts of beef, cartilage and tripe) and I ordered some Vietnamese meatballs to put in.Every bite of that pho had me sayinh, "Mmm!" My friend and I also ordered the egg rolls and a Banh Mi. Yes, we ate like kings. I've had a better Banh Mi, but Da Vang has some of the best Vietnamese egg rolls that I've ever had for sure...and their fish sauce was perfecto! If you always order spring rolls, take a break and try the egg rolls, and don't forget to eat them properly (wrap in lettuce with other veggies served and dip in fish sauce)!   Good gawd, that food was good...  Da Vang is an amazing Vietnamese dive with a friendly staff and wonderful food. It totally surpasses my standards for good pho. Picking between here and Pho Thanh is going to begin to become a tough choice, and I would have to say that they are definitely on even playing fields when it comes to pho. Try both!

photos.caption: Photo of Da Vang Restaurant - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Bill for two people and a bunch of food.
Photo of Da Vang Restaurant - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Da Vang Pho

XqeD1XMe26XJWzVrMYF2ww.text: Don't let the modest surroundings fool you. The food and service never disappoints!  If you want a great is Vietnamese experience this it! The best of photos in Phoenix.

Hu_Il3DW8a6bQG644yT4Ag.text: My wife and I came here a lot when we were both working downtown. Great Pho and noodle dishes cheap and good!

xaAjV2D-FvnK_DFeGbpHug.text: A good place like this can get away with a short description such at this; Its really good and the price is right. You should really check it out.
